sequence: This is one of my favorite films , ever . The story is just so fantastic and the characters are so wonderful that it makes me wonder why I don't like it more. It is a great time travel adventure with some very good acting. You can watch this film on YouTube or you could rent it in the big box cinema for around £20. I didn't pay too much attention at first, then saw it when I got home - but I still haven't watched it all the way through because I'm going to be spending a long while in prison (probably next year).

OK , so I loved Rachael Ray before , but now , I ADORE her ! How innovative . I really wanted to see more of her in the sequel , but I didn't think it would be such a good idea to do so ! A few months back I got an email from my brother, asking if I would be interested in getting some of his stuff in DVD format. My reply was simple "yes" and went on to list several things that he wanted me to look forward to seeing in the box set (which he had recently given to me as a gift).

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time . Top 20. There is a scene where we are asked to name 10 actors, and it goes like this: 1. Jean Seberg 2. Michael Caine 3. James Coburn 4. Robert Duvall 5. Arnold Schwarzenegger 6. Tom Selleck 7. George Clooney 8. Sean Connery 9. Steve Martin 10. John Travolta 11. Mark Strong 12. David Carradine 13. Clint Eastwood 14. Tim Robbins 15. Peter Ostrum 16. Jeff Bridges 17. John Lithgow 18.

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling actors. I was really surprised to find that i was totally wrong. The movie centres around Bartely or B who has been rejected from all of his colleges- the actor who play B is very natural and makes his character seem real- and decides to create a pretend school so his parents stop harassing him. However loads of people see his fake website and join. Feeling their sorrows B can't turn them away much to the chagrin of his best mate.

Garlin outdoes himself as writer-director-actor in his indie production about a big guy ( Garlin ) wandering around Chicago with an old friend (Maggie Gyllenhaal ). I guess I've heard of the original film. I didn't want to buy it, so I waited until the DVD was released last week and decided to see if this new one would live up to its own predecessor's high standards. The first thing I noticed was that all the characters on this movie seemed to have no personality other than what they were wearing when they acted.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it.The director of the film doesn't know if he's ever been to France before or if he even speaks French. And I don't want to say this because I'd probably be laughed out of town, but this film might have saved the life of President Reagan who was a total dud in that film when he first appeared on the screen. He didn't do anything except stare at the wall and make weird noises. Oh wait...that was just him talking.

Before I talk about the ending of this film I will talk about the plot . Some dude named Geraldine (Jane Fonda) takes her daughter, Mary (Kirsty MacColl), off to college. Mary comes back and finds out that Geraldine has been keeping Mary's parents from their wedding. She then marries Geraldine for $10,000. That is a hell of a lot of money for a 12-year-old girl! I really wanted to like this movie until I saw it. In fact, I thought it would be the funniest thing ever. But it was NOT funny.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC. I've been looking for it ever since. It was haunting: visual, textural, sensual. This movie took me somewhere like a dream and I didn't care where. I will never forget the curtain blowing in the breeze. I still remember the way it made me tilt my head. I remember my facial expression when I saw it. I didn't know what had happened when the movie was over, but I find life is that way. It didn't bother me.

NOBODY ( 1999 ) is a fantastic piece of Japanese noir . It 's about three salarymen who get in over their heads, and then make a big deal out of it by getting married. There is also an intriguing plot line that involves a young woman who goes missing. The only problem with this flick is that even if you're willing to accept the premise, there is really no way you're going to watch it.It starts with the main hero (Tsuyoshi Tsuchimikado ), a young man whose father died of cancer when he was young.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne 's `` For The Flag '' by the Czech master director Karel Reisner . It is, perhaps, a strange movie, in that it gives you an impression of this kind of film which would not seem possible in our times. As we see it, the real world of the 19th century (in the days of industrial society) is no longer the place where man lives. A new type of civilization has arisen, one in which man takes his destiny in his own hands, and which can now be seen to take full advantage of the technological developments of its age.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from ! For £2.50 it could have been a very good film ! Not bad at all, if you can remember what it was like before the invention of the cinema and the internet. When I saw this film I wanted to put my head through the wall - not just because of the fact that I loved the original, but because I'm a huge fan of 80s horror/sci-fi and this is an absolute rip-off of the '80s series.

The very few reviews I could find online of Barnens ö really do not do it justice. I read them all before ordering the DVD, but for some reason I ordered it anyway. I regretted it almost immediately, but the order had already gone through so I couldn't cancel it. I'm very glad now that I couldn't. It's an extraordinary movie.I won't give a synopsis of the plot, because other reviewers have already done that. But I will say that I don't understand comments that it's bleak, shocking, weird, clinical, depressing or pornographic.

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave . I 'm happy with that , as i never really enjoyed scream and would never give this movie a chance . If you're in need of some good old fashioned, gory thrills then you may like this film. The story is kind of silly and it has a somewhat low budget. What's the point of making a film if it doesn't have value? The special effects are just ridiculous. One scene where a man crawls out of an aquarium is so over the top that it actually makes me laugh.

This movie was great. It had everything a true action fan could want. Plenty of people getting shot and/or maimed, minimal romance involving sex, a hero that can be identified with, violence at many intervals instead of pointless plot storing up just one scene at the end, and villains that are just asking for it. Bronson appears to be at his lowest level of tolerancy in this film and it shows. Ed Lauter makes a great cop and was seamlessly worked into Bronson's plot without stealing his spotlight. The movie doesn't involve a plot so boring or over-consuming that you watch this film once and never again.

If you haven't seen this film, do it. Its a genremix as i've never seen another. Some very surreal scenes, some hilarious funny stuff, a film noir felling, musical numbers with a swing, sex scenes (The 2nd best played orgasm on Film, bested only by Sally), a pitch of Orson Welles blended together into a work of art. As an work of art it hasn't to be logical at the end, at least not logical for everybody ;-). I owned an tv copy on VHS but loaned it to an ex-girlfriend and now i can't get it back.

I saw this film at a small screening . Even though it had a low budget , the creative direction, editing and special effects blew my mind . It was an action movie about a soldier trying to rescue a captured Nazi leader from the US. I could not believe that they could have gotten away with using this type of material on such a high profile film . It is pretty much impossible to describe in words what made this film so bad. It started off good but then became worse than bad by the second act.This is a terrible film.The first half was very suspenseful and entertaining as the story unfolded.

This is one of my favourite Disney films . It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation, and nothing more. The voice acting is top quality and the effects are beautiful. In this film you get a real sense of depth to the story and the characters. I also like that the story is presented in a fun way and not as an uninspired plot. All in all it is a great animated film with lots of charm. I bought this DVD when it came out on video store shelves because I really wanted to see "Tangled".

When the Romulans come , they will not be bearing gifts ; no , they bring with them war - a whole fleet of ships to fight against us. You are going to have to excuse this horrible film, I just can't find anything positive to say. I really don't know why people are so obsessed with this film. Even though it isn't "bad", it is definitely one of the least original films on the list. There is absolutely no reason for any human being to watch this movie. It is boring, slow paced, cliched and stupid.

I don't usually comment on films since I am in the movie distribution business, but I have to say that this is one of my favorite films of all time. The acting is fantastic and the script is even better. There were no cheesy speeches or exploitation of handicapped people to try and make this movie more "Hollywood". James McAvoy is such an outstanding actor, I could not look away from him if I tried. I was impressed with Steven Robertson as well. I cannot believe this is his first real film.

I don't see that much wrong with this movie. Granted, the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti and Maria Callas, but they can certainly carry a tune. Burt Bacharach and Hal David are talented songwriters and I happen to love their songs, especially "The World Is A Circle", "The Things That I Will Not Miss", and "Question Me An Answer". Some people claim that Hermes Pan's choreography is ghastly and that the snowy mountain sets look as if they were made of plastic; I disagree on both counts.

I had the chance to watch Blind Spot in Barcelona and I enjoyed it tremendously. I thought it to be one of the most captivating movies that I'd seen for a long time. One of the best points of the film was to meet new fresh faces and great actors behind them in unexpectedly and brilliantly filmed great locations. The three heroes share a chemistry on screen that runs all across the film making it so thrilling. They are set on outstanding landscapes spotted by such an original eye (the DOP's work is just great) that makes you feel like you are discovering them for the first time.

If you expect that this movie is full of action and grabbing you from the start then do n't watch it. I had to look away several times just to make sure that my wife wasn't going to get in the way. I saw this movie expecting it to be something really interesting and thought that perhaps they were doing something innovative. I can't believe I wasted so much money on this. I wanted to like it because I think it's a lot of fun, but even though I enjoyed watching it I found it to be an absolute waste of time and money.

The Ali G show was really something amazing - he was so stupid wannabe rapper , but no one he met could tell him the truth , so he kept lying about it. I remember seeing his music video on MTV and loved every second . "Gangsta's Paradise" stars T.I., Ab-Soul, Big Sean, Juicy J, and Raekwon as young gang members who end up in "Paradise," a drug-ridden gated community that is populated by high-school students. The film is loosely based on Michael Chiklis ' book of the same name, although the plot is far removed from the author's novel.

I do n't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch.So I popped in the DVD, checked out the reviews and thought I'd give it a try. What a joke. The guy who plays him has no acting chops and his accent is absolutely horrible. He really shouldn't even be cast in movies. He should have been on an episode of Lorne Michaels show. That guy should be fired from his job because he's just not funny. I hate actors like that! Okay, so it's a pretty good movie.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing? Never heard of them!! But this is one of the funniest comedies I have run across. It should win the Putz Puller Prize for Parody. The absurd starts with Dr. Jeykl snorting his powder and turning into a sex fiend.He is pursued by libido driven nurse early in the movie in one of the funniest scenes of the movie. Pay attention to the hospital PA system in the background; rather like the system in MASH. The final scene with Hyde accepting the award has had me laughing for years.

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . Here, we see a much younger Paul Kersey , but one who is no longer as young. He is much thinner, and wears his hair short. He also appears to have a different sense of humor. I mean, if this Paul Kersey was the same person he would have been in the first movie, I don't think it would be that funny. The only "funny" thing about the movie is that it's set in Los Angeles (not New York ).

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I 've seen in a very long time. This film has everything going for it and yet fails on almost every single level. The story is so bad, you'd think someone made it up as an after thought. There's no real reason to watch this movie unless you're one of the lucky few who already has some experience with horror films. That doesn't mean that you can't have a good laugh. However, once you get there, you'll be wondering why you even bothered watching any movies at all.

This is possibly one of my favorite films. It tells the tale of a girl named Gerda (Chelsea Hobbs) who lost her mother at a very young age, so has been bought up by her father. She falls in love with the bell boy named Kai. However, on her birthday the snow queen (Bridget Fonda) comes the the hotel which her father owns and kidnaps Kai. Gurda then goes after Kai, and follows him through the four seasons in an attempt to rescue him.I thought that this was an excellent adaption of the story with great performances from all the cast.

i love this film!! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is talking about and means to do. it kept me laughing for the duration. duration of the film, the next day, and beyond. i think this film is not one to watch if you mainly care about the plot and character development. this film is pretty much only for the generation that will understand it. there are lots of things you just know being brought up in that generation that you wouldn't if you were say 40. i think Sacha barren Cohen was Very and i do mean Very good.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink. It's not until the credits roll that we get to know this film is actually about Buddy Holly. There are only a handful of shots in the whole film where you might reasonably presume it's about him. The other thing you might reasonably have assumed is that the movie was written by Andy Dick. What I wanted to do from the beginning was to create a piece of music that wouldn't go away no matter what I tried.

After seeing The Aristocats: Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound, I decided to buy it since both of these films were childhood favourites.The Aristocats is a classic, definitely. It might not be a five-star classic, but it is a fun film and makes a good evening's entertainment. It is somewhat a light refreshment from the darker, more serious Disney classics. The Aristocats tries to be a light-hearted musical comedy, and I think it just about succeeds.The storyline doesn't really make much sense and I don't think the plot is particularly strong, but it is certainly not weak.

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious. Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull master, the bad guy, would always be vowing to kill Max with some insane cackling. The writing is the best. I was glued to the set when this would come on when I was younger. If they came out with a DVD of all the episodes they made I would be forced to buy it. This and a Conan the Barbarian cartoon are the ones I miss the most from childhood. I think these cartoons are the most unappreciated out of all the great cartoons.

So it's not an award winner, so what? Have you ever wanted to see a film that was just silly? "The Villain" and this one could top the list.My husband says that "Jekyll and Hyde Together Again" is one of those movies that if "you've been there and done that" you'll think this spoof on the 80's cocaine culture is a riot. I think the whole film is just fun. Nothing is sacred; hospitals, plastic surgery, Howard Hughes.... There are ongoing gags that you have to watch for to appreciate.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II was good. Unfortunately it was not as good as one might think. The only thing bad I can say about this film is that it wasn't well-written, acted, edited, or directed. Maybe you can get away with writing a few good lines and a few bad ones too, but you need to be more than mediocre to stand out amongst other films. Not all of the characters were funny; in fact, most of the jokes were very predictable and did little to make me laugh.

This is Christmas time! A nativity in terms of rebirth, or at least this is what can be hoped regarding the Italian cinema. It was something like 30-40 years that the Italian cinema didn't craft an art piece of this size. This is an absolute contemporary film that can be also regarded at the same level of quality as the Italian masterpieces of the past, needless to quote any name. And finally this is also a big production for Italian standards of the time. In this movie there is a rare balance of different elements, all of them understandable and enjoyable at different levels of fruition.

The writers of lost have outdone themselves . Season two 's finale is even more heartbreaking and intense than the previous episode. One of the greatest disappointments to a horror movie fan in the last decade has been A Nightmare on Elm Street. I really can't say I liked it (I guess I do), but it was still one of the finest horror films ever made. The first two seasons of this film were very poorly made, but they are just as much a masterpiece in retrospect. But for all of their flaws, they are also quite funny.

An interesting look at the immigrant experience, told as a fable with some very weird imagery.I got drawn to this movie because it tells of immigrants from Sicily who traveled to America. I imagine much the same as my Grandfather did at that time. Travelling in steerage to provide ballast for the ships, I cannot imagine it was very comfortable, as shown in this film.Laws restricting immigrants existed. I would guess that these laws were more strict on those who came from the Mediterranean and Africa. Immigrants had to be free from contagious diseases or hereditary infirmities.

By convincing the Prime Minister to back the totally unsuitable Ali G as a candidate for Staines in the local authority elections, he managed to win his old seat. At least he didn't lose an election. He's also got some talent. This movie sucks. It was so bad that I could see no way this would become a feature film. The director doesn't understand how to make a film entertaining and entertaining is what good movies do.The plot is so bad it's hard not to think that there must be another one of those "haunted house" type ghost stories being played out all over town.

The Aristocats is really quite charming , and is rated far too low on IMDb . The songs are n't all that good and they just don't work as stand out hits. They seem to come from a bunch of different studios and composers and some of them may not even be familiar to the songwriter. For those of you trying to understand what exactly was going on inside the mind of George Carlin, here's an idea: A man goes into the woods for the winter and decides to become a bear - in the forest, of course.

I 'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci 's films . Most of his 80s gore films had their moments of awesomeness but they are usually in short supply when it comes to horror. In this case I actually thought it was pretty decent. This is one of those rare movies that should be seen by anyone interested in the genre. It has been two weeks and the only thing more painful than waiting for a DVD to arrive is being unable to sit down, eat dinner, watch some television, etc...and then get up and go about my daily business.

Fantastic Chaplin movie with many memorable moments as Charlie joins the army to fight in WW 1.At first he goes along with the war but then finds out the real reason for it is because the government of the U.S. is stealing money from the German government so they can build a wall around Germany to protect it. This film is very short. You have to go through a few scenes to really understand how horrible this movie is. There is no drama or comedy at all, and even if you did manage to catch some laughs during the movie, it wasn't enough to make up for the awful plot.

This movie is truly a classic 80s movie ! A must have in any '80s ' movie collection ! Gunslinger Girl is absolutely gorgeous and the plot is quite deep. The characters were very interesting and at the end of this movie all of them had their own stories to tell. There was never a dull moment. The only thing I can say is that you will have a hard time taking your eyes off the screen. You won't like it. I'd give this one 5 stars but it's about as good as watching "The Godfather" over and over and over!

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie . I am not saying this lightly . I watched it with my kids on Christmas night and we had a good time watching it . We got a little scared at some parts. However , I still can't believe that this is the highest rated movie in cinema history ! Well , let's see how it was in real life !The story begins with a very poor man (Milo) getting into a dispute with his boss (Ivan). His boss decides that he has to do whatever he wants to make him look as bad as possible.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS...Hmm.... Only that this was one of the best TV series ever assembled!! You have actors of all ages, The actors that are somewhat known and that time forgot. Everyone playing their part to exact perfection! These shows always have some type of moral story to them which most of the time (if not all the time) is very true! You can feel that the man whose voice is dubbed over the credits and in the beginning and ending believes what he is saying wholeheartedly!

Anyone who has seen Ali G before , should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G: Reborn'. It doesn't take long to realize this movie was put together by an amnesiac in his 20s who has never made a film. The premise is fairly original and seems like it could work. I hate to be the one to blame but this movie was terrible, if you love Ali G...don't even waste your time with this horrible movie. This guy needs to get his head checked out at least 5 times a day.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly (1936-1959) is a tour de force for Gary Busey. The movie's highlights are Busey's stage performances where he plays guitar and sings Holly songs. He brings such energy to the performances that Holly's own filmed performances almost pale in comparison. Busey's infectious toothy grin lights up the screen, he creates a totally believable and winning personality and his Oscar nomination for best actor was well deserved.The film follows Holly's career from growing up in Lubbock, Texas, to stardom and New York and his untimely death in a plane crash.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson's work, and for about as long as I've known his name, I've also looked for this movie. I tried looking for this movie all over California for over four years. this past summer i took a trip to Europe, one of my missions on this trip was to at least see this movie. long story short, I bought it and watched it in France! I was blown away, it completely made my trip and i finally feel content that i have seen Luc Besson's first work.

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere, strikes him down dead, and keeps driving. The rest of the film is spent discovering who hit him, why he was hit, and what consequences this murder will have on the rest of the village. Separate Lies is a very British movie indeed. I'm not saying that hit-and-run car accidents are a particularly British phenomenon, but the way everyone reacts to this tragedy is very British. Tom Wilkinson plays James Manning, a hard-working, respectable citizen with a "stiff-upper-lip" attitude towards tragedy.

These critics need to find a new job ! ! ! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY , not an urban legend . If you have ever read about this movie, or seen the previews, you know it is pretty much a knockoff of something else (or just plain "the same"), and I think they did their best to imitate the look and feel of another movie. The fact that the characters all look exactly alike makes this even harder to like. This is my worst experience with a movie. From what I can see here are two sets of story elements.

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it. That would be fine if the film were a travelogue, but as a dramatic exercise in cinematic artistry, that is not good enough. The theme of inter-species respect and co-operation ventures timidly into the forbidden world of inter-species love, but its approach is stereotypical, indicating a lack of understanding of the behavior motives of either species. As with many films, one always wonders what could have been achieved by a more innovative director and a more creative screenwriter. Alas, we probably will never know.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something, and who appreciate a farce that is clever enough for you to take it seriously, this movie will surprise you. It is not a 'whodunit' for people who can't aren't able to follow the verbal exchange of our hero, Professor Dexter Cornell (Dennis Quaid).Cornell teaches in Southern California, near the tar pits. He has not published a novel in four years, his wife is divorcing him, he drinks a bit much, and is blessed or cursed with caustic wit, which he freely dispenses to his students.

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.T Dutchess and the kittens love music.They have to practice the piano everyday.But the butler named Edgar tries to kidnap Dutchess and her kittens he tries to make them sleep. But he fails. Them Dutchess meets a cat named Thomas O Maily. Thomas falls in love with Dutchess. The cats break into song. With the song everybody wants to be a cat. Thomas gets to love music like the other cats. Thomas and Dutchess really like each other.I loved this movie and i like the cats to!

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect father, Louis Kahn, dead since 1974. The film builds slowly, but perfectly, and what starts out as a seemingly lost fortysomething's identity crisis unfolds into a beautiful tale with much deeper meaning with regard to the importance of love, loss, family and perhaps more importantly, our life's work.I had never heard of Louis Kahn prior to this film, although I was vaguely familiar with some of his work.

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply great film. I was looking forward to this movie for so many reasons. The story itself is simple, with lots of action and no big twist whatsoever. However, my excitement waned as I became more and more engrossed in the characters and their relationship. As the plot developed, it seemed like every second of the film went by in a dream-like state. It was difficult to tell if the characters were dreaming, but even if they weren't, it didn't help matters.

Valeria , an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and self loathing. She spends her days with her mother and father but never interacts with them except on the occasional birthday party which she does not participate in. One day she gets out of work early to visit friends in the neighboring country and arrives home to discover her house destroyed by a fire. The first thought is that she must have suffered from a panic attack and it is only when she goes to bed did she realize something had happened.

If we could have `` Separate Tables , '' why not `` Separate Lies . `` This becomes somewhat involved, as it is not clear that you can write such a thing in one pass. This film is horrible. I have no words for the level of incompetence this film has. All the characters are awful and all the plot points are completely unbelievable. In the movie they show clips of an actual terrorist attack on the US. It makes no sense how they would even go to such a large city without being able to get hold of their own guns and kill many innocent people.

As I have said before , I am NOT a fan of Tweety . He 's just so aggravating I couldn't stand watching him.I was expecting something a little bit more entertaining and it turned out to be one of those movies where you wait for the end. This movie has been compared to "Twilight Zone" but I think it is much better because it was not afraid to push the genre envelope. My guess is that some of the other reviews are from people who didn't see the movie or don't remember what they were like when they saw it.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency. Putney Swope is on the board for no other reason than the fact that he is black, and the agency needs a "token" on the board. Swope is ignoring the meeting, reading Jet magazine at the big table, and everybody is ignoring Swope... Suddenly, the CEO croaks on the spot. No time is wasted. A janitor is called to haul off the corpse, and the board immediately and unceremoniously tackles the business of electing a new CEO.

This is one of Chaplin's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more mature United Artists features. More opulent than the Mutual films, it continues Chaplin's quest for perfecting his comic expression. Most people forget that the film is actually a dream that Charlie has while awaiting being sent off to the front.There is plenty of slapstick via the Limburger cheese being used to gas the enemy, and Chaplin's foray into enemy territory dressed as a tree.By this stage in this career, the great man had become so immersed in filmic expression that his films give the impression of making themselves.

Enchanting. The best time to see this movie is sometime when unhappy or sad. It's all just so cute, all, even the way that white bear loves the Queen in secret and gets Her in the end, also the achievement the two young actors of Gerda and Kai gave. It's music is also very nice. The two of us will always be one combined with sad piano tones in some places gives a very touching result and if one watches both parts at once, he'll see the Snow Queen is not so bad.

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback, and if anyone is confused about her past (like how did she end up in the same hospital Hurley was in) then you should know that despited Libby dying in season 2, the character will be explored more in season 3 and we will get answers to questions surrounding her.BTW, great episode. It had a really great cliffhanger and some interesting questions...like what happened to Eko and Lock and what about the four toe statue?I cannot wait till season 3, Lost just rules!!!

A great movie. The movie was even better then the commercials put on. And believe it or not it was very very inspirational. I really think anyone who walks out of the movie at the end will be inspired one way or another.It was kinda corny at the very beginning, but quickly picks up. I laughed. I laughed very hard on some parts. The acting is basically above average, nothing special, but better then average. I can safely say it was the second funniest movie to come out this summer (1st funniest being CLERKS II).

In the first transformation scene, what is the music? I've heard it was "The Greeks Don't Get No Freeks". Is that right? I really liked that sound. I also liked the "Hyde's Got Nothing to Hide" in the final scenes. Truly a doper movie, but with many laughs and puns, sight gags, and slapstick. Madam Woo-Woo's place was reminiscent of some places I have visited myself. Ivy Venus has appeared in some other stuff that is truly amazing. She looks much different in the movie we're talking about, but her maturity didn't hurt her a bit.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel,I have to say out of all the shows that I've seen that ADV released,this one is one of the best shows of all time. I had to see it again,and that's when I got my chance. I bought the entire box set of this series at Best Buy for my 20th Birthday. And I got to enjoy it,and see more of the episodes that I missed on Action Channel,and the same 3 episodes that I've seen.

If you like who-dun-its, you will like this film, considered the best Italian detective story (giallo), Fulci has done.It's not Mickey Spillane for sure. There are scenes designed to disturb anyone.Many would be offended by a local beauty trying to seduce a 12-year-old boy. She was joking, but she was naked nonetheless, and he would have jumped at the chance to jump her bones. She also tries to tempt the local priest.Young boys are turning up missing, and there are several interesting suspects. You have to watch carefully to discover the killer. Can you?

At one time `Buddy Cop' movies ruled the box office. It seemed that every summer flocks of Beverly Hills Cop wannabes descended on our nation's theaters. Not any more. Lately the gusher has dried to barely a trickle. The drought has eased a bit recently with the release of Showtime, a movie that is a genuinely funny and consistently entertaining example of the genre.Mitch Preston is a dedicated cop. He's not a Dirty Harry type by any means. He's just incredibly focused professional who's completely intolerant of anything that gets in the way of the performance of his dutieslike, say, a T.V.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time. Top 20 of my lifetime. I laughed more than I have since Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, and cried more than I have since I saw The Notebook. If you are looking for a touching movie without the sappy edge...this is the one. It is real and powerful. See it and you won't regret it. I was reluctant at first and I only watched it because I had to do a school project about speech disabilities. But this movie is so much more than that.

I usually give horror films around 6/10, but this one caught my eye. House of Wax was by far the best horror film I have seen... Even better than the Amityville Horror.Paris Hilton was quite good in this and I must say, has a good future ahead. Her death scene was probably the coolest. I'll just say how she dies...She gets a giant pole right between her eyes and they close-ups on and everything. Gory, eh? Brian Van Holt was very good as both the killers, Bo and Vincent (Vincent had the long hair).

"Showtime" is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro (Meet the Parents,A Bronx Tale) and Eddie Murphy (Shrek, Dr. Dolittle). The story is this: In the beginning of the movie detective Mitch (Robert DeNiro) and another detective go into a tv store trying to bust some criminals. When the cops arrive, Tray(Eddie Murphy)a cop, tries to arrest Mitch not knowing he's a cop. During this scene loads of funny things happen which catch the eye of tv producer Chase Ritz.

This is a brilliant film. The story starts off in Romania,where Billy Crystal stars as an agent who can talk anybody into doing anything. There is a really funny scene here, where Crystal is a child, and talks his father, who is a rabbi into eating pork (you filmophiles may know that this is a parody of Crystal's religion). He is mainly a talent scout, and he's trying to find a suitable villain for his latest movie. After finding out that the whole film has a terrible crew, he accidently falls into a small river.

The Simpsons of course started off with Christmas special "Simpson's Roasting On An Open Fire" which had basic drawings and not laugh out loud jokes, but this episode has probably the first laugh out loud joke in it and from here the show just gets better and better. This episode centers around Bart who in this episode swaps on a test from Martin and gets into a school for the highly gifted, this leading to Bart mending his friendship with his Dad and losing all of his mates. The Episode is very humorous and shows what was to become the greatest show ever to come out.

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few . The wise can see the wisdom hidden within the show and they will not miss the film. I was so disappointed in the story lines that were told in this movie but it was all good to be true! It's easy to look back at this movie and go, "OK, so here we go," but I'd rather take a moment to talk about this movie for its faults instead.The music is awful. I mean, honestly, how would you come up with such an uninspired sound bite as "Carry On"?

`` D.O.A '' is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish . Dennis Quaid is at his best in this movie as he makes a rather pathetic effort to show off his acting ability. I do find it odd that there was so much debate about the "cure" (I'm going to go out on a limb and guess that the film's title was not chosen to be offensive). While many of the people who saw the movie will probably have been cured by now, for most of them the experience was extremely painful and they can't quite look forward to the next night.

I've commented once on this Chucky great, but I had to do it again to say some things about the film, when I first saw it in a great balcony in a great theater. The film was a lot of fun in the theater and my first Chucky film ever in a theater, and that was a special moment for me, because I cherish Chucky. The other horror villains are referenced with GREAT COOLNESS!!! And the gore was shockingly great! The scene where the gay kid gets nailed by the truck was amazingly cheerful!

When the trailer for Accepted first came up , many people began to get excited about seeing it ... really, what more could you expect? I don't blame them; this movie was one of the biggest disappointments from the last decade. I have never seen a film so poorly conceived and executed with such an inordinate amount of effort (and talent) put into it. The story is totally unbelievable. It has little to no logic or plausibility. The dialogue sounds like it was cobbled together off-the-top of a hat. The acting is bad, the writing is worse and the script is simply horrible.

In this era when almost everything makes it on to DVD (I'm expecting to see the My Mother the Car collection any day now) this film has been unfairly neglected. There are innumerable stupid comedies from the 60's as well as many other eras that have received at least a cursory DVD treatment. This one wasn't even released on VHS to my knowledge, despite the talents involved in the making (Arthur Hiller, Eli Wallach, Anne Jackson, Murray Shisgal (notable later for co-writing Tootsie), even Dustin Hoffman in his debut).

This is a well directed Columbo episode, with also some good character but the story just doesn't really know to interest enough and doesn't appear as well layered and constructed as was often the case with a Columbo movie. This also goes for the killer's plot to kill his uncle. It's quite simple and doesn't seem as well thought out. Perhaps this movie didn't really took itself serious enough, since the atmosphere of the movie is mostly light. At least when compared to different Columbo movies.For instance the movie features quite a large amount of comical relief, mostly coming from the Columbo character himself.

No real plot , no character development , no Scorcese-level direction , but seriously , were you really expecting any? I am a huge fans of horror flicks. Most of them are so stupid, it's hard to tell if they were meant to be serious or just plain funny (or both) but most of them still do the job. With that being said, I must say that I don't think this film is one of those. I can understand why some people would like it, but others may find it offensive.

I had heard of John Garfield , but , did n't know him . I loved this movie . I saw the previews before i rented it and i was amazed . It was my first experience with movies on VHS , so that was a pleasant surprise. So , here comes the problem , there is not much to say about this movie . I thought it was pretty interesting , but most of the action sequences were too slow and boring. In fact , all the time i spent on it was wasted. The whole thing just made me lose interest .

This interesting film noir features three very good performances : Sanders , Patrick , and Blackmer . The scenes between Sanders and Blackmer are quite good, and the story line is intriguing.The only thing missing for me at this time was some music in the film, as I felt it was too slow. A lot has been said by critics about this movie. Many have described it as boring, hard to watch, stupid, silly, or just plain lame. I'll admit that it's all true. However, I can give a positive point of view: The acting was excellent.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary. I knew it was about an ex-Viet Nam POW in Laos who escaped, but I didn't know much else. In reality, I wasn't expecting too much. Oh what a surprise! The story of this man's life is very interesting in itself, but what sets this film apart from other biography-type docs is that Dieter himself tells most of the story himself. Dieter is very comfortable in front of the camera. His personality really shines. He tells his story about his life growing up in Germany during WWII and the hardships.

1969 was the year. New York City was the place. Putney Swoope was the second Robert Downey film to achieve some recognition. The first was Chaffed Elbows (1966). Putney Swoope achieved a much wider release. Pound (1970) and Greasers Palace (1972) were even more profane and obnoxious. Those 2 films were mean spirited to the point that they actually stalled the Prince's feature film career for several years.The subject at hand is Putney Swoope. And it is a mad farce/satire that has to be seen to be believed. I'm not going to go through the plot here.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast! After seeing sneak peaks for BOOGEYMAN (Horrible! 3/10) and Amityville Remake (so-so 6/10) I enjoyed this a lot more! As seen in the trailer, one knock I had was believing that a whole town could be "forgotten" but this is a cheesy popcorn horror movie so I accept it for what it is.My only major complaint is I assumed Paris Hilton would touch wax or get dipped etc. and moan "that's hot" but they didn't do that (how could they resist???

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918. In fact, it is now more available with two other medium sized silent Chaplin features (A DOG'S LIFE, and THE PILGRIM) that Chaplin re-released in the 1950s. In it's day SHOULDER ARMS was a big hit because of it's humor in uniform approach. It still is very funny (Chaplin in disguise as a tree, spying on the Germans, is so ridiculous it's hysterical), but it suffers from being set in it's own age.

I never thought I'd say this about a biopic, but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (especially concerning Kenji Miyazawa's emotions) and too little on the literal occurrences in his life--by the end, I'm not sure if he dies (he's supposed to), or if his sister finally dies (she's supposed to), or if the director spent a little too much time on the Galactic Railroad (that's an inside joke, in case you missed it--Miyazawa wrote a children's book called Night on the Galactic Railroad).

These days , you rarely come by a kid 's show that does not involve 1 ) a preteen/teen pop-culture obsession; 2) heavy-duty teen drama; or 3) some kind of juvenile delinquency. This one was all three plus it was just plain "too cool to be true. "What really stood out for me about this show is that the creators made it look so easy in comparison to TV shows with more serious stories and themes. It could have been a great sitcom but unfortunately, it ended up as a very disappointing movie.

Oh I remember watching this show at 4:00 p.m. during my junior high days. It was not a pleasant experience because I remember watching it when I made my homework.Still, the show caught my attention when Alex displayed her special powers and dealt with the typical junior high problems.But the show wasn't all about adventures and special powers; it was more of an educational effort for a younger audience in order to get more interested in school and biology overall.The lead actress (can't remember her name and I'm too lazy to copy and paste from the main details) delivered a fantastic performance.

I will admit , I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film , and after about 5 minutes of it I was hooked.The plot of the film centers around a small group of men who spend an entire year traveling the world, attempting to become the perfect man. In order to be accepted, they attempt to become the very best. The problem? There is nobody on Earth better than them. There is not a single good word about this film, but let's at least try to describe what makes this film really bad!

This is one of the best sequels around and a very good movie too even there were some mistakes but they did not spoil anything. When I first watched this movie on VHS from my childhood, I thought "this is the worst film i have ever seen". The story was like nothing i'd ever seen or heard about.The characters were just plain awful; the acting was almost non-existent and the plot lacked any kind of consistency. To add insult to injury, it didn't help that the movie was only two hours long.

To say the truth, I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor. Folks may not agree, but he makes equally good performances in bad and good movies. I haven't seen a movie with Penelope Crus before, so I was anxious to see whether she is a good actress. So, here's what I think:The movie is good (I haven't read the novel, however). Some moments were really thrilling and... unexpected. Altogether you'll find the plot pretty simple.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci 's reputation as a director . Too often he 's done terrible stuff, with characters that simply don't do what they 're supposed to be doing, and then it becomes a soap opera. The film I saw is not even remotely good in any way shape or form. Wish I'd never seen the original "Lucio Fulci" but I know I did. I guess I liked the movie because of the great Italian actors (Eddy Arrighi, Paolo Dicaprio, Franco Nero).

WTF ! ! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending ? ? The Notebook was good ... just wish it wasn't such a poor movie ! . It felt like the director wanted to write a bad book, but couldn't because the characters didn't have enough words to fill the pages. This movie is basically one long nightmare of a movie with no redeeming features and absolutely nothing that can be called suspenseful. It starts out with an evil killer stalking a young girl named Kelly (played by Jessica Alba), and after he kills her, she finds herself possessed by him.

Chucky 's back ... and it 's about time ! This time , with the help of Jennifer Tilly and Paul Newman, this baddie finally gets the "good guys" to be able to defeat him. This film was awful. I was really hoping that there would be something different from the usual Hollywood horror flicks, but no. The acting was uninspired and in some cases even flat. The gore wasn't too bad, but the overall look and feel wasn't as dark and realistic as it should have been.

I hope , from his seat on Heaven 's comedic throne , Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this movie. There's no humor at all (there isn't any humor in this film) and it's obvious the filmmakers were attempting to make one up. I've never thought of making up my own scenes, but what the hell did the writer think would work here? It is a terrible film. If you're looking for a "Spike Milligan" spoof, you may be out of luck. He doesn't really have a big role in this movie.

I ca n't get this flick off my brain . It 's definitely totally different than anything that 's out there.It's not like "The Devil Rides Out", where the devil is a big bad guy and has his own rules , he can't go to hell (unless you want to be in it, but that's not the main reason). What I'm trying to get at is, why does anyone think they could make this kind of film? Why would anyone think that people would buy this stuff ? It's so stupidly bad!

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce, direct, finance and/or star in their own films who might otherwise not have been able to? Is that a good thing? This film does not answer the latter question either way, but it does appear that without Curb, Jeff Garlin would not have been able to make I Want Someone to Eat Cheese With. Like most new producers/directors, Jeff Garlin's independent piece heaves a heavily more sensitive sigh than the vehicle he is primarily known for (Curb).

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time . Excellent original music , clever , heady ... it's just about impossible not to laugh at this film. The movie starts out on a train, which is completely deserted, and we meet a bunch of guys who have gone for a joy ride through the night, and as they get near the train they find something that has been left in the darkness. It took me forever to see this movie. I was so disappointed when I finally saw it. The acting sucks. They are all too happy to make the story their little side show.

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply. I've been looking for this movie on DVD for a while and VHS for years. One can get all sorts of movies on line...old movies, new movies... but it all targets a particular group. This movie is very nostalgic for many. I'm not sure why I can't get a copy. Maybe if enough people will write in, the copyright holder will get a clue. It's about time for this to happen. Yes, it's date, but so is The Wizard of OZ.

I 've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months ( maybe longer but not much ) and it is one of the best things i have ever seen... I was so impressed with the acting, direction, and just how funny this show really is that i started planning to watch every episode. And then it hit me "Wait a minute, there's a good show out there". I'm a huge fan of all-time classics like "The Twilight Zone", "Farscape" and "Star Trek: TNG", and this is by far and away the WORST series of ALL time.

I loved this film , which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival . In March 2005 I got a copy of the DVD from the library. I was very disappointed to discover that the movie was made in 2001. I had never heard of Stanley Kubrick until the book appeared and I didn't think that there were any new insights to be discovered here. Well, you get what you pay for! The story begins when an English woman named Elisha Hunt (Caitlin Krim) goes to New York to write a book about her travels in India and Nepal.

Jack, Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond. His traumatic past experience before sailing to the island is disclosed through flashbacks. Sayid plots a plan with Jack to surprise "The Others" in case Michael is double-crossing the group. John Locke convinces Desmond to invade the hatch, which is protected by Mr. Eko, and not press the button of the computer to see what will happen.This episode is one of the best of the Second Season. Unfortunately, we lovers of "Lost" can see the lack of respect the producers of this stunning series have with the fans.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon . I loved the film, and I wanted it to be a real thing, but alas...it never was. It is now considered to be a classic (or infamous if you prefer).The story is so stupid and unbelievable that it has become an article of faith amongst many "film buffs". This movie is only in its first half, which isn't even close to the entire film. First of all, the acting is ridiculous.

OK, so this film may not have won any Oscars, but it is not a bad film. The original "D.O.A." is undoubtedly a better film, but that does not mean this film is bad.The film stars Dennis Quaid in one of his early roles, when he was first becoming really famous, after "The Right Stuff" made him a star, and a very lovely looking Meg Ryan, when she was still now quite famous.This is more of an "update" of the 1950 film, rather than a remake, since the setting is different and the characters too, are different.

I always liked this movie , I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it : ) I even had some friends who wanted to see it before they moved to a city. I was going to give this movie a 4.5 out of 5 stars but I really want to give this one a 7, because if the script and acting is correct then there is no reason why the actor could never do good work again.The director does his job well in keeping the pace of the movie fast. But the problem is that the scriptwriter did not know what to write.

What's the point of this messages if not to discuss and share thoughts about the next season... Here is my forecast: 1. The hatch was indeed blown, but somehow everybody inside survived. Buts lets see about that. 2. The episode at the end with the tent is an observation team monitoring the tracking device installed on Desmonds boat by Penny. Now that the magnetic shield around the island was lifted, the signal was picked up by the observation station and they are going to send a rescue mission. 3.

The revelation here is Lana Turner 's dancing ability . Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub dancer, nobody would ever guess what she was up to in her private life. One of my favorite films of the 1980's, I've always been a little disappointed that it only got a limited release and has not been picked up by Criterion for DVD release. I'm so glad they finally gave it a chance. There isn't anything like it or similar on the market now, at least not in the form it was intended.

We loved this movie because it was so entertaining and off beat -- Not your usual Hollywood drivel.My husband had a similar reaction to the film, when I showed him it after viewing it with our son. He's only been watching films since the '80's, so we never really "got it". I didn't like this movie. Some people will like it and others will dislike it. I am not going to waste my time trying to explain why I felt that way. I just wanted to let you know where I am coming from.

Hey all you jive hustlers, you stone foxes, you mean dudes. Watch out cause Slaughter is back in town! If you are looking for a bad-ass, funky film to watch some night, this is just right. 'Slaughter' is back and trying to take it easy n' relax after his adventures down in Mexico. But if you are a narrow-minded gangster like 'Duncan', you are bound to seek revenge. Why, I don't know. Was 'Hoffo' in the first one his brother or what? Any who.

Can the intensity of a husband 's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime , despite being ordered to do so by his superior? It was a good movie, but it was just a piece of crap. This would be a bad movie if it had an interesting story and the actors played their roles like they were real people. There are numerous instances in the movie where you could tell the director or producers had no idea who this guy was before they cast him. He looks like he walks on water, which means he must be someone's son.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol' says it all. I used to watch this movie all the time as a kid; and even then I sensed the silliness of it all. The low budget, horrible acting and lame script was ever apparent back then. I watched it again yesterday and just couldn't stop laughing. It's so bad it's actually good lol. Like another reviewer said, it doesn't take itself seriously. There's no way one could look at this movie and say that the makers did so.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary . I knew it was about a gay couple and their son, but after the first 10 minutes of the movie i didn't care that much anymore. This documentary is a good story, but the production value is poor. The actors were fine, but very bland. There are far too many shots of people smoking cigarettes and drinking coffee while sitting on stools and chairs. They could have gotten better lighting. I had read some reviews which said this film showed the real face of homophobia and transphobia in our society.

This is what movies should aspire to. Funny without being totally stupid, a little sexy without having every female in the cast show her boobs, biting without resorting to 'f-bombs' every line. I've been seeing Justin Long pop up in a lot of films over the past few years, I figured with the right role he could break out. (Mac commercials not withstanding.) This film just might put him on a fast track to the A list. The rest of the cast also did their jobs perfectly, this is an excellent little film with a nice message.

The cover of the VHS says it all: "Without doubt, the most powerful movie of its kind since the Texas Chainsaw Massacre". I'm a huge fan of 70's and 80's slashers and I have to say, I agree 100 %. The characters are believable, the actors have an excellent charm (especially George Kennedy as the forest-ranger). There's the twisted atmosphere, that only TCM has, an astounding soundtrack to reflect the emotions and the filming locations that are the most beautiful in the history of horror.

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film! Hat's off to Ben Daniels, Lavinia Currier and the great Honore de Balzac. This captivating film conveys the passion experienced by the characters so effortlessly and yet so powerfully. I watched it mesmerized, almost holding my breath as the story developed towards its inexorable end. This film's execution was almost flawless: simple and pure, it plays with our hearts, guiding us in understanding the strange platonic, absolute thus possessive bond between two creatures not meant to be part of each other's world.

I was n't expecting a great deal from this film , so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it. The premise of the film is simple enough : there is a man who can turn into any animal he likes, and then he meets his love interest (who happens to be some kind of kangaroo). After they have been together for 3 months, she decides she wants to go back to the land where she grew up, so he gives her a golden opportunity to do exactly that. But what happens next makes you sit back and think 'how could this ever have come to pass'?

it's a great movie for the whole family. i don't think many people have seen it cause i ask people and they say that they've never heard of it before. Sophie Heyman is my aunt's sister in law. my favorite scene is the whole movie i can't even pick a favorite scene. my favorite character is Hubert because he is a funny yet smart dog. if someone hasn't seen it they are missing out on a great adventure. i've only seen it cause my aunt is related to Sophie and she got a copy from her.

Accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and PC ads. The movie is about Bartelby .B. Gaines a guy who has rejected from all the colleges he has applied for so decides to make his own college and invites all the other people who did not make it, problem is hundreds of people sign up to his school. The movie is hilarious and I was lucky enough to buy it for $5.00 at a sale and I have always watched it since. Overall this movie is a must watch for fans of all comedy as it is funny, witty and just a good movie all up.

Fantastic Chaplin movie with many memorable moments as Charlie joins the army to fight in WW 1.At first he goes to boot camp, where he has to learn how to handle his rifle and how to walk in line. That's a really funny scene as the tramp is not used to keeping his feet straight!Next thing you know he's in France in a trench. Hilarious scenes here include a starving Charlie eating the cheese of a mousetrap and reading a letter from home over someone's shoulder.When Charlie goes to sleep he finds his bunker all flooded and his roommate snoring.

There 's no point in comparing this with the original series . Though different in look and content , both are extremely entertaining shows. In fact, they're the only shows I've ever really been bored by. As much as I enjoyed the original series, The Adventures of Doody was just not that good. Sure, we were treated to some clever plot twists (most of them made more sense once they got a little further into the story), but for the most part, it just wasn't all that great.

After learning that her sister Susan is contemplating divorce , Kate decides to travel to the distraught woman 's remote home village, where she hopes to convince her to give in to her desires. What was wrong with those guys? They weren't smart enough to get a job after they graduated. They were always complaining about how hard it was to pay back student loans. The acting was atrocious, the plot was too shallow and stupid. The characterizations were not good. I could not think of a single positive thing to say about this flick. This movie was just plain ugly.

This show really is the Broadway American Idol. It has singing, the British Guy, A guy who's sometimes nice, and a super-nice woman.Of course it is different because there is a sing-off, and there's dancing and some acting (we just don't see some of the acting). I gave this show a 7 because there are a couple tweaks that I know a lot of people (including me)would make if they were working for the show. The first thing that really needs to be changed is the judges deciding who goes home.

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once , about ten years ago . It's the story of one of the greatest explorers of the last century whose ship was lost in the Indian Ocean. He found an island that he named Reunion and then sailed there to find out if it was habitable.It was a long, arduous voyage with some problems, as you know, but the whole thing can be viewed as a great adventure tale. There's lots of wonderful scenes shot on location on Reunion , so if you want to get a chance to see this movie, go do it!

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times . I taped it in about 1987 when it was still new. The only reason why I did not watch it with my children was that they couldn't understand some of the dialog. I'm so glad I watched it with my kids. This film is simply a waste of money, time and effort to be put into making such a bad movie. It has zero originality or story line. If you want to make any sort of comment about this film please don't do it here.

"D.O.A" is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish. Dennis Quaid is at his caustic best; and Quaid is sadly one of the most underused talents in Hollywood. His then beau Meg Ryan also appears with him, but as is usually the case, doesn't really make much of an impact. The film is stylishly directed throughout, drawing on a number of influences to capture its 'seamy' feel. Would you credit that it's actually directed by two people? The answer is no. The whole thing is superbly slick, from its innovative camerawork to its unabashed use of black and white photography.

Like some people here , I love/loved Stingers ! In Norway it got aired a lot later . That also explains why they made the movie in the style of an old Norwegian television series . I am so embarrassed for that movie. I saw it with my mom at the cinema and she told me that she thought it was great. Well, I thought it was terrible. It had nothing to do with the story. Everything was off. The plot was unbelievable. The acting was bad. There was not one ounce of emotion in the scene.

Like a few people I know, I came in late on 'Stingers'; not until 2000. Three years later there is no way I'd miss an episode. The show really is that good and has, for a better word, maintained its integrity, unlike 'Blue Heelers', for example. The crime is the thing; personal lives are there but only wheeled out when affecting an investigation! When Gary Sweet was brought in, some fans seemed worried, but he's really fitted in well, which didn't surprise me.

What an excellent movie, made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it so serendipitously, channel surfing on a nice frozen day in North Texas. Kathy Bates is at her usual best leading a cast of very normal and human costar characters thru one of the most wonderful feel good movies we've ever seen. Why this movie wasn't given the attention it deserved on it's release in 2002 is difficult to understand. Why it was head and shoulders above so many of the boring pieces of trash released with greater fanfare and attention is evident in the viewing.

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature . Faulkner mostly wrote about life on the West Coast in California. It has been written that if you don't write about Los Angeles, then you haven't done well. But it's important to remember that Faulkner lived there from 1925 to 1943. When I was 10 years old, I was given the opportunity to read this book by my grandmother. As an adult, I still cannot understand how this book was possibly good enough for a child (who didn't really know what a novel was at that point).

Charles Chaplin's 'Shoulder Arms' of 1918 was his longest film to date, though, at just over 45 minutes in length, it was not quite a feature film. With World War One just drawing to a close, many popular entertainers of the time were doing their part to inspire their native troops, and Chaplin was no exception. And so the lovable Tramp went to war! The film begins with the Tramp in training, and the character is hilariously inept at even the simplest military drills, including marching and gun-slinging, much to the disgust of his drill sergeant.

Like a few people I know , I came in late on 'Stingers ' ; not until 2000 . Three of the five stars were for the actors, but there was nothing to recommend them except that they were funny. This is the movie that has become my all time worst film ever.I've seen hundreds of bad movies here at this site and I still can't decide which one is the WORST. In this case, I have two answers. First, it's very poorly done, so badly executed that the actors look as if they just came out of a wet paper bag.

This version of "The Lost Horizon" is actually not a bad film at all. I think the problem is people like to pick on musicals, especially those made in the 70s. I saw the film upon its original release in 1973 (I was ten) and really enjoyed it, the music especially. (Burt Bacharach has always been a favorite.) The story is fun, the acting is good, and technically it's excellent. Sure, there are one or two rather silly dance numbers, but hey, you can't win 'em all.

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families and live in an isolated community in Africa. Soon after the arrival, a number of people become mysteriously ill, including the women who own this house. They all die within a matter of days of one another. In spite of the fact that local authorities are not able to trace these bodies, the police are unable to come up with any other lead. What is known is that all the deaths were caused by something unknown.The only thing we have for sure is that there are many mysteries left to uncover.

Spike Milligan's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years, and 2002's 'Puckoon' is sadly no exception. The novel, set in 1924, concerns the partitioning of Ireland, in particular its effects on a solitary community ( the 'Puckoon' of the title ). Due to a colossal blunder, half the village is now in Northern Ireland, the other half is in the Republic. Locals go to the toilets at the bottom of their gardens to find a barbed wire fence blocking their path. Drinkers crowd like sardines into a corner of the pub to enjoy a cheaper pint.

Made at the height of the Black Power movement , this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope ( Arnold Johnson ) in a bad light. It doesn't work. Even if it were true, we're talking about an entire generation of kids who had no idea what the Black Power movement was about or how they were being mistreated by the police. When I first read the description for this film, I really didn't think it would do as poorly as it did. The only reason that I made it to the theater was because I wanted to watch something else.

This is a wonderful movie, and I still love it! It just so magical and it is fun for the whole family! I recommend it to people of all ages. I promise you will not be disappointed! The characters are always so engaging, so real, you will just love them! The story of Gerda and Kai falling in love will really amaze you and put that little spark of magic into your life.I don't see how anyone would care if the movie matched the book, I mean the movie was amazing! I haven't even read the book, and guess what?

Some days ago , in Rome , a young Romanian man with criminal precedents assaulted and tortured to death a small girl who was passing through the train station by her own will. At that time , he had committed a number of other similar crimes, mostly involving children. In the last few years we have seen numerous cases where innocent people have been hurt and killed because they looked "suspicious" or because they went to the wrong place or happened to be on the wrong time . In those cases no explanation was offered for what could have caused the violence, nor was even an attempt made to make it stop .

I 've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark . I've done my best with what little information I have found. This show is just not worth watching. First off it isn't funny. The characters are all shallow, unrealistic, and predictable. Second of all you'll see that the show is trying to do too much. You can't really give more than 3 minutes of your viewing time to each episode. That being said this show is one of those shows that you will love but still don't know why you should watch it.

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage in places. This is true, and is the biggest flaw of this film. However, it isn't so often, or so bad, that one shouldn't see this video. If you are a Black Sabbath fan, you have to see this. Aside from having seen Black Sabbath in the Sevnties and early Eighties, I saw them in 2005 or 2006 when they also headlined OZZfest just like in this video.

I do n't see that much wrong with this movie . Granted , the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti's original voice, but there is something to enjoy in these characters, even if the actual storyline of the movie is a bit lacking . In the end, the movie just made me cry. I was very disappointed when I watched it. The main character had such a unique personality. It was nice to get to know her a little bit and hear her voice. Unfortunately, I think the story wasn't that good. I didn't understand the motives of certain characters.

When `` Madame '' decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble . The snobbish Butler Edgar who was in charge of making sure the film looked good didn't get a single script revision, and that left the director with only a handful of lines. This movie also has some of the most annoying performances I've ever heard in a film. This is another one of those films that has nothing interesting or memorable about it. A couple of other directors have come up with better horror movies (e.g. Evil Dead), but even they could have made a decent movie out of this.

That this film flopped at the box office, and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today, is a great pity - yet somehow rather appropriate. The commercial suicide the Monkees committed by making this film is mirrored by the metaphorical suicide they commit on-screen. To destroy so brutally their carefully constructed image as a wholesome American alternative to the Beatles is courageous to the point of rashness, as is the admission of being no more than pawns in the entertainment industry, trapped (in the movie, literally) in their own artificiality.

Let me clarify that. This is not a "good movie", but I am so glad it is out there, I am so glad I saw it, and for the role that it plays in my DVD collection, it is sublime. It is the ultimate PG-13 romp, it is college as we imagine it will be when we're freshmen in high school, it requires so much suspension of disbelief that it may as well be taking place on Mars. It is so wholesome that even when it tries to be dirty it wouldn't make your grandmother uncomfortable.

Wow, What a wonderful film-making! Mr. Im has done it, again!His last work, ChunHayang (2000) was a great film, but this one is even greater. Selected as an official feature film in the Canne Festival for the second time in a two-year row, this 66 years old director is getting better and better at what he is making of with a Korean culture.Simply, Chihwaseon is about a great Korean painter, '(Ohwon) JANG, Seung-Up' who was considered as a prodigy in the late Nineteenth century.

The movie does n't take itself seriously , and if you follow its lead you 're going to have a good time ! The only problem is it's pretty boring. I'm not saying that the characters in the movie were bad but they had nothing going for them. One of the best lines comes when one of his buddies asks, "Where did we all get our noses?". If you haven't yet seen this then stop reading this review. Go right now. No, I don't recommend it to anyone who hasn't watched it already.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you 'll find it. This is a very poorly made, low quality film.I do not understand how the producers of this film were allowed to produce and market it. The characters just don't seem to make any sense. I really don't know what all the writers had in mind when they created this script. It seems to be written on the fly. We never see any evidence of the character's personality. There are several instances of the characters saying things that make no sense.

I first saw The Victim ( aka Out Of Contention ) well over 25 years ago when I was very young, and thought the movie had potential. It's one of those films that you just sort of have to give a shot because you don't want to spoil the experience for yourself. This film took me about an hour to watch before I gave it a pass. First of all, if you didn't go into this expecting any sort of high school drama, you should really check your expectations at the door.

Well , I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning . I am not an expert, and there are many things i have trouble comprehending. But I do understand this film.The story begins when a young student goes to live with his parents after their death. When he finds out that his best friend is also living at the school he becomes very attached to him as well. The main character has a big crush on him. He gets mad at her if she shows up late.

When I first saw this movie,I also expected "our boys" to be cute,and more like an extended version of the TV show. I didn't "get it" back then. But,years later,at a party YEARS later,at a 70s' type PAR-TAY,where certain substances had been smoked,inhaled,and with plenty of tequila,"HEAD" was on late at night.We watched it,and finally realized what "HEAD" was all about. It spoofed their own show,as shown in one song that called themselves,"a manufactured image".

Was very fortunate to see the movie Hari Om at The Bermuda International Film Festival . It was the opening evening for the festival and it was a great way to end the night. I would highly recommend visiting with a friend or two if you happen to be in the area. It's an intimate film so make sure you have lots of blankets and plenty of drinks on hand.You're not supposed to talk about the movie but some people do and the conversation inevitably leads up to the fact that one of the women is having a baby.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre . Set in 1970, it deals with a couple who are forced to move to Mexico by their parents. When one of them (who may or may not be a cop) goes missing, the cops are on the trail. I saw this yesterday and couldn't believe what I was seeing. It seemed so ridiculous that it had to be real. However, I am a huge fan of Giorgio Moroder and have seen him do a lot of stuff.

The last film by underrated director Alberto De Martino ("The Antichrist", "The Killer is on the Phone") is a truly suspenseful but incomprehensibly neglected giallo, containing pretty much all the trademarks that makes this Italian horror sub genre so magnificent and addictive to the fans. There are some very disturbing themes (child abuse, phony priests), loads of creepy moments, plot twists left & right, outstanding music and  last but not least  a handful of really sadistic murder scenes! Especially the opening sequence, which is some kind of prologue, is a powerful piece of horror!

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good . I have to admit Ms Cruz' performance was not for me. She did a wonderful job and I enjoyed the movie, just not the song . Maybe I should listen to the music that came out after the movie ! This is the worst film I have ever seen! It is just stupid. It starts off with the main character saying something along the lines "there is a lot of people who say they want to do something interesting in life". And then the screen goes black with no music playing.

I just thought I would add another observation , here . While there are a couple of visual sub-references , it all came off as the writers were trying to create some sort of fantasy .
