When a new character joins the cast, or when another baddie has to be killed off, you can usually tell just by his voice what he is going to say next.

`` Back in the Day '' is an interesting , but flawed effort . Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper, a small time drug dealer who becomes the hero of one of the movie's better scenes. It's not the most original character in the movie, and I feel he gets more out of it than any real person could. I actually liked this film. However, what really bothered me are the many inaccuracies and blatant attempts to make the story into a "comic book." The characters are obviously created with the sole intent to appear as they do on the screen (except for the lead).

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an "against the system" type of movie and attitude. It is an excellent portrayal of the "system" in question and how ridiculous it truly is. The funny parts in the movie are in fact funny because they speak the truth about the world around us. Anyone who finds this movie to be unrealistic is simply denying the self evident truths about life. And that is to learn what you enjoy. That is what college should be about..I come to find that a comment must have at least 10 lines.

When the new Outer Limits first started , the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging . As the series began to grow in popularity , the writers became increasingly pessimistic about the show's quality. The main reason being, that it was becoming obvious that people weren't going to buy it when it was presented as such a grandiose production. This story is so incredibly lame that even the actors don't laugh.I thought the plot was really stupid, I didn't know the characters would act that way, I just assumed they must be some of the dumbest people around.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up, many people began to get excited about seeing it... really excited. Who could blame them, it looked like fun. But that's exactly the thing. People went into Accepted looking for a good movie, but if you think about it, Accepted isn't the type of film destined to be a good movie. It's meant to be a film that pleases its crowd without too much effort being given. That being said, for those of you who expected a great film, you need to think about what could be made of a comedy like this one.

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character . The humour is funny, but not in the usual way. If you want a good laugh, go to see 'Caddyshack' instead. Well, I watched this movie because I was trying to learn more about Ali G. I don't think anyone who has seen it will find it funny, but people who have seen it will like it much better. The story is very thin. It is made up mainly of stereotypes, such as an alcoholic father (Gethard) and an uptight teacher (Owen Wilson).

This is a good film, no doubt, but with some odd aspects. Without spoiling anything it takes place in 3 places only- a Sicilian farm, the boat,and Ellis Island New York. All shots are close up so we never see a broad sweep of anything. I wonder if this was to save money? No street scenes anywhere, and we don't even see the boat except in close ups. And the music...what on earth was going on with playing Nina Simone songs, decades before they were out?

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline . I go to the movies more than anything so I thought this movie would be enjoyable. After watching it, I'm not so sure about that anymore.The acting is all pretty okay but I can't tell why the plot doesn't make much sense at all. It makes me wonder if the writers didn't watch the show and decided to give it another try. If you are a fan of the original Star Wars Trilogy, then you may love this movie.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius . And this movie is good ! Although the film does n't nearly reach the amount of magic that I had expected. But still, I thought it would be worth at least some watching. However, I can't say I enjoyed the entire movie.The story was very short and did not make me care for the characters. This may be the worst "film" i have ever watched! First there is a huge opening scene in a cave with a man holding a baby to his chest as he talks about making love.

This film is an impressionistic, poetic take on the immigrant experience, a reflective look at the turmoil and fear which might be associated with emigrating. These are aspects not often considered in movies about emigration to America in particular and to to any country more generally and the film vividly and convincingly depicts the nervousness and enthusiasm, if ignorance, that poor, illiterate Sicilian immigrants have in anticipation of their emigration to the United States. They have some fantastic, unrealistic notions about the United States which are disseminated on the trip over.

This is one of Chaplin 's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more commercial (and far more enjoyable) Chaplin films that came shortly after. There's no plot, no plot development, no dialogue to be found here. I bought this movie as a gift for my girlfriend because we had a good relationship and she loves silent movies. I wasn't really sure what to expect but when the credits began playing I was in despair. After watching it a few times I can say this movie sucked.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson 's work , and for about as long as I 've been alive, it has always been difficult to figure out how the hell this series got made. You see, while I am absolutely sure that some of Besson's ideas are very interesting and well-paced, he has also done almost everything wrong with his film industry. For one thing, like most directors today, he likes to go off on tangents in the middle of their films rather than making any sense of what he's doing.

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance , a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - all for only $20. I'm sure that if the film had been done correctly, it probably could have become a classic. Unfortunately, it does not live up to this quality. The acting in this movie is almost as terrible as the screenplay. The problem is that most of these actors seem to forget that their character was never actually meant to be memorable at all. In fact, they do an excellent job of forgetting about their role in the first place.

This movie is beautiful in all ways . It is visually stunning , and this is a good thing since most of the screen- time is taken up by an incredible set, especially the exterior. I have to say that I felt a little bit like I was looking at some kind of antique car. This film is about two people (a doctor and a cop) whose mission is to find out who murdered John Dillinger. There are no other characters except for a man (who plays a piano) who may or may not be the true murderer.

Then again, I like Rachael Ray. She is fun, sweet, fresh, and such a joy to watch. I have to alter just about everything she makes as I am a vegetarian...but it's great to see her with a program that shows more of her personality. After all, she is a television personality. I think it's cool that she is so inviting with her fans and still appears to be down-to-earth. The studio audience appears to be rather small, but that just makes for a cozier environment. Some people have posted that the show sucks.

If we could have "Separate Tables," why not "Separate Lies. "This becomes somewhat involved. A housekeeper's husband is killed when he is hit by a car while on a bicycle. The culprit turns out to be the woman she cleans for. The latter was having an affair with a friend and was driving the car with the lover in it when the accident occurred. To complicate matters further, the housekeeper once worked for the guy's parents and he had her jailed for stealing. Therefore, people will hesitate to believe that it was his car that caused the accident.

The movie doesn't take itself seriously, and if you follow its lead you're going to have a lot of fun (as long as you don't mind your murders served up really bloody, and your horror topped with extra cheese)!This film winks an eye at every horror fan, and then gives them the finger. It knows it sucks, and because of that, it's far and away the best of the "Child's Play" series. It plays up the "stoopid humor" angle so well, you find yourself doing more than just laughing AT it, but WITH it.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery's best performances in a movie, and I have seen most of her movies.I saw this for the first time on television when I was around fourteen, and I was so scared.I watch this movie every now and then, and I still enjoy it very much.I know that these days that this movie would probably not scare people too much.That just goes to show that the public movie and television audience has seen too much graphic violence in the last thirty years or so.I love movies that do not show the graphic details, you let your imagination do the work for you.

I love this movie , though I do n't like how they picture Egyptians , being an Egyptian citizen myself, i think they got it all wrong.. the only thing i can suggest to them is not to continue with their script and just make an original movie instead. It's always sad to see such films. This one takes the cake! It was filmed by a Japanese director, Shunji Iwai, who in the last decade has directed several "movies" that didn't work out so well. All of his "musicals" have failed miserably.

"Head" is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968. The movie is a complete contradiction of the Monkees image. It presents the Monkees in a way their fans never perceived them; men with real thoughts. Totally controlled by their producers, the Monkees were given the opportunity to tell their side of the story. The film pokes fun at their image, the entertainment industry, and corporate America. The soundtrack contains some of their best music. It's a movie well worth seeing over and over again.

I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a wonderful film. The actors are superb, the writing is fresh and real, the whole thing was just spot-on. I love James McAvoy in this, and I can't wait to see him in "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" movie this December. Romola Garai is wonderful too. Be sure to check her out in "I Capture the Castle" or "Nicholas Nickleby," two of my favorite films.

Loved today 's show ! ! ! It was a variety and not solely cooking ( which would have been great ) so I liked that about it. Not a good show, to be frank. It doesn't seem like much of anything but a bunch of random episodes that happen to appear on television at certain times. Nothing is really interesting, the jokes are boring, there aren't very many characters or anything of interest happening. The plot lines don't really tie in to one another and just kind of hang there without any sort of closure.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II picked up and became a quite enjoyable watch for a couple of hours, from primarily two points of view. The love triangle is an interesting one and strikes me as believable, because I know it happened in various places under occupation. Penelope Cruz played Pelagia, a young Greek girl engaged to be married to Mandras (Christian Bale). I had questions about the depth of their love from the start, but their future was torn apart when Italy invaded Greece, and Mandras went off to fight.

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply beautiful story of a man and a woman hungry for something more in their lives than they have at present. The chemistry between Lane and Gere is magical from the first scene in the film to their last embrace. The locations, beauty of their attraction for one another when it unfolds when they first meet, and the story that follows, and as they begin to know each other with the attraction they feel towards each other is real, is romance that is projected to an audience with tender care.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development. Fulci was a master at creating horrific atmosphere using inventive camera work, vivid cinematography, and yes - wonderfully explicit gore.This film is no exception, however, compared to his later films (The Beyond, Zombie 2, City of the Living Dead, House by the Cemetery, etc.) the characters here are extremely well developed and the emphasis shies away from the supernatural and is more on the suspense created by a classic who-dunnit amongst the lush hills of Italy.

I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series -- my only detraction would be that it seems to be more of an action sequence in the last 10 minutes or so than an actual story. The premise for this show was absolutely amazing, but the execution was dreadful. It was like a bunch of friends trying to write a great TV drama and were forced to use a mediocre script. I watched it when it came back on HBO, and there was not one single line of dialogue that I could find anywhere.

"Hari om" is an Indian greeting and the compelling title character of the film bearing this same name(played by the wedding planner from Monsoon Wedding) greets you and takes you on a journey through the heart of southern India. There's no "Bend it like Beckham" backdrops and stereotypes, and only slight salutes to the music and dancing of Bollywood (however, the soundtrack is well worth procuring), but rather, the feel that you are seeing the real India permeates the film through the use of dozens of local residents in each scene to augment the performance of the five professional actors.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage 's better films . He turns a fine performance as the leading role into a pretty mediocre film. My problem with The Mummy movies is this: most of the characters are boring, uninteresting, or just plain wrong. They never seem like they're having fun. I've read numerous reviews where people said that this movie had a great screenplay, etc. But when I go to see the movie myself (on VHS, no less), I find myself laughing at the ridiculous dialogue, non-sequiturs, and downright bad acting.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner 's mansion in Paris. She is the most beautiful of them all, but she is spoiled rotten and doesn't like to get out of bed for fear of being spotted by paparazzi. I thought I was going to give it a 1 star, but as it turned out I had to go down to 5 stars. Not because it's a horrible film, but because it wasn't worth the $7 I paid for it. It just didn't make me smile.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars (The Monkees and Victor Mature), or its director/co-writer (Bob Rafelson), but also its other co-writer (and brief cameo) Jack Nicholson. As it stands, most of them seem to shun it, and to outsiders the movie is regarded, at best, as a curio.While the T.V. series was famously based on the antics of the Beatles' 'Help! ', this film is also judged by the same accord. Yet far from the trite and painfully overrated Beatles films, and even the dated Monkees T.V.

What a surprise . A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor ' only naughtier . Funny guy in his early forties playing a character more like an elderly alcoholic with a temper. I'm not one for cliche and I couldn't believe that this could have been made when it was first published in the late 70's (I think). The ending makes absolutely no sense at all and leaves you completely perplexed. I can't believe this is getting so much love. I actually feel sorry for Michael Caine , the man behind this, he had such a hard time making a movie.

Just as in `` Columbo '' we see the fatality occur right at the beginning . What follows is an incredible amount of "drama". I'm not very good at horror, and I'm not sure why this movie has managed to make its way into theaters. It is a long, slow, drawn-out train wreck with lots of wasted energy and no story. In fact it's really kind of boring. It's hard to believe that one guy was able to get through such a convoluted plot without getting killed. And there is no real suspense (at least in my opinion).

i did not read the book. nor do i care to. the movie was a beautiful romance, and i think women will enjoy it. no, it was not a "10" film, but it was enjoyable. women, if your man is bored as mine was, then watch it yourself. hurt is wonderful as the philosophic doctor who delivers a thoughtful monologue on "in love" and "loving. "also, if you like nick cage, he was terrific and funny. i enjoyed watching the developing romance. also, if you like Christian bale -- do see him in equilibrium.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery 's best performances in a movie , and I have seen many others, however this one deserves it's rating. In the first half hour of the movie there are some interesting scenes and some pretty cool effects. However, after the 60 minute mark, the story just fell apart. It was not until the end of the movie that I started to get a sense of what was happening. If you want to understand why Hollywood has made "The Matrix" (or at least its sequels), read this book written by the man who made it.

( Some spoilers included : ) Although , many commentators have called this film surreal , the term fits poorly. This is a film where the viewer can see and feel everything. The actors play with their own emotions in a more realistic way than what we usually see in movies these days. As I've always said (or at least thought) but never written, it is impossible to describe a film without saying that it is too good. It has to be amazing to be boring. Of course, the best possible movie is one that gets no attention.

Very touching film, a great surprise to come up from Brazil, a country that usually exports features about social themes, violence, sex... Magical realism is a very hard task, and I believe João Falcão has made it wonderfully. It seems that he really didn't intend to make a realistic film, far from that. Although many people think the film was adapted from the play, he said in his interviews that he actually based the film on the book. Another mistake is to think that Falcão has been influenced by the series "Hoje é Dia De Maria".

I was so happy to learn that Hari Om will finally be theatrically released in 2007 . I saw this movie on a friend's DVD rental and thought it was the greatest film he'd seen. (The only problem was that the DVD came with a full hour of the original film!) I watched the film twice and even took the trouble to listen to all three audio-tracks while viewing the film. The action was excellent, the characters were likable, the story had some good twists & turns, and the direction was very good.

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage and makes it seem like you are watching the concert from an airplane, or on an air trip. I was surprised by how many different things could be added onto this movie. The plot of this film would be very interesting to watch: A group of friends go out in search of their high school idol. They are given the task of tracking him down in the desert. The story isn't very good, it's pretty predictable but the acting is just awful.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne's "For The Flag" by the Czech master director Karel Zeman.Although the story is enacted in a rather understated late Victorian style, the visuals are a knockout. Zeman uses animation, graphics, painted sets, model animation combined with live action to create the atmosphere of Verne that the reader associates in his mind. The style resembles the steel engravings of Dore and Bennet and Riou that illustrated these stories with a healthy dose of Georges Melies added.Photographed in beautiful black and white the animation is of the highest order and not of a Saturday morning variety.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman : TAS and its ilk , I enjoyed it in a non-violent way. It's a pretty good example of how to do a children's cartoon. It would be a great idea to have this on TV one more time, but alas, this is not an option. The movie is quite forgettable; you could easily watch it twice if you didn't mind re-winding and re-listening every so often. At times it seems like there are only a few moments where the story picks up.I can't believe why this was made.

My husband and I watched this last night...It was wonderful....For once he was wrong in guessing ahead of time the suspenseful ending. It moved along very quickly and the acting was superb.. I adore Tom Wilkinson anyway. He has never made a bad movie as far as I'm concerned. The above description of his acting hits the nail on the head... The facial expressions are incredible. Even the picturesque scenery is awesome. We have just finished watched all of the Prime Suspect series and I am convinced that the British have a way of capturing the audience.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White , Cinderella , or Bambi , but it IS a very interesting piece of cinema, if you are into fairy tales as a genre. I watched it and found myself laughing several times. You see a bunch of young children playing by a lake with a magical tree that grows from their bodies.The story has a good beginning, but falls apart pretty quick. It does have a nice twist at the end, but it never really makes sense. The characters are quite shallow, not much depth there, especially compared to the rest of the films.

I ca n't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I 've described this movie to my friends, but still it doesn't mean I won't see it. I was so expecting a good comedy from these guys, because the last one I watched was crap. But hey, I guess they are just trying to do something else with their careers. It's almost too easy for them, since they have some decent actors as well. The plot is weak, even for an action flick like this, and the supporting roles are not much of anything.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film, like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles, as just another patchwork of mindless violence. And while there is a fair amount of mayhem, DEATH WISH 3 is not that awful of an effort, particularly for fans of the series and its star.This time out, aging Charlie's Paul Kersey is let loose by a police chief desperate to clean up a rough part of New York City. The trigger-happy vigilante moves into the heart of gang territory, where he once again becomes a one-man army in an urban war of good versus evil.

The Ali G show was really something amazing - he was so stupid wannabe rapper, but no one he interviewed noticed that he was just pretending. Sasha Cohen is actually very intelligent guy, who pretends to be stupid, so he could get really honest answers from people... And it is very funny. So I didn't expect movie to be good, cause it was all acted - no real people or interviews. So the basic point of all show was lost. But I was wrong - I laughed all the time, it was one of the funniest films I ever saw.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film. It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the country during the period just prior to and after Pearl Harbor.I appreciated the visual look of the film -- naturalistic and simultaneously poetic. Great work by a great D.P., David Boyd.Though a family film, the story never becomes maudlin or saccharin. We understand and believe the motivation that propels the young boy on his odyssey. I understand the love of the younger brother for his older brother and do not question why he sets out to do what he does.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it. It's one of the best "teenager" horror films I've ever seen; and that's saying a lot. Nothing is left without an explanation to back it up, the characters and plot break countless horror movie stereotypes, and it has got nothing to do with some other horrible pieces we've been submitted to lately. (A clear example is the mindless "Saint Ange".) The first 30-40 minutes might be downright boring with the exception of the beginning, although some minor light mistakes can be easily spotted.

Little Dieter Needs To Fly is another in the remarkable body of Werner Herzog's filmic work that is without peer. Having recently rewatched it on DVD, nearly a decade after its initial US release in 1997, it has lost none of its power, and one can see its influence on documentaries as diverse as Herzog's own recent Grizzly Man and Errol Morris's Academy Award winning The Fog Of War. Like the former, it details, in its far too brief 74 minutes, the life of an interesting American. Like the latter it gives a peek at a side of war that few see.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell his parents about an alien attack, which later turns into a monster. The movie takes place in a desert and the whole movie is dark, boring, and has horrible special effects. It would be great to watch a movie like this on a rainy day but it just makes no sense. There is so much going on that you'll probably miss something. I saw this yesterday and I didn't like it. This film is made up of 1 minute scenes, most of which never make sense.

I 've commented once on this Chucky great , but I had to do it again to say some things of what I found there. I've read a lot of bad horror movies. Some are good, some are worse. I don't like bad movies, but I really like bad horror movies. That was not my problem at all. The reason I wanted to give this review is because it's probably the best and most well acted horror movie I've seen in a long time.The characters were convincing and the special effects were impressive.

My favorite show of all time! Yeah, I thought this was so cool, and Larisa Oleynik was the first crush I ever had (AAAAWWWWWW). It was well written, funny-except when it it wanted to be serious, and just a great show overall. But since we couldn't afford to keep Nick, I couldn't see any episodes after Feb. 1996, and maybe that makes me think more of the show than I should. To me it's more the epidemy (now that doesn't look spelled right!)

The Aristocats is really quite charming, and is rated far too low on IMDb. The songs aren't as memorable as the ones in the Jungle Book, but they weren't bad at all. The animation is really lovely, the best sequence being the landscape of Paris in general. It looked beautiful. This is probably Disney's most relaxing animation I think, and as another reviewer quite rightly said, who doesn't love cats? Another great piece of animation was O' Malley looking into Duchess's eyes, as their romance was so believable while not obvious.

I first saw The Victim (aka Out Of Contention) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. Being a passionate fan of Bewitched since I was a child, I loved to watch anything that starred Elizabeth Montgomery. This movie was (and still is) a real treat - whether you are a fan of Miss Montgomery's work or not. Elizabeth always shines in her roles, such as her portrayal as the rape victim in A Case Of Rape and as the suspected murderess in The Legend Of Lizzie Borden.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year. You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and Court TV can be relied on for a few every weekend. So I started watching The Morrison Murders thinking I knew very well what to expect: a more or less competent retelling of a real-life family murder. What I got was a subtle, beautifully acted drama that engrossed me from start to finish.Both the brothers were totally convincing, and Jonathan Scarfe was perfect in the challenging role of Luke. The look and feel of Georgia was in almost every frame.

What a shame this movie was never released . ( It is now playing on cable . ) I tuned in to it after my son's birthday party at his friends' house. He told me about it being on television and wanted to see it. I couldn't do that when he showed up so I gave it a try. This movie was made by a bunch of people who had no idea what they were producing. The acting was terrible, the story line was boring, and its plot didn't make any sense.

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? I doubt it!Blankfield was fairly popular at this time for playing the pill-popping doctor on Fridays. Thomerson has been funny in anything he does, from movies to series to stand-up comedy. If I ever find this movie on DVD I will definitely buy it. I recorded this movie off of HBO back in '82 and have pretty much worn out the tape. One of the funniest takes on the Jekyll & Hyde theme ever.Of course.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan , where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion . After seeing the movie, here's my take on what it's really about:
The plot takes place in the late '60s, when all of the major Hollywood action movies are shot in Mexico City. The city is so overrun with cocaine that everyone who doesn't work for the police or run an escort agency is running around town doing their own thing (as opposed to having to sell their product to anyone else). This was the worst movie of the year.

Better than it has any right to be, this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office. At times sophomoric, at others, bitingly satirical and witty, Jekyll and Hyde is mostly just a near perfect reflection of the times, laden with drug and sexual humor, reminding one at one time or another of everything from the Woody Allen of "Everything You Always Wanted To know About Sex" to the Mel Brooks of "The Producers", Saturday Night Live to Monty Python, Carlin to Cheech and Chong.

OK so Paris Hilton sucks in it (typical Malibu Barbie) but the rest of the actors are just great! I watched the film last night and it totally kept me going thru out the whole film. Chad Michael Murray IS SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO HOTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT and he's just a ace actor. Total hero man. The main girl who is the sister to nick (chad) is such a brilliant actress. Thumbs up. I think it's so different to films out their these days, most of them to go with psychopath's, possessions, ghosts but here you have a theme about wax!

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life , this time the creatures under the sea , in this extraordinary film . I saw this on TV at one point, it was a movie I had seen before. A few years later I went to see it again with my family and watched it with them. They were able to relate to it because they had been through some kind of similar experience where they found themselves being chased by these things. That is why it is so effective. One thing that stood out to me was that there are no blood splashes or injuries shown anywhere.

This show really is the Broadway American Idol . It has singing , the British Guy , A guy who can ride a horse through the snow , a woman who dresses like an old school porn actress , and of course the girls who sing.I am sorry to say that I do not understand some of the words used in this show . They all seem to sound like they are coming out of a movie script instead of being actual words. There are many times that I just don't get it , especially when there are so many musical numbers that I have no idea what the hell is going on.

This little film is hysterical , full of stereotypes about gays , straights , dwarfs , British tea and pubs . It was made by a man named Brian De Palma and it is really awful. You might laugh but you will not believe what he did to the film. If anyone ever asked me if I would want to make a comedy, then I would have answered in the negative! The worst film I have seen all year.The characters are so unrealistic that they seem to have been constructed from the head of a dead dog. The acting is horrendous and the script is totally amateurish.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films, it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment. The most noticed element of the film is its silence; no one speaks. I don't think Besson, despite what is evident in most of his later work, meant it as any kind of cool gimmick. I think what makes it so clever and so effective is the fact that with no other way of communicating, everyone has to read each other based on intuition and conveying of emotion, no matter how slight.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman:TAS and its ilk, I enjoyed it in my youth and recently had been able to watch them all again, great voice acting from Tim Curry, Richard Moll, Tony Jay, and Maurice LaMarche in various roles. The only qualm I had was Rob Paulsons voice seemed a little too old for the title character, but that wasn't a big deal as the stories were great, and the fact that the whole thing has a great time loop twist ending.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love, passion, and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss in his latest film BLINDSPOT.BLINDSPOT'S diegetic world is exploding with suspense and takes the audience on a twisting  journey to the core of the human soul. As a director, he manages to draw the human spirit from the performances of his actors. With superb editing, especially in the flashback scenes and beautiful cinematography, BLINDSPOT is a thought provoking suspense from beginning to end. A thriller which leaves much to the minds' eye.What an  astounding accomplishment for Stephan Woloszczuk. Cheers Stephan!

"A Slight Case of Murder" is an excellent TV movie, which is defiantly worth the price of a rental. William H. Macy is great as a movie critic who accidentally kills his mistress, and then has to try to conceal the crime. Although that may sound dark, the film is actually quite light hearted and funny, with many memorable lines ("Acting is harder than I thought- you ever see BODY HEAT? I think I owe Bill Hurt an apology" and my personal favourite "For next week answer these two questions about film noir, What do these people do during the day?

It 's Showtime ! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro 's careers . It 's nothing more than an insult to Murphy , DeNiro and every other comedy actor ever . When this film was first released, I read the reviews with awe and disbelief. As it's not often that such an important piece of cinema is so poorly made, I can only assume that whoever directed it didn't do a very good job. There are several reasons for this: First, most of the acting is terrible.

`` Live Together , Die Alone '' is divided into three main story lines , and each one of them have the same character . I really want to give this movie a 1/10, it's not for everybody but I gave it 3 out of 10. The premise is great, the acting was okay but I'm guessing most people won't be interested if they can't get past the boring part in the beginning. The film starts with a man being thrown from a moving train which has been hit by lightning at an accident. He is found dead under mysterious circumstances on top of a train tracks.

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety, my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of artistic expression often do not gain mass appeal. The story line depicts a young boy stealing a car and embarking on a surreal, dream-like adventure with very little basis in our conceptualization of time and space. Therefore, anyone who attempts to view this film from the perspective of its conformity to reality will likely be disappointed; it is not intended to be "realistic." It is, however, intended to be metaphoric with extensive symbolism apparent to those with superb attention to detail.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character , unable to speak , living in a world incompatible with modern life. The story is set in 19th-century Spain . I thought it was really well done, and this film is one of the best movies I have ever seen, although not my personal favourite.The plot was interesting from the start and the characters were well developed. However, the dialogs, which seem to have been created for television, are very slow and annoying. This is the most disappointing movie I have ever seen. I had no intention of seeing it at all.

The Monkees, surprisingly, are a big favorite of mine. Yes, they might have been the original manufactured rock band; a gimmick that certainly has reached overkill in the 21st century. However, their music holds up as some of the best the 1960's had to offer. Last Train To Clarksville, Daydream Believer, I'm A Believer, (I'm Not) Your Stepping Stone, Valleri and Pleasant Valley Sunday are great songs, written by good songwriters such as Boyce/Hart, Neil Diamond, Goffen/King and John Stewart.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be. Terrible acting! Implausible scenerios! Ridiculous death scenes! Creepy, evil-for-no-reason villains! The last 30 minutes of this movie just might be the best 30 minutes ever put on film, especially in the scene where the decent, hardworking citizens string chains across the street, knocking down the evil bikers and then shoot them, only to be joined by the neighborhood children (!!!) in celebration. And how can I forget the elderly woman with the broom? She's sweeping out the scum!

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback , and if anyone is confused about her past ( like I was ) this will help them. In fact, I hope that some one can get an image of this girl and see what's wrong . As a lifelong horror fan myself (and also being a huge Buffy fan), I had to see this movie. And while I have to say that I find it hard to imagine why anyone would willingly watch it, I thought it could at least add a small dose of comedy into a film that usually has nothing funny to say.So what actually happens?

"Don't Torture a Duckling" is one of the coolest Italian horror films I've ever seen, and I've seen my share. To call it a giallo is a little misleading because it's not really a typical murder mystery. It's more of a straight horror movie.Complete with one of the most brutal and gory scenes ever in a movie this old, Fulci's twisting and turning film oozes with a creepy ambiance and an old school Italian feel. The setting is perfect: an old Italian village. The music is ridiculously perfect.

But a great cast! Jonathan Pryce, Kathy Bates, Rupert Everett, Lynne Redgrave, Julie Andrews and Dan Aykroyd! And that's just the beginning.I'm not totally sure that any description of the movie and plot are going to entice you to watch this one. Suffice it to say that it has something for practically everyone: death, singing, a sparkly suit, cell phones, a little person (nice looking woman, actually), a drawbridge (modern, not Medieval), a boombox, and a crossbow. Oh, and a psychotic.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre. Set in rural Italy, there is a serial killer of children at large. Add to the mix an array of characters familiar to fans of giallo cinema  a madwoman, a newspaper reporter, ineffectual police, a sexy siren, a priest, a mute girl, a mentally-retarded loner etc. This is one of the best Italian thrillers of the early 70's.Unusually for a giallo, the victims in this case are young boys, which makes a change from the more typical women in peril angle.

1930's comedy mystery about "The Crooked Circle" a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the murder of some one who swore to oppose them. Enjoyable but really unremarkable little film, the movie works simply because the cast headed by Zazu Pitts and James Gleason (both of whom would later appear together in a couple of Hildegarde Withers films after Edna Mae Oliver dropped out of that series) and supported by a great cast of actors and actresses you know but may not know the name of (I don't hence the lack naming).

`` A Slight Case of Murder '' is an excellent TV movie , which is defiantly worth the price of admission. But the fact that it isn't really a movie about a cop who is killed during a crime scene investigation is what makes it very hard to watch. This was NOT the best movie I have ever seen. I liked the idea behind it (a guy gets kidnapped and has to make sense of the situation before he kills his captors).The execution was fine. The problem was the script. It didn't follow the plot.

This movie was great . It had everything a true action fan could want . Plenty of people getting shot off , explosions , lots of guns being used and it was all done very well . The plot didn't take too many turns , the characters were not given enough screen time and we never got to see the big guy. What can I say, this movie was so bad it was hilarious! I mean how bad could this be? It started off ok with an interesting idea and then went downhill really fast.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen ! The images that are in this movie are so spectacular that you will never want to put it down again! I can't think of another documentary quite like it ! The cinematography is simply breathtaking ! This was a great documentary, but it left out too much important information from the story. When I went to see this film, I immediately wanted to know how the American's got involved in WW2 and what happened to Germany after they did.

The film isn't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch. I am the first one to agree that Victor Fox isn't really that attractive and his music and style are pretty cheesy. I also agree that the film has some odd distractions and some scenes don't work well. So what? If it makes you smile and you enjoy it who cares? Does every film have to make sense? Does every film have to be perfect? No. A person could get razed admitting that they love this film. Again, so what?

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war . Everything about the movie was perfect . A good cast. Well done. I will be seeing this for sure. I'm a big fan of the 1980s and '90s, so when they showed "The Devil's Advocate" on VHS, I bought it. It has to be one of the greatest horror/thriller movies ever made. And why wouldn't it be? How can you go wrong with Freddy Krueger? Even the most extreme fans of these movies can admit that he's still the baddest thing since sliced bread.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film . It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the heartache that has come to them. I was very excited to see this movie, but as soon as it showed up I was like "WTF?!?" I actually don't know how anyone can say that this movie is about anything at all. In fact, I'm pretty sure the title isn't meant to be taken literally. If you're expecting a love story or some sort of romance between two people, then I'm sorry to say these people are not worth your time.

When "Madame" decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble. The snobbish Butler Edgar who is next in line to inherit decides to get rid of the cats. Thereby the story can begin and the cats can go on an adventure that would otherwise have been impossible. An adventure that lets them meet the charming, but not altogether trustworthy cat O'Malley. He helps them through many dangerous and funny situations until the inevitable happy end.The force of this movie is in its humor and music. Edgar is simply hilarious as the insulted butler who is out to settle the score and of course he himself takes some serious beatings.

WTF!! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending?? The Notebook was good...but sheesh, enough with the depressing endings already. I'm told that he writes about realistic situations that people deal with in real life. Understandable...but sometimes it's nice to see people who have sacrificed their whole lives to only get to a mediocre unhappy time in their lives - to finally find the true meaning of happiness and are able to live it out for the rest of their days. Don't we already know what really happens in real life?

I still can't describe what to feel when I received this by the fnac site. Such a rare movie, so little spoken and known, is difficult to find, even to fans, but the contrast betwen past and present is devastating: now I hold a DVD of the movie, with the finest quality possible. As I did in Atlantis, the other rare Besson movie I bought by the internet, I saw this one at home, with all the lights of my dvd and tv turned off, and marveled at the experience. I didn't know what to expect.

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history, someone had to be the first. One could make a case that in Shoulder Arms, Charlie Chaplin invented the genre.Hard to believe that back then this was a daring move. When you consider that some of the best films involving such people as Bob Hope, Abbott&Costello, Laurel&Hardy involved military service and made during war time, it's just something you accept and laugh at.In the First World War Chaplin along with fellow stars Douglas Fairbanks and Mary Pickford went out on bond tours.

I loved this film ! ! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see how it would be like. This was not what I expected. It's hard to put a finger on exactly why but I just feel like I've been left with an unpleasant headache after the first hour or two. The plot has some similarities to Star Wars but it doesn't work in any way. I am a sucker for a good old-fashioned family movie, especially when it follows a very interesting tale. Sadly, this is one of those things that just doesn't happen.

Mark Blankfield ( from the old late night TV show `` Fridays '' ) plays Dr. Daniel Jekyll , a scientist who becomes obsessed with a man whose body is turning into flesh that he believes to be possessed by an evil spirit. While searching for this man, Dr. Jekyll and his wife are abducted by a team of paranormal investigators led by Sheriff Harry Landon, played by Bruce Willis . I love "Friday Night". I was watching it when I was about 3-4 years old on tv, and my mother always made sure I got some.

Great movie . Post-apocalyptic films kick ass . This one is no exception . Kept up the pace and interest a bit too much for my liking . First thing I do when I open the mail from my mother in law is pull out my camera and take pictures of it. It takes a few minutes before I realize that there is more than just the standard cardboard box in the box. The back of the box contains something which I don't think I've ever seen before, a small silver disk that glows with a slight pinkish light. That's right, it's a radio antenna.

This has got to be one of the most magnificent things I 've ever seen on film . I do not believe in CGI for the sake of CGI, and I have never seen anything like this . If you are a fan of B.C. Anderson or Robert Altman, then this movie may just be what you are craving. I don't even remember the first time I saw this movie, but it was one of the first movies I've ever fallen in love with. It is truly a masterwork of cinema. The performances are fantastic, and the direction is brilliant.

I always liked listening to Buddy Holly and felt a real loss when he was killed at a young age in an airplane crash. He wasn't in the old rock 'n roll class of , let's say, Chuck Berry or Jerry Lee Lewis, but he wasn't far behind. Who knows how big his legacy would have been had he sang for decades. Almost every single he put out was a hit.So, I was very pleasantly surprised how good a job Gary Busey did at playing him and at imitating his singing voice.

Before I talk about the ending of this film I will talk about the plot. Some dude named Gerald breaks his engagement to Kitty and runs off to Craven Castle in Scotland. After several months Kitty and her aunt venture off to Scottland. Arriving at Craven Castle Kitty finds that Gerald has aged and he has grown meaner. Gerald has certain rules for the castle(the rules have been the same for 200 years). Gerald does not want them to stay but, Kitty insist on staying by making excuses. One night her aunt catches a glimpse of the monster running across the hall.

I can't get this flick off my brain. It's definitely totally different than anything that's out there. I've seen a ton of movies over the holidays and while some are okay nothing really rocked my world the way BlindSpot did. There is just something way cool about the actors and the way that they put the film together. It's like there is really scary stuff mixed with with some pretty f****ing hilarious black humour. Franco is great but the older rough dude steals the show in a few scenes, like when he punches the kid out in the dirt grave.

Considering it 's basically low-budget cast , this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock'n'roll legend Mick Jagger, whose real name was Paul Robeson. The movie takes some interesting twists and turns, but I think its best for what it does not try to be; a musical with music in it . This movie is horrible! It's one of those things you watch out of spite. You're like a kid that gets mad because someone else stole something from your house. You don't want to see anyone else getting hurt as you've had enough of other people stealing from you.

My impression , having seen this documentary , is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had answers. For the price of $2.50, you could have just paid someone else to do a decent job. The acting is really bad. And the soundtrack was so cheesy and cloying that by the end it seemed like an old movie with poor sound editing. This makes it impossible for any viewer who isn't from the area to understand the true meaning of this film. I found myself wondering if we were actually in Texas at all.

In Tweety's S.O.S, Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that happens to carry a certain canary bird-and Granny, his owner. Uh-Oh! Once again, Tweety and Granny provide many obstacles to the cat's attempts to get the bird. Sylvester also gets seasick quite a few times, too. And the second time the red-nosed feline goes to the place on the ship that has something that cures his ailments, Tweety replaces it with nitroglycerin. So now Sylvester can blow fire! I'll stop here and say this is another excellent cartoon directed by Friz Freling starring the popular cat-and-bird duo.

inspite of many movies dealing with great artists or a genius , chihaweseon pointed out the real dilemma in which the art form faces. As far as he was aware, no one is capable of producing films that are both "artistic" and entertaining. And for good reasons: they tend not to be well received. I think I've seen this movie about 4 times now. I had a similar experience watching it when it first came out on VHS, so I wasn't too surprised when I saw it on DVD. I really don't like it, but I did like some of its predecessors.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the cast, this film would have been much more enjoyable if they had worked together on any other part of the series. This film is absolutely terrible. What an utter waste! I am very disappointed by the fact that it was filmed at the National Film Theatre. They could have done something to make it look like a feature film. Instead of trying to do something new, they just copied what happened in the TV series.

It was a terrific movie ! I like to watch it again and again . The actors were awesome . I enjoyed the music that they used in the movie , but I did not get into it . The plot of the film was very thin. It would have been better to have more characters instead of having one for every scene. There is no character development, and we hardly see any of the characters. We only hear each other's voices, and do not see much of their faces (at least during the first half of the film).

It took me a while to find this movie since they do n't have it yet on DVD ( and it was only available in video format, the same as most of my DVDs). It's worth watching but if you want to watch an action movie without all the silly dialogue then you will probably not enjoy this film at all. The plot of this film is pretty straightforward... A man with a broken back travels around the world in a wheelchair trying to cure himself of his condition. While traveling he meets some amazing people and gets their help.

Chucky ( the murderous doll from `` Child 's Play '' and 2 crappy sequels ) is dead . But he lives in an underground city where there are supernatural beings who can take away your soul and cause terrible pain, murder, etc. I found this movie extremely depressing and thought that most people would find it depressing at some point. I was wrong.This movie makes no sense at all.The story of this movie is unbelievable. It started out by saying that "the bad guys have been trying to take over New York's streets for two decades and they just don't know how to win!

This is one of the finest TV movies you could ever see. The acting, writing and production values are top-notch. The performances are passionate with Beverly D'Angelo superb as the older woman with a teenage daughter and Rob Estes simply perfect as the young stud boyfriend. However, the best part of this film was how it showed the consequences of sexual abuse instead of going for the usual happy ending. It showed that abuse can happen in good families; involve good people; and wreck lives. It is thought provoking and entertaining. Congratulations to all concerned with this exceptional movie.

I just thought I would add another observation, here. While there are a couple of visual sub-references, in this episode, to the possibility of unexpressed feelings between Jim Kirk and Yeoman Janice Rand; there is a special, physically tender, moment, toward the end. When the Enterprise is reversing at emergency warp speed in an attempt to outrun a possibly fatal Romulan plasma ball, Janice, perhaps fearing that their life is about to come to a dramatic end, seeks comfort by placing her head on Jim's sympathetic shoulder as they observe the aproaching instrument of their impending doom on the main viewer.

I taped The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network and I watched The Morrison Murders on Lifetime , Lifetime Movie network and I still have the VCR, so this is a good thing! This movie has no plot, characters or motivation. They just sit around, talk and look bored.The only people who seem to enjoy themselves are the kids. One of the children even comes out with a cigarette in his mouth as he is waiting for the rest of the kids to come in. This film is a travesty. It should never have gone to film at all.

Documentaries in which sons and daughters seek to understand a parent and , by the process , their own lives. There is no shortage of bad movies, but this one has the worst title I ever heard! This movie should be called "The Mommy-Moe Movie". I would say that this was not a terrible movie. It was actually quite good. However, when you see the final product, what does it seem to represent? What is the point of all of these people's lives if they can't even hold a decent conversation with each other?

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow . It accomplished this through the energetic performances of the actors. I'm not going to go in depth about every scene, but let's just say John Lithgow and Christopher Walken deliver an outstanding performance...this was the only movie that I actually laughed with my friends on a Monday evening. I saw this movie last Friday night. I didn't have a problem seeing myself in any of the roles. I also had no problem watching myself get killed off by a bunch of other actors who were supposed to be playing their own roles.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly(1936-59). He does have a spitting image to the man. Being a garage band in the 50's is sure different from today's. Having a group of three is usually simple back in those days. I bet that Buddy Holly(Busey) was a much better musician than most of what I heard. Since he lived in Lubbock, Texas, it was only a quiet country town back then. His parents were Christians, though his mother was a strong supporter of her son's work.

I just can't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense. It was never supposed to make sense. (Duh! The writers were completely wasted on Frodis at the time.) It was just supposed to entertain and mock, and it does both wonderfully.The Monkees are good actors. They wouldn't have been hired if they weren't good actors. Mike has a thing for deadpan and darkness, Micky is the best at sheer psychotic comedy, Davy is a Broadway veteran, and Peter actually had people believing he was that dumb in real life.

The movie is excellent . Acting , cinematography , direction and music are spellbinding . It seems to me that director Michael Curtiz did not care for the character he was portraying. This film is so disappointing. I'm really confused about why it's a "feature" at all, unless they have some sort of sick-o plot twist which I cannot imagine in real life. The story has absolutely no connection with history, let alone any real meaning. The acting is horrible (except for the woman who tries to be funny by calling her son 'Little Nicky').

This is a brilliant film . The story starts off in Romania , where Billy Crystal stars as an agent of the CIA trying to save the country from communist revolution. He falls in love with a beautiful blonde who happens to be a communist, then they get married and go on a journey together . I have seen this movie many years later when it was released and it left me very disappointed.The characters are poorly developed, the main character just isn't likable. The action is extremely limited and dull. This film should be avoided at any cost unless one is a hardcore political activist.

Gary Busey's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography. Since had a musical background, he was able to do his own songs and it really works. It's always good to see that fine actor, Don Stroud (one of the crickets) and Charlie Martin Smith as well.An 8 out of 10. Best performance = Gary Busey. Thankfully, Mr. Busey was Oscar-nominated for this, losing to Jon Voight in COMING HOME. A fairly low-budget flick that doesn't disappoint, with GREAT SONGS by Mr. Holly. I hope this made plenty of dough.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old. I had no idea who Buddy Holly was, nor can I remember what it was that made me sit down in front of the television, tuned in to HBO, and watch this engaging biopic. What I remember was realizing that it was a (somewhat) true story, about someone who actually lived. I recall the music, great songs that I still love today (I can't believe Gary Busey sang his own songs and so well - What a stud!) Then, came the end.

I admit to being in awe of the Sea and have spent a number of years in the Navy , but I knew nothing about this movie when I got it, and even less so after watching it. The cast is not great, and the special effects don't hold up. And while there is some pretty good action scenes here, they are set-pieces that would make most actors' blood run cold. The plot, as it stands, seems to be about two friends having a drunken argument which turns into a fight between them and ends with one of them getting killed.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert. A brutal but beautiful world that is explored through memories and edgy layers of sound and score. The landscape develops its own persona, paralleling the inner geography of all three characters as their stories unfold. The stark void of lost love, the fear of the unknown, and then transcendence of emptiness through the very openness of this desolation. Three misguided souls fighting to find something absolute and positive in all that negative space. The drama is compelling. James Franco and his co-stars deliver deft performances.

I think it definitely is. The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language should model their conversations after its dialogue. For example, the exchange between Paul Kersey(Bronson) and Ms. Kathryn Davis(Deborah Raffin) (more about this character later) is extremely clear and to the point: Ms. Davis says, "I hope you like chicken. It's the only thing I know how to make," to which Kersey deftly responds, "Chicken's good. I like chicken."

I know this movie is n't for everyone , and I wo n't push my opinions on you , but if you like horror movies then be prepared for a bad movie . If you like comedy movies do yourself a favor by not seeing this movie . This movie was awful. It didn't move the plot, it made me laugh at the characters, it kept me guessing what was going on. The main character was boring and had no interesting lines. And the rest of them were just annoying.They all seemed to be playing off each other.

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade . She smokes and drinks . She does n't have a lot of friends in school and she spends her time reading. When she gets into an accident, her parents send her back to school because they are afraid she is losing her mind. She also tries to seduce the other girls at school . I can't say enough good about this movie. It really doesn't take itself serious . The plot is so lame that it is unbelievable. I saw this as a child and loved it.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre, but I think this one is done quite well.It's twistedly cute clever & dark. This story brought back memories of the types of girls I was in love with as a child.Also, it makes me want to check out some of Nadia's other movies, many youtube comments about how hot she is in this video. Sure there is some Burton influence here, but I wouldn't say this Brad is trying to rip him off.He is just jumping in & adding his talents to a genre that I can appreciate.

Oh my gosh ! ! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! . It's like one of those scary horror films you see in movies, that when they close the door you know something is wrong. The acting is awful and the direction is horrible. They had to make the film as slow as they could, because it made no sense. I can't believe there are people out there who actually watched the film, but if you did, then you should give it a miss. If you liked it, then great!

If you have n't seen this film , do it . Its a genremix as i 've never seen another film in the genre like this before . So if you want something to pass the time, or some laughs , this is your movie . The acting is decent enough , and the sound mix is great . But im sorry for those of you who cannot make out the spoken dialogue . I really didn't expect so much from this title . This is probably the worst movie i've had the misfortune to see.

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . If you remember the 1974 film then you will remember Kersey was a " Conchie " during the Korean war and that he was physically sick after he committed his first execution . Ten years later Kersey seems to have learned unarmed combat and how to handle anti tank weapons in his spare time . But I`ll overlook that gaffe because DW3 is the best of the sequels , lowlife scum bags get shot dead , burned alive , their teeth smashed , and thrown to their deaths by middle aged housewives armed with sweeping brushes .

This movie felt so real . I actually felt all of the emotions portrayed here during my life at various points. It was one of those things that could have gone so wrong it would be embarrassing to show it again in public. One of the best bad movies ever put to film. From the opening scene there's just something about it that will make you cringe. It's not a terrible movie by any stretch of the imagination. It's just too cheesy for me. I've seen far worse than this when it comes to bad acting and awful directing.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful place in horror history. This film is an attempt to re-establish himself as a decent horror director by trying to be more original than what he already had done.I have seen this about 10 times since I started going to see it when it came out in 2003. Not only do I find it to be very cheesy and dated, but I find it hard to believe that this was filmed in the same era (1980's?) as the movies we're talking about here!

Louis Khan was one of the most influential architects of our time, and this film speaks volumes about how little everyone really knew. His son's desire to find out who, and more importantly what he was is moving, and emotional.This film captures the spirit of what architecture is really about, what good design is, and the emotional price that is paid for it. Equally haunting is the sound track. If you see the film, and then listen to the sound track you can revisit the film simply by listening.

Well, what's wrong with the title "Separate Lies" (accused elsewhere of not being "exciting"). It's cunning, subtle and a bit poetic. (Of course there's a Phil Collins song and a James Belushi film called "Separate Lives", which are alluded to here.) But the real point is the ethical dilemmas of telling lies at different levels that the film probes. OK, it's not an "in-your-face" hilarious title, but then it's not an in-your-face hilarious film. Please give British films like this a chance.

No . I 'm not kidding with this one . He was a guest reviewer for Entertainment Weekly and gave it three stars. This is the worst movie I have ever seen. It has absolutely no plot and EVERYTHING is done in a silly way. It's like watching someone walk around trying to memorize a list, and then they go into a library, and read every book they see. The ending was just too bad as well. It had such a predictable ending. What happened to the character who survived? Why were they fighting all of these crazy people?

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall it isnt bad at all the only problem is the ending which makes you want to rip out your heart and throw it in a dumpster. I was looking forward to this movie. I've always liked Michael Caine and have watched him in many different films over the years, but I'm not usually one of these people who really likes acting (my favorite kind) so watching this movie seemed like just another boring action flick.

I do n't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor . You need to get a life. Some people in my town who are so self-entitled that they have no sense of humor will never make it in this field, and I don't want them in it, too. I don't think anyone cares enough about science fiction to read such garbage. What's really wrong with it? Where is the good stuff? The fact that it's a comedy doesn't make any difference, does it?

Separate LIES changed my life . Actually , the Q & A did.SPOILERS BELOW . Read only if you watch the movie . I'm not sure why they called it "Lies ". I went to see this movie for my daughter and she wasn't into it at all...She said there were too many "plot holes". So, I thought I'd check it out with her. Well, I didn't even want to turn around after I saw the preview. The movie just kept getting more and more ridiculous.

* * 1/2 Elisha Cuthbert , Chad Michael Murray , Brian Van Holt , Paris Hilton and Jon Abrahams . The last movie had a lot to do with it.The story is nothing special, there are only 2 real characters in this movie (and both are annoying), and the cinematography is bad. There are some shots that are very difficult to see or even understand at least. This was my second viewing of this movie. I like to enjoy movies when I can sit and have a good time. In other words, if it's not great then I don't watch it.

Blind Spot's images are great. The action draws you in completely, even though the movie is a bit long. By the end credits all that you can think about are the film's positive high-points. The lead actors have the most incredible screen presence. The story is heart-wrenching. The film score is nicely understated . Completely moving in its own powerful way. Not your standard melodramatic cuing. Trance-like moments add poetic resonance to the engrossing narration and terrific visual compositions. Hope you get a chance to see this film. It delves into some dark territory but you come out of the tunnel seeing nothing but white light.

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families by stowing away on an outbound ship. They think that if they successfully make the voyage they can better their lives by making enough money in New York to send for their families. Unfortunately for them, the ship that they select is a rundown Russian freighter which has already been heavily fined at a previous port for harboring stowaways. The captain and the first mate are determined not to let this happen again as their jobs are on the line.

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918, a doughboy who can not seem to get the marching down straight. He spends time "over there" in World War One trenches. Several gags stand out: Limburger cheese as a makeshift grenade for one. The cramped quarters of the barracks in the trenches and when Chaplin and his mates are washed out of their bunks by flooding are highlights. Chaplin ends up capturing several German soldiers single-handed, and he spanks the German commander for refusing a cigarette. When asked how he did it, Chaplin replies that he surrounded them.

I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt, My parents loved it and now in syndication I feel what they feel. This show did what the original limits and twilight zone (new and old) couldn't do. This show used some old ideas and some truly original ideas.I still cannot believe Jonathan Glassner and brad wright did this. Those guys were producers on stargate sg-1. The show kept the audience entrenched in the story and set a truly scary atmosphere. This is what was not there in the new twilight zone.

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in ! I love watching him ! ! i just think he has so much fun with it all, as if he is trying to bring the audience along. He is brilliant in every movie he makes. My only criticism would be that there is not enough of him in the movie. This was a very bad movie. The acting was terrible; the editing was poor, the music was generic, and the writing was clunky. It had absolutely no redeeming qualities whatsoever.

This was a riveting film, one that really drew me in. I'm a big fan of William H. Macy, and he puts in a wonderful performance. His great likeability, coupled with the way his character breaks the fourth wall, really gave me a sense of complicity in his actions. I found myself waiting tensely for the whole house of cards to come collapsing down around him (and by extension myself, as his confidante and silent witness). It took several minutes for me to relax once the film had ended, I was so wrapped up in it.

This film , winning Im Kwon-Taek the Best Director at Cannes in 2002 ( tied with P.T . Anderson for most important movie of the decade) is not a good story, but more of a collection of short scenes, some of which you can't tell if they are acting or just jokes. There isn't a single thing to be excited about, and that includes the music. You'll hear the words "Ride on Horseback", "Sailors", "Dive in" and "Jump in", but there are no songs, except for one "I'm a King".

Without going into any details of a good...if a somewhat provocative...TV movie, there seems to be a consensus among the users that there is "no one to blame here".I disagree. Yes, the young male lover of Beverly D'Angelo, played by Rob Estes may be young and horny (and good looking) because he's not getting as much as he wants from mom, that doesn't mean, he can climb in bed and have sex with daughter. OK, he can use the excuse he just wanted to watch TV with her, but I don't buy it.

1969 was the year . New York City was the place . Putney Swoope was the second Robert Downey film and made the most sense to do. I've never seen this movie, but it sounds interesting.The main character is a professor who has just moved from London with his wife to the U.S.A. He's been looking forward to coming out on the West Coast for some time, when he becomes aware that the local police are trying to deport him back to London. This is a truly atrocious film. This one is no different.

First off, I absolutely loved this movie. As a Billy Crystal fan, I must say that I was expecting more comedic situations than I actually got. However, it was nice to see him in a role with more depth and emotion. His portrayal of talent agent Sammy was brilliantly performed and uniquely him. In addition, Gheorghe Muresan (as Maximus) was superb in his first film role. When Sammy goes to Romania to visit his client on location he has his world turned upside down. He never expected that he would accidentally find the one person who could change his life.

This is what movies should aspire to . Funny without being totally stupid , a little sexy without having every woman on screen wearing skimpy clothes or anything like that . The story itself is fine but the characters lack any real depth. To begin with, there are some great actors in this film, such as Tom Berenger, who can play a lovable loser and an all around good person. And then there's Kevin Costner, who is one of the most famous actors you've never heard of, but he has some nice lines here and there throughout the movie.

Duchess and her three kittens are enjoying the high life with their devoted human mistress until the wicked butler Edgar, with his eyes on a big inheritance, decides to dope them and get them out of the picture. How can these fragile creatures cope in the unfamiliar countryside and the meaner streets of Paris? Only by meeting the irrepressible alley cat O'Malley, a rough diamond with romance in his heart. After they get a taste of the wide dangerous world, he guides them home, and Edgar gets his just desserts at the wrong end of a horse.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic barriers. Ultimately the market place determines the message that is sent to the public. This movie dramatizes that point. A conservative white-collar advertising company is taken over by a group of street-wise African Americans chaired by a no-nonsense black man who wants to make a buck and believes he can sell products by telling the the truth. But the movie shows that no matter how hard he tries to do something different, the market place and the political system demands that he conform, rendering him no different than his predecessors.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but manages not to let the film turn into schmalz.This is a fantastic film, its funny with sad bits and it makes you look at things differently. Tell everyone you know to go see it now- FANTASTIC!The acting is excellent, and Dublin plays a starring role. This film will change the way you view people with disabilities and also give you a very entertaining night out in the cinema. I can't wait til it comes out on DVD.

I think that this short TV series, was absolutely wonderful, and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of everything that was on the screen at the given time. This was by far David Attenborough at his best. I personally thought this was one of the best documentaries in the past decade. This is definitely worth peoples money!I also found the bit about the abyss and deep water the most fascinating and interesting part. It was incredible to find out that the 'Blue planet' team discovered more than 10 new species of underwater life!

* May Contain Spoilers * The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when I was about 8 years old... I don't remember any of it, it was like a long film, maybe 45 minutes. Now, my memory's a little hazy and I've not watched it since... but I think there may have been a "hidden" scene that might have made it into the DVD set. Anyway... I'm sure you know what is coming, so go ahead with reading this and enjoy!I'll tell you anyway, this movie was bad.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character, unable to speak, living in a world incompatible with modern life. He trusts to his homemade weaponry - helmet, sleeves, and spear - made out of hubcaps, seat cushions, and discarded office furniture. Just as Don Quixote rode Rocicante, "The Man" rides his contraption (literally) transcending the lost lives caught up the harsh and demeaning modern world - soaring above the earth, away from the plight of modern man. Both characters ride in search of adventure in an effort to right the wrongs of the world.

I would say 'Bride of Chucky ' is a `` return to greatness '' but the series was never really that great in the first place and I'm sorry to see this go so far. A couple months ago I heard about a TV show which had a very creepy woman who lived on the edge of town and killed anyone who got too close. Well, I decided to check it out anyway.It turned out to be a horror movie - called "Bride of Chucky." I can't say much about the movie's plot because I haven't been able to find any useful information online about it.

I loved this film!! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it. I saw it opening night and loved it, Some people told me that this film wasn't any good and to stay away but I thought it was great. The actors did great and it was scary and made me jump. Paris Hilton did a great job for her first film, everybody is giving her a hard time when she did great and she didn't even have that big of a role. The set was great has it was made of all wax and how it was made.

`` Blind Spot '' one of my festival favorites . I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers in a dark room talking at each other's ears. They must have had some kind of telepathic rapport, because as they spoke, they kept making eye contact and keeping their eyes on the ground. It started to happen when they reached a certain point in their story that it was becoming apparent that they knew the other two people better than they knew themselves - and this fact wasn't revealed until later. There was no suspense in watching them "conversate".

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job . He apparently didn't get any training in comedy or acting, so it's amazing to see how he pulls it off (in fact I can't wait to see this guy in real life!). This is definitely not for the casual viewer, unless you are a fan of the game. This movie starts out pretty good. It has great music and great special effects. However, after about half way through it really starts to come into its own.

What a shame this movie was never released. (It is now playing on cable.)
