I tuned in based on my high regard for the stars and was rewarded by seeing a movie far better than the ones I've been paying to see in theatres recently. I like to be surprised. So often movies are marketed as "offbeat," but are in fact more of the same old recycled drivel. This movie is genuinely different, with the bonus of a heartwarming message. Jonathan Pryce sings like an angel.

Was very fortunate to see the movie Hari Om at The Bermuda International Film Festival. It was the opening night and was such a delightful movie. It was shot beautifully around India and I want to go there now. The main actor..Vijay was absolutely incredible. He was the highlight of the movie. Apparently he was also in the movie..Monsoon Wedding. He was the total star of the show. Benoit's character cracked me up...was very funny. And the girl (forget the name) was great too. They were all great!

I can not say this movie was a hilarious, but I must have had a grin on my face the entire time. I like this darker kind of comedy; "very bad things", "8 heads in a duffel bag" or "coldblooded"The way the main character tries to get away with murder is a lot of fun to watch. To me it was not much of a surprise what the ending would be, but the way that ending came about was. Another thing that sticks out, is the way they have managed to involve the audience.

Like some people here, I love/loved Stingers! In Norway it got aired a lot later. That also means that we are in the 176th episode. (yea, that's right) I have to say that I really love Stingers! It can make me cry, laugh, smile and so on. I think I'm going to die the day we reach episode number 192. Stingers might be the on series(except from Grey's Anatomy) that I really watch! The actors are amazing! Especially Jacinta Stapleton! Personallly I think she is one of the best access we have!

I saw this film at a small screening. Even though it had a low budget, the creative direction and intelligence of the cast helped make this a small gem of a movie. It's April 8, 1994, each of the characters are in their "mid 20's" and pursuing some kind of artistic ambition (acting, music, film, writing) when they learn of Nirvana singer Kurt Cobain's suicide. They quickly get inspiration to travel from San Francisco to Seattle and attend the Cobain vigil. It's here where the film really picks up and serves up a series of funny and emotional scenes.

Well, I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning. This movie wasn't it. It plodded along at a pretty slow, deliberate pace for the first 40 minutes, but there wasn't really anything in it that I was terribly interested in--there's an intriguing and mysterious feud between Jean Reno's character and an old man, but more of the first 40 minutes is dominated by the wanderings of the main character, whom I didn't know much about and couldn't really relate to at the time.

Double Shock is one of the many good Columbo episodes which reaches the level of a good movie.It has all the elements we like in the Columbo episodes. We get the laugh when Columbo makes something clumsy, and it happens more than once in Double Shock. I can almost guarantee that you will laugh several times if you decide to watch this episode.We also get the riddle as usual with an almost perfect murder, but something about the murder troubles Columbo. The end is the usual, we get the story about how Columbo solved the mystery.This is another good Columbo-episode, and I will rate it 7/10.

This is sweet. The actress who played the nurse with the gonzongas is the same actress who plays Elvira mistress of the dark. Another little tidbit is the actress who played the nurse who would give her wedding ring was the landlord lady of Roy Munsin in King Pin. This is most glorious story ever to be told. It should sell more copies than the bible. My parents played a part in suggesting the release of this movie to a local movie theater. The movie ran for a week and we were one of 4 families to see it.

This little film is hysterical, full of stereotypes about gays, straights, dwarfs, British tea and pubs, American gun culture, divorce and marriage; yet, it manages to be sensitive to the issues surrounding each. Kathy Bates is "Amazing" Grace Beasley, and as a character actor of staggering range, she brings her considerable comedic talent to ground this somewhat unusual film as she did in Fried Green Tomatos. With the help of other comedic talents like Dan Akroid as Max, her ex-lawyer husband and the backdrop of downtown Chicago and rural England, the story is just intriguing enough to entertain.

What a cast of actors and actresses in this Columbo episode, beside Peter Falk, you have Julie Newmar, Jeannette Nolan, Martin Landau as twins. Anyway, the old uncle dies mysteriously and it looks like a heart attack on the bicycle discovered by his fiancé, Julie Newmar, who plays the role so deliciously. Jeannette Nolan plays the other woman of the house, the housekeeper who prides herself on her talents and chides Columbo's sloppy and often typical behavior with his cigar. Martin Landau plays identical twins in this one. Each who accuse the other of murdering their uncle for money.

Being a middle aged mom myself, I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in the many issues that effect us. Diane Lane beautifully portrays Adrienne and the sacrifice and conflict that a mother goes through, wanting to do what is right for her children, but still have a happy life herself. I am not a big Richard Gere fan, but he always does a good job with the guy who is sort of jerk, but learns something about himself.Criticism of their romance as unrealistic is hardly justified when compared to most other romantic movies.

I don't care what some of the reviews said, this movie was funny. The thing with this film is that you can't expect anything else except to be entertained. This is not some intellectual comedy, this is a clever popcorn movie. The three main cast members are great and work very well with each other. Shatner is a standout in the supporting cast as himself, a former TV cop, brought in by Russo's character to coach the cops on how to be "TV cops." Those are by far the funniest scenes.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu, being Greek I adore my country and I liked the flattering director's point of view. Based on a true story during the years when Greece was struggling to stand on her own two feet through war, Nazis and hardship. An Italian soldier and a Greek girl fall in love but the times are hard and they have a lot of sacrifices to make. Nicholas Cage looking great in a uniform gives a passionate account of this unfulfilled (in the beginning) love.

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a film. I remember watching this when it came out on DVD. At first I didn't care too much because it was all the same crap I'd seen on the big screen.Then I watched it again - with subtitles -and there were some scenes that made me wonder how they got the scene shot, which was actually pretty good.The only reason to see this now is if you've already seen it! The only problem I had is that the acting was just so bad and the story was just so weak.

In an early scene, Luca (David Pasquesi) and James (Jeff Garlin) are walking down a neighborhood street in Chicago, admiring the bucolic architecture, when a woman, angrily arguing in French on a cell phone, passes by them, prompting James to remark, "There's nothing hotter than an angry French woman." A few blocks later, they pass an old Filipino woman, also angry, also arguing on a cell phone, and Luca remarks, for referential effect, "There's nothing hotter than an angry, elderly Filipino woman.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a bucket load of gore lead to him earning the title 'The Godfather of Gore'. While Don't Torture a Duckling was made before Fulci became well known amongst gorehounds, and isn't all that gory; it's certainly a gritty and nasty little thriller, and for my money - the best film that Fulci ever made! Don't Torture a Duckling really is head and shoulders above a lot of the Giallo genre in terms of production values and unlike many of Fulci's later films, everything about this Giallo is great.

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time. It has an original script, talented cast and it delivers an hour and a half of pure unadulterated fun.It tells the story of a high school graduate Bartleby "B" Gains (Justin Long) who is not accepted in any of the collages he applied to, so to avoid his parents' disappointment he creates a fictional collage. In the attempt to fool his parents completely he creates a fake website and turns an old psychiatric hospital into a school.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year . You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime. A lot of people will say, "Well if these are true stories, why aren't they on the TV?" I'm sorry for taking so long to post here. I watched this movie a few years ago with my family, and then never got around to it again because I just felt it wasn't really worth watching. It may have been fun at first, but as soon as you get caught up in the story, the film starts to come apart pretty quick.

Lucio Fulci, later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie, was years earlier a master of the Italian giallo (in the company of Argento and Bava) with films like A Lizard In A Woman's Skin and his masterpiece, Don't Torture A Duckling. This film has all the elements of the Italian mystery/thriller genre known as the giallo, but really pulls the viewers in by having each key character with a skeleton in his/her own closet. This keeps you doing as much detective work as the detectives in the film itself. Who is killing the young boys in town?

The very few reviews I could find online of Barnens ö really do not do it justice . I read this book to my son after having been introduced to her by his grandfather. I thought that she had a lot of potential as a novel author and I thought that she would have succeeded with this one. In the end, I felt that it was too shallow in its portrayal of the Jewish people. If you are looking for a movie or television show from the 1950s, this is it. This is the only film I have ever seen about the Holocaust and the events that led up to it.

Films belonging to the "film noir" genre usually contain similar elements: a "deus ex machina" plot twist that drives the main character headlong into bedlam, a pretty but psychotic girl, a handsome but psychotic thug, lots of money, lots of brutality, and usually a denouement in the desert. Think "High Sierra" or "White Heat. "There is plenty of hard-boiled bad film noir out there. But when film noir is good, you can't take your eyes off the train wreck of human lives.It is this latter tradition that "Blind Spot" belongs to.

As a film buff, I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny, sarcastic comments about this film (my favourite being Woody Allen's quip "If I had my life to live over again I wouldn't change anything ... except for seeing the musical remake of Lost Horizon"). Therefore I've never been able to watch it without smirking at the choreography/set/songs etc. Just recently I came across a widescreen DVD and watched it for the first time in years, along with a friend who had never heard of the film's reputation.

Years ago when I first read John Irving's The World According to Garp, I was astounded that most of the younger adults with whom I had contact didn't like the book when I loved it. I began to understand that it was an age and experience thing. I experienced somewhat of a déjà vu when reading some of the comments on this site that were clearly written by younger viewers. Fully enjoying Separate Lies is surely an age and experience thing.In this film the viewer sees a seemingly happy upper middle class couple - he a successful lawyer - she the perfect wife of a successful lawyer.

I saw the trailer and read some reviews , and I had low expectations for this movie . I was so wrong. This movie made my day . It was just so bad it made me sad. The actors were all wasted and the acting was horrible. If you are in the market to see a film like this, then go ahead. Otherwise, I do not want to know anything else about it. I think I've finally done it - watched every episode of 'Bored with the Ugly' on Comedy Central. And I don't even watch that much!

I thought that the storyline came into place very well. I liked this movie a lot. If you're going to rag on a Bridget Fonda movie, you can just rot. I thought that ragging on movie stars was a bad idea. Apparently somebody doesn't think so. I rather enjoyed the movie. I'm even thinking of buying it. I want it to be my very first DVD for my room. That's how much I like it. I rather would not start an online argument with someone I don't know & have it be over a movie.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh : as the Monkees reduce their entire career up to one song, which they can only perform in this one single video! I have seen this movie once, back in 1974. I was a 17-year old boy and it was really lame. The music didn't catch my eye at all. It made me look forward to the next movie more. However, when I rewatched it recently, I thought that the new songs (the ones that I had been listening to in the beginning) had taken over the film.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell the tale of how he came to this place. He started out as an officer in Napoleon's army fighting in Egypt but became separated from his unit. After nearly starving and/or dying of thirst he came upon a leopard which somehow became his bosom buddy. It brought him food and before long the soldier became almost totally wild so acute was his bonding with the animal. All things do end however and the man decided it was necessary for him to leave the critter.

Being American , I have not been exposed to this character before , which is good because some of you are going to like it. This film has the feel and feel of an American TV show. The story is told through a series of intercut flashbacks that are meant to be rewatched multiple times. There are few movies I enjoy more than M*A*S*H; it is truly one of the greatest shows ever put to celluloid, but sometimes you find a movie that is boring in its plot and characterization.

Warning--this film has some amazingly graphic images and should never be seen by kids.The artist who this story is all about was indeed a fine Korean painter who rose up from the lowest depths to become their greatest painter. Unfortunately, in so many ways, this guy was also a jerk in so many ways. Some of this was the artistic temperament and what may have seemed annoying was just his demanding nature when it came to art. But, other times he was simply a drunk jerk--especially when he was on his way to becoming a great artist.

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something "not human" is portraying human beings and I think that this film is one of them. Apart from a few points of the plot and the characters - this film could be changed with all people rather than mainly animals. Although - it's good someone did not - I feel the cats are jolly good in this film portraying humans! :-)This film also focuses on quite a lot of adult issues - which is rather odd for a Disney film.

Easily Lucio Fulci 's most respected film , `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is highly renowned for it self. It was one of Hollywood's highest-grossing movies during the late 1960s, which is also the point when I began to wonder why I have never seen it . I know that this is a classic Italian movie , but if you go to the internet (which isn't so bad nowadays and has an excellent collection of films) you will notice how few people ever talk about it. There's a scene in `Sideways' where they're all walking down the sidewalk.

Ross Hunter 's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy , based on James Hilton 's enduring bestseller , was written by and stars William Shatner in the title role. At the time of release in the U.S. in 1977, it was considered a box-office flop. The movie went on to win four Academy Awards, including Best Picture. One of the saddest moments in "The Lion King" (or rather, the saddest moment in all of film history) involves an old man who loses his daughter to a lion. As you might imagine, this results in him going through a series of tragic episodes.

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was . I was expecting the typical Hollywood "franchise" type of film but this is very much original and well done.The movie opens with a police officer, played by Tom Selleck walks into a bar and meets an attractive woman (played by Michelle Pfeiffer) who introduces her to him. They both talk for a while and then they walk out together. This leads to a few more short scenes before they are caught up in another case that will change their lives forever.This movie should have lasted only 4 hours.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie ( I have lived here my whole life ),I've been looking forward to this film and finally had my opportunity to see it. And that's exactly what happened. I was really disappointed in the entire film. I think a good screenplay could have made this an even better film. In fact, I think it could have gotten a lot better. It wasn't until I watched the documentary that some of the more disturbing aspects of the book were explained to me.

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear of death. When we die we go down and stay there, in a black hole. And then when we reincarnate we start from the beginning again with new eyes. So that when we are resurrected we have to see what's happened. Which is not much fun. This movie isn't very good. I think it's because the story is so poorly told. There is no plot. It seems like a lot of words were written on the screen to give a certain effect.

I don't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor. You need to get your head out of your up-tight ass if you don't find this movie hilarious! If this isn't your "cup of tea", so to speak, then look at it for what it truly is- a damn funny movie. Maybe they DID set out to make yet another drugs/T&A movie, but in this case, they've truly hit the spot. It's especially funny for the Ali G fans, because he delivers everything we've come to love and expect from him.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius. And this movie is good! Although the film doesn't nearly reach the quality of the tv-show, it's still very funny and has some seriously wicked moments! I've liked Ali G since the first time I saw the material from the show. I think he's one of the best comedy characters of all time.. up there with say, Peter Dragon ("Action") and The Blues Brothers. Biggest surprise with this film was that they've actually got some serious actors to do it (Dance and Gambon).

This is sweet . The actress who played the nurse with the gonzongas is the same actress who plays Elvira in the Spanish version of Casablanca (1933). She's also done a lot of movies that are better than this one, so it doesn't take long for you to realize that this is not good at all.The story is based on a true event. The movie starts on a Sunday afternoon when a young mother and her daughter, who had been missing for almost a month, were found dead by their father. They had been stabbed in the head and had been sodomized.

Accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and PC ads . The movie is about a kid that finds out that his sister is dead, and he begins to look for her in an abandoned building. There is little action in this one, so I won't give it more than two stars. When I was a kid, I remember my parents telling me stories about all the movies we'd see growing up. They weren't kidding; they didn't know anything about American cinema other than what was on TV (mostly reruns).

I saw the trailer and read some reviews, and I had low expectations for this movie. I was pleasantly surprised. While the plot is a little off-beat, everybody in the making of this movie pulled off a pleasant flick good for many a laugh. The writing and jokes are far more literate than I have come to expect. Better yet, they are delivered with aplomb by unknown actors doing a good job, all of them.The main reasons I wanted to see this movie were Justin Long and Lewis Black. Long is from "Ed" and the new Apple computer ads.

I remember this film of old. It's a great, chilling, atmospheric horror picture about a man who moves into a Scottish castle, only to discover that there are strange goings-on in the corridors at night. And there are even stranger events taking place out back, in Hollywood's most familiar hedge maze. Yes, this is the maze you've seen in every feature-length film that ever involved a topiary puzzle, up to and including "The Shining." But the punchline to this story is about the last thing you would guess. I certainly didn't see it coming.

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film ( which is excellent ) . It borrows from all of the great films and I have to agree with the reviewer above that some of it is rather obvious. The actors, the locations, the special effects are all fantastic, but I don't like the story.The characters seem very one dimensional and do not play well in a group environment.There is no dialogue, no action, just two people talking.It also makes you wonder why there is so much violence in the world today.One of the better aspects of this movie is the performances.

What a surprise this film was. I've seen a good few of Fulci's horror and zombie flicks and was amazed that this was by the same director. He also wrote the screen play which shows that the chap was quite capable of crafting a detailed, complex story line. The dubbing on this is not good, but far from the appalling slop that only further hinders later howlers like 'Manhattan Baby'.The photography in this film is fantastic. A strange, almost futuristic highway appears throughout the film which focuses on a small town where young boys are being murdered.

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters . I had never heard of it until it started playing. I was shocked by what I was seeing. It is hard to believe that when this was released in the 1980's that no one knew how bad this film was. The fact that most of the cast is white made it even harder, and the story has so many holes that it could not have been a serious film. If you are watching it for the laughs, then you are doing it wrong.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos. I saw this movie a long time ago, but it seemed to be put out of order and never got re-rated or re-edited. Now I can see why. This is a complete piece of crap. It is very well-acted by some actors who don't get paid for their performances. The story is awful, full of inconsistencies. It is like a lot of Hollywood movies from the 1960s. This movie isn't much of a comedy.

I 've got to say it . Gary Busey saved this film . If it were not for his fine performance , it would have been worthless . A good movie if you ask me . He plays a con artist and he knows how to deliver the goods . Unfortunately , he didn't get the chance to use that gift . What could be more depressing than watching someone who once had fame, money, power, and influence try to make a difference in society? After reading some of the reviews for this movie on IMDb, I thought it looked like "the" worst movie of 1998.

The movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts. But it will put you close to being in a time and place that no longer exist by getting to the *feeling*.As Keith Richards remarks in Paul McCartney's movie about Holly, there's some Buddy Holly in almost all rock made since his day. The tragedy that took him is dealt with gently, and the rest of the movie recreates the joy of a great music career and a joyful body of music.Gary Busey does a remarkable, energetic portrayal of Holly, and his performances hint that he really gets into the music.

Valeria, an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and depression. Although she may have a one-night lover or if someone lives with her, it makes no difference of being completely alone. Valeria is also a passionate woman who can take actions to approach that special man, Massimo, and at the same time the fear that allows her to answer his questions only with a "yes", "no" or "I don't know". The way to accent the loneliness of the character is magnificent.

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen, However, I am only in the second season.The typical Columbo activities are both amusing and irritating. His cigar ashes causing him trouble have been seen before, And the bit where he always identifies in some way with the murderer--in this case cooking ,Tho the scene on the TV cooking show distracted from the main theme.Also not explained was why the brother at the beginning of the show was cutting part of the wires of the mixer. The reason was never explained ,nor did it serve any purpose.

Barbora Bobulova's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time. It has been a long time since I have seen so much hidden passion and mystique presented by any actor simply by utilizing her facial features and the use of her eyes and mouth the way Barbora does with this character. She was entirely believable as Valeria and I was swept away with her characterisation of this role. All at once the film was real life and fantasy, the clever use of what was limited dialogue left me spellbound.

I just ca n't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense . It was never supposed to be good - it wasn't supposed to be bad. First off, I have to admit I didn't see this until after it had already been green-lighted by the big screen. If you're really looking for a film to laugh at (and if you happen to know that laughing at something is worse than being dead) then this isn't what you should be seeing. It's very well done, in fact.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film. I have got to say that I think everyone was impressed with how good this movie was. Though, my roommate didn't care for it but he's not into horror movies anyway and just went to see if Paris Hilton can act. By the way, if you're worried about that, don't be. I'm not exactly one of her fans, but I must be honest and say she was pretty good and she has the best death scene. Overall, all the actor's were very good.

I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt , My parents loved it and the kids at school hated it. This show sucks and I really hope it never gets to air, it's disgusting. This series is very well known in the horror/suspense community. The premise of a man who can see ghosts haunting his past has gotten a lot of attention from various films and TV shows, which is certainly not surprising given how old it is! But that isn't all the show has to offer.

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen , However , I am only in the theater for 30 minutes at most so i can't say much. The only thing that could've been done better, if you don't mind me saying so, is to shoot the entire series in color. If not then it's a mess. There are several problems with the plot, characters, dialogue, direction, even the special effects. Every major character has a flaw, some just plain wrong. It isn't as if this were a good movie, but it is a bad one.

I thought this movie was pretty good!OK, so maybe it had a few scenes that could make people think of other horror movies, but i have seen a lot more pathetic movies that got much higher ratings than this! Many movies nowadays are remade to a more modern version and there's nothing wrong with that, it keeps the story alive. i don't think this movie was pathetic at all and i'm not just saying that because i'm a major Chad Michael Murray fan, but because i enjoyed it.

I 'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it 's absolutely everything you could hope for in a bad movie, except for the ending. A very bad adaptation of Robert A Heinlein book. This movie follows the events that occurred in the 1930's following the sinking of the liner SS Titanic off the coast of Maine. It follows the lives of a group of American survivors who lived in New England as the storm washed over their shores. This movie is a complete waste of time and money.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly ( 1936-1959 ) is a tour de force for its authors. The first movie in the "Guitarist's Rock'n'Roll Hall of Fame" was produced and directed by David Hockney, who went on to make many great films. It is difficult to decide whether this movie is as good as the other Hockney pictures or not, because it has none of the charm that others have shown. While the acting is good, there are many scenes in which nothing happens, leading to the impression that the story doesn't really interest the audience.

The movie is excellent. Acting, cinematography, direction and music are spellbinding. It seems to me that the reason so many give the movie a low score is because of the devotion they have to the original, 1937 version starring Ronald Coleman. That movie - for good reason! - engendered an unbelievable level of commitment. From talking with people who saw the original when it first came out, I believe the impact was something akin to the first "Starwars" movie in modern times. I have seen it. It was and is wonderful.

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo ' ( hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door ') and found it very interesting and one of the best I have seen in years. This film is a mixture of fantasy, thriller, suspense and psychological horror. The story is really quite silly. All the characters are extremely immature. There is some nice action scenes with gun battles. Unfortunately, the acting seems to be all over the place. It could be said that the actors were not put together particularly well. But this is certainly not the fault of the film.

I did n't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD . I knew it had a cult following because of the title. I had seen some good horror and was hoping it might do something good with it. Unfortunately, not so much. The film is extremely basic and lacks in any variety of acting that would appeal to those who actually like to see good acting. It feels very forced and has very little "wow" factor. Just a heads up: if you want to make money making crappy horror movies for $3 million, watch this one!

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film (which is excellent). It borrows the main premise--a man has been poisoned and spends the rest of the film trying to find his killer. But I like that the writers chose an English professor, instead of a private dick, as the protagonist. The plot is also quite original. In general, the film moves along fast enough to keep you awake. But what mars this film is a strange dated quality about it (probably due to the horrendous 80's original music score)combined with an affected "noir" feel.

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a film? Probably someone. But no-one, truly no-one, could ever compare their expectations with the amazingly emotive and powerful performance given by the two actors in this film.Michael (Steven Robertson) lives in a home for disabled people. He has Cerebral Paulsy, and as shown to us right at the beginning, he has huge trouble communicating. So it truly is a lifeline when fellow disabled member Rory (James McAvoy) who can speak normally, understands him.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie. But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch. (MINOR SPOILERS) As per usual, the main character, B, is the sane one of the bunch. B has this crazy idea to make up his own college when he's rejected from all colleges he applies to. He's known for making fake IDs. so an acceptance letter is no problem.Because B's dad is a hard @$$ and suspicious of this university he's never heard of, B gets his friend Sherman to design a website for the university.

I've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark. I've noticed a lot of reviewers calling this the typical "buddy" film. De Niro is in no way Murphy's buddy throughout most of this movie. In fact, part of the comedy of this film is De Niro's reluctance to be friends with anybody.Murphy really shines in this one. He is back at doing what he does best, acting like a complete ham. He is a cop who wants so much to be an actor and enjoys being in the reality show.

The show start out with the boat . Desmond was i it . Then they went to try to save him. This movie is a piece of crap. The film itself is not very interesting, but the writing and direction make it very hard to watch. If you want to see some cool movies, I would recommend this rather than "Naked Lunch". It takes place in the past, which is why I give it 2 stars. A lot of the characters from this movie have been around for quite some time. This also makes it difficult to identify any of them.

`` Showtime '' falls somewhere north of what some critics have been saying , and a little south of what all but one reviewer have said . I don't think any critic is wrong . This movie seems like it could have come out of an old TV show. It's not, in fact, that bad--it's very good, especially in the beginning. But at this point, after four or five episodes (and about three minutes each), things are going downhill fast.The film starts out slowly, even though you can see the setting right off the bat.

Lucio Fulci , later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie , was years earlier a director on the British TV series Death Comes to Pemberley, but he went on to direct a number of cult-classic B-horror films such as Vampires Are My Friends . While I'm not sure if they're all that good, it's still nice to see a film that actually had some merit, even if it isn't quite as successful as some of the others. If you like slasher films, this is a good one to check out.

That's right. Ohwon (the painter and the main character) is an exceptional person. What strikes me most is the message this film might address to all of you people there. And the message is sad. It says that, it's very difficult to do anything that's amazing or maybe even genius without having to obey the governments, establishment and other VIPs of this world. And even if you try, you might not be able to bear it. It is about the battle of a single person with a system. With many systems.A great film of this wonderful Korean director.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a very strong female character (like Rosemary's Baby, for example) I found myself thinking "What if I created a female lead who was actually pretty?" The only negative I can offer about this movie would be that the dialogue was so cheesy and forced in that it just didn't work. There were times where I couldn't stand what I was hearing and had to laugh as the actors tried too hard to act their best.

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good. And of course by that I mean Wilkinson. The other two principals were "decent". But the characters themselves...what on earth was so bad about the character Wilkinson played (James Manning)? I didn't see him behaving like the martinet Emily Watson accused him of being. Bill Bule, on the other hand, was an insufferable jerk who I was praying would meet an extremely brutal and prolonged demise. Who was I kidding? Tom Wilkinson isn't Paul Bettany after all.

it 's a great movie for the whole family . i do n't think many people have seen it cause i didn't watch it when i was a little girl . Not much has been said about this film so I will just make this short and sweet. At the time it was one of the very best horror movies of the summer. This is a remake of an earlier (1990) TV series by Michael J. Pollard which was pretty good. That being said, it seems that there is a lot of blood and gore involved - and the script seems fairly generic.

For those out there that like to think of themselves as reasonably intelligent human beings, who love film, have good attention to detail and enjoy indie movies with funny, smartly written dialogue then this is a film for you.For those with a poor attention span, high expectations and no brains.. well.. um.. you may get bored and find things dragging at times.This is a charming, modest and well paced movie with the actors bestowing a real sense of depth and warmth to their roles. I chuckled to myself pretty much the whole way through..This film is a little gem.

Ah the Outer Limits. I love that show. It was surpremely creepy, or down-right mysterious. I loved all the genres of the show, from horror, to thriller to mystery, whatever the genre, it was good. I guess I must have started watching way after it got canceled, when Sci-fi showed it as re-runs, or played marathons of it. It was a really good show, I don't know all about the seasons and everything but I do remember that every time I saw the screen freak out and the voice on the TV say: "There is nothing wrong with your television.

where do we go from here? that is the overriding question of this film. And make no mistake, 'mainly ETC. ', the 2003 effort from director john jansen, asks far more questions than it answers, but none so poignantly or so powerfully as this one.much of the the film plays like a running conversation between you and your college drinking buddies, and I'm sure many of the questions raised by the main characters you'll recognize from your own evenings of drunken debauchery. however, one of the many beauties of this film is that we are rarely given an answer.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME. The 1973 musical remake of the James Hilton novel about mythical SHANGRI-LA! is a real special gem. Music by BURT BACHARACH and lyrics by HAL David. A strange mixture of straight drama, adventure and musical sequences. It has the distinction of being the ONLY anti war musical fantasy ever filmed. This film was a critical and financial disappointment in the United States, but made a lot of money overseas. Only in America did it fail.

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10 , and it just blew my mind! I remember that night thinking "that's not real, how could it be?". I watched the series until the last episode (when I moved away to college) and then dropped it completely. Then I found it on Netflix again and I have been trying to get it off of the service ever since.It is a very funny show with some great characters and I would love to spend more time with these wonderful people and see how far they could get into the future.

This is one of my favorite films, ever. The story is just so fantastic and the characters are so good. Unlike the other Disney films of the age, this film never bores the audience. 101 Dalmations, Peter Pan, Robin Hood, they were all good, but lack what we have here. This is funny, creative, and always on target. This movie just has an extra something that you can't learn in books. However, this is not the best animated film ever made. That title belongs to the BRILLIANT Toy Story.

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO, regardless of the age of the OAV. The plot itself makes sense, but the characters don't.This might sound picky, but considering that the city of Olympus is almost exclusively populated by living machines, would YOU feel comfortable there as a human? Would any machine ever emulate human arrogance, short-sightedness and greed quite so effectively? I doubt it. There are some pointers towards this in the movie, but only when the team can be bothered to put them in, by and large the 'bioroids' (or whatever they are) are interchangeable with human characters.

I 'm not going to go into too much depth , but Showtime was a pretty funny movie . There were some good lines but the acting was pretty bad . It is sad that it had to end this way. The only reason I bought it on DVD was because I really wanted to give it a chance. To be honest, I felt cheated. I know I am not in the same category as many of the others who gave it a "10" or even a "2" star, but for what I paid for the thing, I thought it would be ok.

After seeing The Aristocats : Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound , I decided to rent this film when I got my chance. There were no trailers for the movie, but I thought that it would probably be very similar to The Fox in the Hounds. But then I realized that the differences were quite profound! First of all, I was thoroughly disappointed with the "special edition" of the film. Not only are the original theatrical prints still out on the market and selling for over ten bucks each on eBay (yes, people actually purchase DVDs of this sort!

This new installment to the Child 's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as "Lol, they're making a horror film". Well, maybe this was just my bad sense. I mean it's easy to laugh when you like a certain movie. But here, I couldn't even keep up. Not because I didn't find anything funny or entertaining about the film. It's just that I found it so utterly pointless and annoying. A few months back I saw this movie from the original DVD release.

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music . Filmmakers like Richard Lester, James Coburn, David Lean, Douglas Sirk, Roger Corman and others experimented with new and unusual ideas in a variety of styles. After watching this I can only say to myself that no one in their right mind - or brain - would ever produce such trash again. It's all about the gore, the gory sex scenes, the brutal fight scenes. The violence is so real and the gore so gross, I can't help but look forward to seeing it again next week.

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in! I love watching him!! i was 10 yrs old (1979) when i seen him for the first time.i eagerly await each and everything he'll be acting in. hopefully one day i can see him in person. he's very hypnotic and mysterious and that voice is commanding and strong! he is very attractive, even now at 65 he is absolutely stunning!!!! In my opinion he is the greatest actor iv'e ever seen!

I've got to say it. Gary Busey saved this film. If it were not for his fine acting talents this film would have been sub par. I recommend the film but just barely.The biggest difficulty with the film is its broad disregard for historical, geographical and physical accuracy. For example, why is Lubbock green and hilly? How come Buddy's producer Petty ignored? Where are the daily trips to the Clovis, New Mexico studio? Why is Nashville treated as a racist hate camp out to destroy the Holly sound?

I absolutely adore this movie! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store. I saw Kathy Bates was in it, so I figured it had to have some worth, you know? I watched it the first time just shaking my head . . . huh? Then it was the last scene and I found myself aching from smiling so hard. I clicked "play movie" and watched the whole thing again. It is without doubt the quirkiest movie I've ever seen. But the more I watch it, the more I love it.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years. On the contrary, I was more impressed now than in my callow youth with its honesty and brave humour. In 1969, the transition among African-American groups from a predominant policy of conciliation and integration to one of confrontation and self-determination was still quite new, and more than a little controversial. It took courage and finesse to portray both the Establishment and the Anti-establishment as the caricatures they often closely approximated in real life. Special mention should be made of Arnold Johnson's performance: he successfully avoided having his character lapse into either sociopathy or buffoonery.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it . I found the character's behavior somewhat odd and distasteful especially after watching it again as an adult. I found it very hard to believe that any person would be capable of committing such horrendous crimes with so little provocation. This may sound like a weak comment, but I wonder what is going through most people's minds when they sit down to watch this movie. As I understand the story, a man kidnaps two girls and then murders them in a remote rural area.

I do n't care what some of the reviews said , this movie was funny . The thing with this movie that makes me sad is how many people did not know what they were getting into when they watched this film . This was my first encounter with George Lucas. I had just seen Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope a year earlier, and although I knew who Lucas was, I wasn't really too familiar with his movies. I also had a very bad reaction to Return Of The Jedi, which I believed to have been a sequel to Revenge Of The Sith.

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not : intelligence and good messages . Accepted , it seems, that the only thing keeping this one from making the final cut in Hollywood will be the poor quality of the production values. The special effects were too weak and the acting was awful. I really didn't get the meaning of anything in this movie. What a shame for the film-maker ! I watched this movie with some curiosity, but wasn't so excited to watch it. This movie has all the hallmarks of a 90's cult classic.

Another popular screening for a British picture at Coalville 's Century Theatre . A well crafted , solid drama with an interesting cast, a good plot and a very intriguing ending. I think you could get away with less than the film's $20 price tag. This movie was bad. The actors were unimpressed, the special effects were weak, and it had no humor whatsoever. There was no romance, or anything that could move the movie along.The acting was awful. Every actor on the screen was terrible. This movie wasn't even a good movie--it sucked.

Indeed , Cynthia Watros is in this movie as Elizabeth talking to Desmond . Though I 'm just wondering how many people have read the book and still had a hard time getting into the movie. Wow, so much talent on display here. This is an absolutely beautiful movie with wonderful direction and stunning cinematography. However, the acting was pretty disappointing and the story told in the first half of the film lacked any real energy or substance whatsoever. The plot seems to be taking a break at around the 3-4 hour mark due to the lack of tension.

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time . Quickly the movie grabbed my attention and got me hooked . The director did a decent job of capturing the essence of what made the movie so special . You have to watch this movie in order to enjoy it . If you aren't interested in watching movies like this one you'll probably hate them . Not really much to say. The plot is just about as bland as your run of the mill comedy. A guy moves to LA, and his girlfriend marries a guy who is also moving to LA.

As a film buff , I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny , sarcastic comments about this one, but I still couldn't wrap my mind around it. Sure, it seemed like an interesting premise, especially since it could have gone so many different ways. The main character was kind of cute, but she didn't really have any sort of depth, other than that she was a young girl who got her powers by being super smart .I mean, why do you want to be a hero when there are more important things to do with your life?

I had the chance to watch Blind Spot in Barcelona and I enjoyed it tremendously . I thought it to be very good. Unfortunately, I couldn't help but wonder about what happened to the other actors after they were dropped off at the airport. When I went to a screening of this movie at the theater, there was a woman sitting in the box seats that looked exactly like my daughter. She was so small and thin that it made me nervous when she came near me. The director didn't make her any larger or give her more of a presence.

As with so many modern US films , there has to be a supernatural element to the plot , but it seems to have vanished from the script.I think this was one of the first movies that came out where they did not have a ghost in the house (which is pretty standard now). I watched this movie without really having an idea of what I was supposed to like or feel about it. I've seen so many horror movies that I can see how this could be very appealing. Unfortunately, my expectations didn't match the film.

OK , so this film may not have won any Oscars , but it is not a bad film .It is one of the best movies I've ever seen that was based on a book by a famous author. This is an incredible movie! The acting is superb, there are some funny moments, and the editing is top notch. So why is it rated as a "poor" movie? Why do critics give this movie a 2 instead of a 1? Some people seem to believe that poor reviews mean that the movie is bad.

Telling the story wouldn't be the point at all, would it? Barnens ö, spelled almost like "booné aww" is the title for that brilliant novel of the late seventies that shocked a lot of people, including myself.Children's Island is the title, and what an island. In the book, Raine, the main character has The Guiness World Record Book as his own Bible. And he's keen on breaking new records himself. In particular the youngest person under water for three minutes.The story is, as most Swedish films and books of the time, deep, consciously provocative and awe inspiring.

I 've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was actually the director in charge, it's easy to see why so many people might have taken issue. The main problem with this movie is that everyone involved is horrible at what they do. I love Paris Hilton, but even her talent isn't enough to make this movie stand on its own two legs. Most of the other actors (except for Jason Alexander) are pretty forgettable, which means that the movie ends on a rather lackluster note.

The revelation here is Lana Turner's dancing ability. Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub and ballroom dancer, Miss Turner rarely got the opportunity to demonstrate this ability on film.So, viewers take notice! Here, MGM were clearly still trying to determine in what direction they would develop the still young starlet, and were, therefore, consigning her to everything from Andy Hardy to Doctor Kildaire.In "Two Girls on Broadway," however, she is given an excellent opportunity to display her native rhythm and ability to shift tempo in the lavish production number, "My Wonderful One, Let's Dance."

One of the most magnificent movies ever made . The acting of Charles Buchinski ( later known as Bronson ) was just so good. I think it was one of those rare moments where a movie could be seen from multiple angles and you wouldn't know who was talking to whom or who did what. I can't imagine what they were smoking on set, because they had to spend half of the movie doing that. There was not one line of dialogue in the film that didn't end in some form of laughter. In fact I've never heard anyone talk at all throughout the whole movie.

A film about the relationship between a man and leopard that's very reminiscent of "The English Patient," even down to a scene similar to when Ralph Fiennes' character carries the body of his lover across a desert-rock cliff. In "A Passion in the Desert," the main character carries the body of the leopard across a desert-rock cliff but in the opposite direction (calculated decision or unconscious contrast?). Historically expanded from a very short Balzac story, the film is not perfect but a treat no less. Final shot will haunt me for weeks.

SHOWTIME is a mess, but it's an entertaining mess. The plot is forgettable, the satire is lightweight and the action sequences, though well-staged, aren't that exciting. But I laughed. A lot. Credit goes to the inspired pairing of De Niro and Murphy. They have great chemistry. Murphy delivers the one-liners, De Niro cracks us up with a look or grimace. This movie will get a RUSH HOUR-like reception from the critics. Don't listen to them. If you're a fan of De Niro or Murphy, you're going to enjoy this movie.

NOBODY (1999) is a fantastic piece of Japanese noir. It's about three salarymen who get in way over their heads when their innocent, drunken cheapshots p*** off three OTHER guys one night in a bar. When these three mysterious strangers, who are up to much more deviant no-goodness than even the film allows us to know, beat the living daylights out of one of our "heroes", the trio decides to return the favour in kind - only they accidentally KILL one of the other guys!

Due to its predictable , second-rate title , ( the one it was distributed under in Italy , at least ) I did not know much about it. But what I wanted to find out was: how did it turn into a film of this caliber , and what made the whole thing so unbelievable ? In my opinion this movie is actually the worst of the big 3, even if it managed to be very good.I've always been a fan of movies with bad writing and an awful plot, and that's true for this film.The first thing that jumps out at you is just the sheer number of actors involved.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of one Dr. Robert Wilson. This film has everything to interest a film-goer, but fails to do so. In fact, most of it is utterly uninteresting and completely unnecessary. If you're looking for an over-hyped Bollywood romance/horror/thrillers that will probably leave you asking, "Why are they here?" You won't like this one at all. The directorial team behind these films may have had the talent to create some great things, but they were never able to pull it off with this clunker of a movie.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old, I adore AristoCats. It is a movie that contains no double-entendres, no almost-swear words like heck or darn, no parents who are functional idiots, and no crotch-smashing or flatulence jokes that are so prevalent in even the "best" kids movies these days. The story line is sweet and interesting. The music is great. The love story is quite romantic. The kittens are adorable, and the various other characters are unique and attention-capturing. The action is simple and not overwhelming or confusing.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people . The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of the characters are so captivating. It makes me want to get out and experience this film again. This may be a terrible movie, but it is an absolute must watch for any fan of horror movies. This is one of those scary movies where you can actually see the actors in their underwear or undergarments because they are all covered in bloody spittle. I have seen this film several times with friends and everyone says the same thing... "What the hell was that??!!!!"

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I've seen in a while. It's an emotional roller-coaster. One of my favorite scenes is the pub scene. When Dirk tells Grace that he didn't want to go to the pub because the villagers don't like him, you expect the worst. When the old woman holds her glass up and says 'To the Memory of Victor Fox and the whole pub follows suit, I wanted to cry. The funeral scene is hysterical! Julie does it in her typical Julie Andrews style. Johnathan Pryce is excellent as Victor.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be . Terrible acting ! Implausible scenerios ! Ridiculous death scenes ! The soundtrack is just awful and I have yet to see an original song by any band since "My Way"! The plot: A group of people are trapped in the basement of a house for five nights and must find a way out with only their wits, wit, and the help of a little girl. All hell breaks loose after a series of supernatural events occur and the group comes to understand the meaning of human life (and the afterlife).

I love the TV contest. Hate to see it end. There are so many talented contestants. It's a shame that only 2 will be picked. I love watching the judges also. At times they are as entertaining as the contestants. I have been watching the show faithfully every Sunday night. Wouldn't miss it for the world. It's the best reality show that's ever been on television. Good luck to all the contestants, though I have already chosen the two who I would like to see play Danny and Sandy on Broadway.

Great show ! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps . Contestants range in ages from 18 to 50 years old . All of them have grown up as women and therefore have had to transition into their next gender role. I just watched this show, and I think it is pathetic. I mean it is supposed to be "reality" TV? Why the hell did they have so many men on this show?? There are no women in this entire show, and there's a big difference between a real man and a drag queen.

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80's, and this one is even better. Sylia, Nene, Linna, and Priss are all back as the Knight Sabers in their hard-suits battling the robotic boomers. The animation is crisp, the characters are well-developed, and the action rocks. Priss is a singer in her regular job, so the series features some wonderful songs as well. There is a fair amount of violence, but most of it is against robots, and there is some fan service, but nothing too racy.

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life, this time the creatures under the sea, in this extraordinary 8-episode trip to all the animals under the sea!The cinematography is astounding, bringing to the screen truly breathtaking footage of those whales! But the best thing about it, as well as seeing each episode, is how they made it! Whether it is making models of creatures, or those impressive shots of the whales, they explain to you in about 10 minutes how they did it!2001 had some great tv shows to our screen.

the first time I saw this movie, I just thought "what the hell?" a 10-year-old kid driving around bizarre places, meeting bizarre people, going after a game called MOTORAMA! Hell yeah! I enjoyed this movie a lot!Jordan Christopher-Michael is a brilliant young actor! It's a shame he stopped act. He interprets very well his character Gus on the movie.Gus loses an eye, got tattoos and go at the most weird cities acting with Flea, Drew Barrymore and Meat Loaf! Want more? OK, don't even try to understand the story, but why this movie needs one!?

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people wouldn't like it. My wife has never seen it, and when I just rewatched it last night, I waited until after she went to bed. She might have been amused by a couple small snippets, but I know she would have had enough within ten minutes.Head has nothing like a conventional story. The film is firmly mired in the psychedelic era. It could be seen as filmic surrealism in a nutshell, or as something of a postmodern acid trip through film genres.

"Showtime" falls somewhere north of what some critics have been saying, and a little south of what I expected months ago when I first heard about Eddie Murphy and Robert Di Niro teaming up for a comedy. Overall, it was pretty good! As "real life" crime or cops go-- and plot, for that matter-- it is pretty illogical, but DUH--- this is a comedy. Also, while the special effects, chases, aerial shots, and skyscrapers blowing up were present but lower key than a Schwartzenegger movie, I found it a bit tiresome and overdone.

SPOILERS BELOW`A Dog's Life' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing. In Charlie Chaplin's other movie from 1918, `Shoulder Arms', the silent film genius focuses on an entirely different brand of humor. His war comedy specializes in surreal, exaggerated set pieces in which Chaplin demonstrates unprecedented creativity and mastery of composition. When the soldier's bunker gets flooded, the water level reaches just the right height so that Chaplin can execute his gags most successfully. In a later scene, the soldier dresses up as a tree, a disguise that belies Chaplin's much increased ingenuity and goofiness.

I 've been a fan of Rachael 's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network , so I was expecting something just like her show - but to my pleasant surprise, I found out that it wasn't what I had expected at all!The first season was quite good, especially for the time period we were living in (the early 70's). The second season started off well, but then quickly lost its way. As the series went on, there was never any real development. It seemed as if the writers decided that the story was already done and moved on to other things.

The Simpsons of course started off with Christmas special `` Simpson 's Roasting On An Open Fire '' which had a great plot, but the episode ended up falling flat because it lacked any sort of humor to keep viewers interested. There are several reasons why this movie isn't very good. First and foremost, there is no point in paying an hour for this type of movie when you can watch much better quality movies at least half-hour cheaper on DVD from other channels. But the real reason I gave this a 1/10 was that the actors look like they are trying to copy each others lines.

Great movie. Post-apocalyptic films kick ass. This one is no exception. Kept up the pace and interest without a speck of dialogue (mainly through some good character development). The fight between Reno and the Hero was tight. I also liked the use of cave paintings and medieval-like weapons to show how primitive and savage mankind had become without their technology and guzzaline. The connection between the beginning and end was a little spacey, that is, I had a hard time understanding the distances between the hotel and the opening sequence.

The cover of the VHS says it all : `` Without doubt , the most powerful movie of its kind and one of the greatest comic book films ever produced!``
Well, there is no need to add that I have NEVER seen this movie. I was in high school at the time. I did not want to watch "The Matrix" (which had a bad ending anyway) so I chose this instead. If you don't believe me, read the reviews. This film sucks. That's just the way it is.

Louis Khan was one of the most influential architects of our time , and this film speaks volumes about how a man with such talent failed in his life. Why bother watching this? Well, I have some issues with the acting. There are a few moments where the characters are just not very convincing but it doesn't take away from the film's overall quality.The script is pretty poor and lacks any depth. This is a big issue since the director does a great job of conveying the message of the story to the viewers.

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80 's , and this one is even better . I had no idea that there were 2 other remakes of this film in the 90's, but they are much more enjoyable to look at than this one. This movie does not follow the original story line at all. To be honest, I was surprised to watch this movie. I didn't have any expectations since I hadn't ever seen the TV series. The acting is great and the script is interesting.

Another enjoyable Warner flick . I really liked John Garfield in this , though I 'm wondering why Cagney was allowed to direct this film after he got caught doing the same sort of work with his own films. You could tell this was going to be a very low budget film because there isn't that much going on - all the actors are just standing around, it looks like one of those cheap horror and adventure movies you'd find in the early 70's. This might sound like a good idea but unfortunately it isn't. There are lots of bad jokes, horrible dialogue and no suspense whatsoever.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people. The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of life's moral highway make interesting viewing. There seems to be a different standard of judgement on women who have extra marital affairs than on men. Amy Watson's hurtful and humiliating behaviour towards her husband seems to pass without comment. Reverse the roles and one could expect a torrent of condemnation towards the man. If she found her husband boring and judgmental she could could have told him so, left and waited for a no doubt large financial settlement upon divorce.

What a surprise this film was . I 've seen a good few of Fulci 's horror and zombie flicks and none of them were anything like this . I have never seen such a bad script . The dialogue was almost unintelligible. The story follows a man (Giancarlo Giannini) who decides that he is being stalked by an unknown man with a gun who is killing his family. In order to protect his family, he tries to go on a hunt but gets captured by the man who wants to steal his fortune.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC . I 've been looking for it ever since . It was so good and so weird that I ended up renting it.It was actually quite scary . And it had a very interesting plot to go with it . But I felt as if I could not really care enough about it at all . Especially since I didn't want it to end in the way it was supposed to . It wasn't a good story. Borderline (2014) is an American remake of the English horror classic A Walk in the Woods (1970), directed by John Boorman and starring David Warner.

This is probably my favourite TV show ever. I love all the characters, especially Alex, who is the PERFECT woman! Always makes me laugh and feel good when I watch this show. There is just something about it that is amazing, hard to describe.It seems some or all of the episodes synchronise with music albums as well. Here are a few examples. (The episodes start again when they end - but DON'T play end credits until the very end, but always play the opening credits. With most the episodes the album plays once and the episodes play twice, but some go on further.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years . On the contrary , I enjoyed it a lot . I had hoped that with three new directors , the production would be in better shape. The editing is very poor . It takes forever to find the right shot . The dialogue is very hard to understand . If you're looking for a horror classic, this might be the wrong movie for you. If you have no interest in being scared, please do not watch this movie at all.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an `` against the system '' type of movie and in keeping with the `anti� message of the film. It is quite evident that the director was attempting to portray the anti-establishment philosophy of the movement in a very negative way. This movie was made by people who don't care much for their country. They're not interested in making America great, they want to bring back slavery. The only reason I kept watching was because I had a feeling it wouldn't be a complete waste of time.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something , and who appreciate a farce that is clever but not brilliant in its execution. The film is an embarrassment to itself. I've heard many of these reviewers praise "Funny Face" for its witty dialogue and quirky characters, and that's where I disagree: it's just a cheap joke. It isn't funny or well-acted; it's contrived and contrived-as-hell. Even the jokes are over-written. You'll never remember what the punchline was before it happened, nor will you care what it was.The whole premise of the story is ridiculous.

I've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was in it as well didn't give Me the best impression of the film .... then to be dragged to the cinema by a group of my friends and sit there expecting a pile of pants i was shocked to find that i was scared stiff all the way through the film ... it was predictable yes but the build up of the deaths and the whole atmosphere of the film made it REALLY scary for me ... i was watching through my fingers the whole way through.

When I was 10 (currently 14), I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would not have a happy ending. And until a few weeks ago I had done pretty well, except for Shakespere for English class...etc...I was still only watching things that ended happy. But then I saw Ramola Garai in Havanah Nights, which was cute, not good but entertaining enough to watch. After seeing this a few times over the two or so years since I first saw it, I grew to like it, especially the music.

I was so happy to learn that Hari Om will finally be theatrically released in 2007. I saw this film three years ago at the Vancouver International film Festival and have been waiting for it's release ever since so I could send everyone I know to see it. It's like taking a trip to India....colorful, magical, thought provoking. Aside from one rather strange Hollywood style auto rickshaw chase scene this movie is very realistic. This is not a Bollywood style song and dance movie but it does have drama and romance and humor.

This film was made right in the area where I grew up and now live. I know personally most of the property owners of the various locations used in the film. As a teenager, I worked in the fields surrounding the isolated road shown late in the film with Ron Perlman, Jonathon Furr, and the car. I am told that Jonathon Furr and Ben Allison are are natives of NC. I was fortunate to see it at a local showing. At that showing was one of the people who helped select locations and secure props, such as the bus (1938 Greyhound) used in the movie.

Based on a William Faulkner short story , Two Soldiers is a top notch short film , a movie that manages to capture both horror and suspense in the best possible way while also being an entertaining film . It's hard to imagine how anyone could have not enjoyed it at some point. The story is intriguing , the acting is excellent, the set-up is perfect. The premise of this movie is about a young guy who decides to take a walk on the edge of a cliff for a little relaxation. When he finally returns home, his father has died and the girl he'd thought was his daughter has disappeared.

This is a good film , no doubt , but with some odd aspects . Without spoiling anything it takes place in the 1930s when the country was in the grip of fascism and the Nazi party controlled the government.The first half of the film focuses on two young Italian girls who were both members of the secret police during World War II. The second half picks up another couple of weeks later when one of the girls' friends returns home from the battlefield in Italy. I'm a huge fan of these movies. I'm not even sure they are as good as the classics such as 'The Exorcist'.

Hey look , you do n't watch this movie to change your life ! But if you are female especially, i would recommend to watch it with your girlfriends. The movie starts on a good note and then ends with a twist. In the early 1900s, when I was about 6 years old, an Italian-born American couple made their way into our country. Their story is one of poverty, racism and hatred. It's a tale of love, betrayal and family dysfunction that is so hard to believe.I can honestly say that watching this film was worse than actually witnessing it myself.

Lucio Fulci 's `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by greed, corruption, and the lust for blood. I was somewhat skeptical about the premise, since I'm used to horror movies that take place in places such as Egypt or Greece , not Sicily. It wasn't until reading the script that I realized that the setting didn't really fit with the main theme of Italian history. To be fair, it does have many elements associated with Sicilians (such as their name) that may have been lifted from Greek mythological characters.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie. It follows all the rules. Short scenes, to the point, cheap to shoot, guerilla-film-making, no sets (just disused buildings) and possibly an empty hospital wing. Also, even the black&white film-stock was a stroke of genius, probably selected more for its low expense rather than film effect, but it worked.Reno was amazing as the Brute. Everyone's acting was brilliant. The plot was simple and effective and no flabby bits left to distract you.

Let me clarify that . This is not a `` good movie '' , but I am so glad it was able to be made in this era. It has everything: action, suspense, drama, comedy, and romance all mixed into one movie. I would love to live in this time period and see this movie. But I can never get around the fact that I don't think it could actually be made in the 1960s, even if it had the stars of the time. There are other movies about the Vietnam conflict that should have been made then.

Jeff Garlin's film is filled with heart and laughter. As in Curb Your Enthusiasm, his screen persona is hilarious; but in addition we get to see both warmth and a sense of emotional vulnerability that makes the story universal. While the film chronicles his character's dreams of love, performing success, and weight loss, it will appeal to anyone who dreams of a better life. The supporting cast brings the frustrations and joys of his life to the screen in funny and heartbreaking ways. The simple joys of food, friendship, and trying once again once life has disappointed us are all themes.

That 's right . Ohwon ( the painter and the main character ) is an exceptional person . What strikes me in his work are the contrasts he finds in his life. I was really expecting to be impressed by the film because of what I had heard about it. I was shocked when I came home from work after watching this film. It didn't make any sense. All I could see was a few people arguing, which seemed to have no relevance to the story or the characters. It wasn't so bad that I didn't want to watch it but it did make me feel uncomfortable.

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground , and in particular the `` flowering of our national spirit '' as they do it . Well I had to give this one a 1. It isn't the worst thing I have ever seen, but I don't particularly want to be part of a TV industry that tries to get me to watch more shows by making me choose between good films and crap television series. This show made me decide not to bother watching anything else on Channel 4.The characters are just so stupid and poorly conceived that they could have been written for a sitcom!

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear we all have. Fear of rejection, fear of intimacy and most importantly fear of our own inadequacies.The three lead actors, Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo are match well to their roles and are excellent. It was a joy to witness the dynamic between the three of them as it seemed real.I believe Barbora Bobulova is a stand out. I hope we see much more of her in the coming years.This film doesn't take the easy way out.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (although they will probably prefer the latter). Not a bad flick, and not particularly good either.The acting is very good - but the plot is pretty lame. It's basically a couple of guys who just happened to be in the same position in their lives that they are in right now. One guy is trying to make a name for himself in his own way, the other guy is being used by his parents to look after the kids.

I went to the pre-screening of "Rory O'Shea Was Here." I like this movie better than I expected, because the excellent casts and the powerful performance. It's a film about the friendship of two handicapped young man. Rory is free spirit young man who wants to be independent regardless his Duchenne muscular dystrophy. He can only move his two fingers but he can talk eloquently and help his new pal, Michael, who has cerebral palsy and is significantly speech impaired. I guess that's enough to start with a weeping drama. Well, it is.

This is one of the best sequels around and a very good movie too even there were some mistakes but still I enjoyed it. This time, Charles is not just fighting one or two muggers but a whole army of them. Death Wish 3 has a lot great action scenes and I enjoyed it every single second of it. Director Michael Winner knows how to direct a good action movie like this and Jimmy Page providing the music, with producers Golan and Globus still doing there thing and Charles Bronson is still acting good for Paul Kersey.

What a great film ! I never knew much about Buddy Holly , but was familiar with his lively and often humorous performance in this film. It is hard to make out what he is doing, since he is wearing an old-timey hat, but it certainly doesn't look like he has anything to say. He does indeed scream at least once. Buddy Holly's story is pretty interesting. It's just not very well acted. The characters have a lot of holes in them, there aren't a lot of dramatic moments or twists.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it . It 's one of the best horror flicks of all time. But I'm afraid that many, many others will not have the same view. This movie has some decent scares but its overall effect is just plain wrong. You might find it entertaining or interesting to watch , but your mind won't be there for two minutes after you leave the theatre. Wow!This was the first movie I really checked out after seeing "Nightmares from Hell" a couple of months back.

I would say 'Bride of Chucky' is a "return to greatness" but the series was never really great. Very good #1 was, #2-3 were throwaways, and I think this 4th installment is equal to or even better than the first movie. And it contains the best subtitle/tagline: "Chucky Gets Lucky." So he does, in the role of Jennifer Tilly, who thoroughly rejuvenated this series as Jeri Ryan did for 'Star Trek: Voyager.' Tilly didn't just create a presence; she added much needed humor, back-story, drama, tension and a great little sidekick/play-thing for Chucky.

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David. The actors seem like real people in this fairytale of the outside world meeting with mystical Shangra-la.
