It is a joy to watch Bobby Van, whose acting puts me in mind of Red Buttons, and, as always, George Kennedy (Cool-Hand Luke) who always manages to carry gravitas in his roles. The surprise here is Charles Boyer as the elder High Lama. Who would have known? All-star cast including Michael York and Olivia Hussey makes this work a keeper for those of us who cherish people.

`` Head '' is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968 . The film starts out with a scene showing a car being hit by another car; however, it becomes obvious that there was no real accident involved. There are many more shots of this car going through the landscape. At one point, the car speeds away without slowing down. The camera zooms in on the windshield of the other vehicle. In another shot, a person can be seen running in the opposite direction to the car.

I saw this movie on it 's opening night , and enjoyed it . I probably would have enjoyed it much more had I not seen it as it was so dark and gloomy . The only reason I went through with going to see it was because of the fantastic cast of actors . They were both very nice and entertaining . This movie reminded me of what I thought was a really bad horror film that I watched years back called "Horror of Dracula". The characters were awful but at least it was a scary movie. This is not even remotely close to that.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing ? Never heard of them ! ! But this is one of my favorite horror flicks and it would have been even better if they were in it. I didn't want to see "Death House" ever again but this movie had a lot of potential. OK, I'm no horror expert (although I am a huge fan of many films), but I was not very enthusiastic about this film. I mean, what's the point of going into the house and seeing the dead bodies on the windowsill when you don't know how to open them?

Very touching film , a great surprise to come up from Brazil , a country that usually exports features about cars and sports cars, but I guess there was some other reason for this film in the end.The actors were great and made the experience quite interesting. In the beginning it seems as if everything is going well , then it just starts to sink in, and the story gets worse and worse. I've heard many good things about this movie. I saw it the weekend before last, so I wasn't exactly expecting much, but I was wrong.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film, The Life of Jimmy Dolan which starred Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. as the prizefighter on the lam.Even with the restrictions now upon production by the Hays Office, this remake actually turns out to be better than the original. Douglas Fairbanks, Jr., is horribly miscast as a pugilist. John Garfield with his background and style steps into a part he was born to play.They Made Me a Criminal was directed by Busby Berkeley who Jack Warner believed in keeping busy in between musicals. Berkeley in fact would soon be leaving Warner Brothers for MGM.

This is probably my favourite TV show ever . I love all the characters , especially Alex , who is a great actor and always comes out on top. He has a great personality and is so charming. But he can be really annoying when he is mad (which is often) and that is how he makes us sit through this stupid story. I did not want to watch the movie because, like some other reviewers here said, "this movie does not have any depth". The problem is, despite having a plot, very little character development takes place.

I 'm not a massive Disney fan , but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them, so I decided to watch this one as he sat in his room. And boy did that movie make me want to write a song about it!First of all, the name of this movie is totally stupid. My 6-year old said to me, "You are going to make some people laugh out loud." Really? You're saying that because your kid can't figure out how to pronounce the name of this movie?

by TyNesha Mells . In this drama , Ja Rule , who stars as Reggie , struggles with the loss of his daughter, a prostitute, after an affair with one of her friends. She later leaves him and eventually moves to Miami to live with him. His daughter is pregnant with his child by another woman, so it would be more understandable if they were separated at birth. A lot of people said this show was very boring, but I disagree. It's like a crime drama on ice. We're not going to spend any time on the plot, since most of it is pretty obvious already.

When his elderly mother Emily ( Jeanne Bates ) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier ( Brion James ) she has to rely on the assistance of two mysterious young men ( William Hurt , Jim Broadbent ) who act as mediators between her and her killer. The plot is rather straightforward, but not particularly good. The pacing is very slow and it seems to take quite a long time from start to finish. The only redeeming feature of the whole affair is that in spite of its flaws, it manages to be entertaining to watch.

When I was 10 ( currently 14 ) , I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would have an anti-Semitic joke in it. I know, I know, this is one of those movies where it's obvious the director/co-director doesn't believe in what the movie is about or that the cast and crew actually believe what they are saying. After watching "Saving Private Ryan" I was absolutely shocked to learn that at least two American soldiers were Jewish. It was so shocking that I immediately went online and Googled all my friends to see how many other people they knew that were Jewish.

It was a terrific movie! I like to watch it again and again. The actors were awesome. The movie kept me on the edge of my seat. I would recommend this movie to anyone. I wish Lifetime would put this movie on DVD. I would most definitely purchase a copy. This movie just proves that you should be very careful about who you get hooked up with. You may think you know someone, but you never know. My daughter watched the movie with me. She thought it was great. All I know is, I will watch this movie every time Lifetime airs it.

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form . I tracked it down today on the DVD. It doesn't work and I don't get any enjoyment from it. It's so boring, the story is so weak. A lot has happened since I first saw this movie back in 1979. The last 15 years have seen a great change in music, culture, and society. I was a 16-year-old girl in 1980 and one of my friends said: "You could have made this movie today!". Well, what did I do?

This is my favourite Columbo. Martin Landau (excellent!) plays twins, one of whom may have committed a murder. This Columbo is unusual because the usual murder scene at the beginning doesn't give you any clue to which one did it! Peter Falk is on form as usual in this episode written by Steven Bochco (who also wrote 'Murder by the Book', my second favourite episode). The supporting cast are great especially Julie Newmar (very under-rated) and Jeanette Nolan as the house keeper that Columbo just keeps on upsetting.

No. I'm not kidding with this one. He was a guest reviewer for Entertainment Weekly and gave this movie positive marks. And who can blame him? This is a charming, upbeat, and rather funny Disney movie. Who doesn't love kittens? The music in Ev'rybody Wants To Be A Cat is jamming. It makes me want to snap my fingers or something. Only years later when Cats Don't Dance came out have I seen a movie that was that musically fun. What Aristocats lacks in animation and story, it makes up for in charm.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie . But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch! I can't believe I ever saw this film, it was terrible. The writing was so bad that it made me want to throw it in the trash can. The acting was terrible, they should have had someone else play each role. The script was a complete joke, I found myself laughing out loud more than once. I wanted to rip my hair out. I didn't care if I lost the plot or not, I wasn't even paying attention during the first half.

The movie is incredible , it has a sound track which sets the tone for the movie . THe lines have no meaning to me and the story is contrived beyond belief . This film was very interesting for many reasons, some of which are discussed in the reviews. But I feel like there's something missing that makes it worth your time. In particular, as someone with borderline autism (and yes, I'm one myself) I find that the fact that the people in the movie all have different ways of expressing emotions made my mind start spinning.

I've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie. I agree the move had many opportunities for improvement but unlike all those who are looking for the perfect movie with the perfect songs and the best acting, I was looking for something a bit different and this movie gave it to me. I watched this movie not as a critic but as a person looking for a little hope, a little cheer, a bit of a release from my everyday life, and this is what I got.

OK, so I loved Rachael Ray before, but now, I ADORE her! How innovative. I love that she has a cooking section- I admit that occasionally I skip that part, only because it makes me WAAAY too hungry! But I also love that you can get the next day's grocery list on her website. I love that she has regular helpers and that she's made some of her viewers become her regulars. I love how personable she is and how creative she is. I also like how she does her Mystery Guests.

A mix of 70 's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line . As I 've said before in other reviews of this movie, i think that a good 90% of the movie is made up of scenes which could have been used to make a really fun 80's cartoon (like Space Ranger) instead of making a crappy sci-fi film with a few nice moments here and there. As someone who doesn't know much about this movie beyond the title, I am not too impressed. It's so bad I don't know how anybody can sit through it.

What a surprise. A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor' only naughtier. Funny guy Tim Thomerson (who steals the show as Blinkin in Robin Hood-Men In Tights) is downright hilarious as the anal retentive Dr. Jekyll and the sex crazed Hyde. The one scene that is really funny is when Dr. Lanyon (Mark Blankfield) catches Jekyll in bed with his daughter and says: "how dare you take advantage of my innocent daughter." Jekyll replies, "but sir, I'm going ahead with the operation. "Lanyon replies back, "oh.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars ( The Monkees and Victor Mature ) , but because it shows that music can be as funny as comedy. In the world of adult pop music, there are few bands who could come close to what the Monkees could do on stage with their crazy antics and ridiculous costumes. First of all - I don't think this movie was meant to be a "honest" review of the Monkees; rather, I would like to discuss the film in the context of other aspects of the rock 'n roll history of this country.

This has got to be one of the most magnificent things I've ever seen on film. I don't know if it's as serious as it seems to try to be, but that hardly matters. This film is extreme, absolutely wild and surreal. The packaging and the marketing only make it more so because you *know* that ever so often some mother has to reprogram her kid to accept our reality after he checks this out from the video store expecting something completely different. Look at the roadmap, for one thing!

I 've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer , and I 'm so glad I did!This movie, while it certainly has its share of problems, actually is pretty decent. It 's got a good story line and some good characters. The problem with this movie, though, lies in its execution.The acting is just too over the top for what it should be. There is really no character development here, and the few scenes where they do get to do a bit of character development are incredibly one-note and unnecessary.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I 've just managed to watch this film for the second time. This is a sad story. I really can't begin to explain, but I just couldn't bear watching this! The characters were not that funny or original, the plot was extremely predictable and it just wasn't all that compelling. If there's one thing that every movie needs to be, it's suspense. There is nothing in this movie about suspense, at least what you'd find in any good mystery. I watched this movie with my partner.

This is a stunning movie . Raw and sublimely moving . It felt like a very gripping , intelligent stage play. I'm a little hesitant to comment on movies, but here goes. In case you haven't heard of this movie in some time, it's definitely not for kids (or anyone younger than 14). At first I thought I was imagining the movie as a sort of "Rudolph the Rednosed Reindeer" meets "Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory". But I can assure you it's much more serious than either of those films.

Well , what 's wrong with the title `` Separate Lies '' ( accused elsewhere of not being `` exciting '' for its time) ? Is it that it is just too old? In my own view, I think that this movie is one of the most original in the history of cinematic science fiction films, and a rare exception to the rule. Worst film ever! I don't understand why anybody would watch it. The acting is awful and some of the dialogue is so out of control that it's really hard to remember what they actually said.

`` Caribe '' is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects . However , it delivers a perfectly choreographed story, with wonderful acting and the most realistic dialogue from an actor like Mireille Enos. For the record I have never read or seen anything remotely resembling this movie. It looks like all the money spent on advertising went right into creating this pathetic piece of trash. In short, it's one of the worst movies I've ever seen. The storyline is simply that of a bunch of bored college kids who don't fit in anywhere else.

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television (RTL7, around 1800hrs) and I still watch it! I don't like the A-Team... I absolutely adore them!! It is just great to see Justin chasing the former members of A-Team. Brings back memories from the old days, when I was young an sweet. I would have given you a 10 for excellent, but Justin looks like he is chasing the former A-Team members all by himself. Of course, that is the only bad thing on this documentary.

Jeff Garlin 's film is filled with heart and laughter . As in Curb Your Enthusiasm , his screen persona comes across as authentic, but unfortunately this was not enough for me to finish the movie. I will say that many scenes were funny but too long to watch in one sitting. This was the third film directed by David Hoberman, the other two being Big Fish and The Wicker Man. He's no slouch in the directing department, either, though there are several flaws here. For one, this film has very little plot, only about ten minutes of it at the beginning of the movie.

William H. Macy always gives a good performance. He never looks lazy and never seems like he'd rather be somewhere else. In short, he's what more actors should be like. "A Slight Case of Murder" is directed by Steven Schachter, who went on to do two more great films with Macy (Door to Door, The Wool Cap).Television movies have long been a dump of overdone acting, poor cinematography, and sub-par scripting. That's why it's so refreshing to see a TV movie that does exactly what it's sort of film was created for.

I Loved this movie. Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role. More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade to this comedy level, which is at the very top of the line in my opinion. A no drink movie, you laugh so hard you will spill it all over yourself. Can We expect more? Let's hope so. I would like to suggest many movies for this type of remake. Mel Brookes made some remakes of classic films.He made some very strong contributions. A Picture of Dorian Gray would be a good suggestion.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to watch those movies too. If you're anything like me, and you probably are, you'll be laughing for years to come at the jokes in this movie. One of the funniest parts is when Gus sharks some money off a guy with kids and then the guy takes those kids into the forest like Hansel and Gretel then he and his wife go home with them. The soup scene kitchen is rife with comic genius of buffoonery: "Inspection officer -- Here!"

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I 've ever seen . Not only it 's a great thriller and thriller/comedy/horror but it's also absolutely beautiful. If you don't know what i'm talking about...this movie starts with a scene where some guys are on a road in France. They're driving around doing nothing, when this truck comes from nowhere, crashes into the back of the truck they're in. The guys get out of the van, and the camera pans up to show the dead guy's head floating in the air.

Warning -- this film has some amazingly graphic images and should never be seen by kids.The artist who this story was adapted from is probably the greatest ever, but he did not draw a line between his art and reality. One of my absolute favorites. I had it on my DVD player for 2 days straight. I don't know why! It's one of those horror movies that just has to be seen no matter how sick or depressing it gets. The plot is so unbelievable that you can't believe anyone would actually do what they say they're doing.

I never heard of architect, Louis Kahn, until this documentary. In this almost two hour documentary which goes very quickly, his son, Nathaniel Kahn, explores his father's life from Estonia to the slums of North Philadelphia to the University of Pennsylvania in West Philadelphia where he studied and taught. He travels to Bangladesh, Israel, Connecticut, Trenton, and La Jolla, California as well as New York City to explore his father's creative genius. Personally, Louis Kahn had three families including his wife, Esther, who refused to give him a divorce and their daughter Sue Ann.

A well written screenplay. A moving story showing the middle class English at it's best. Some great acting by Tom Wilkinson and Emily Watson. Tom Wilkinson is one of Britain's best actors. He knows how to be subtle and honest. Emily Watson is an actress I was not familiar with, but to her credit she does a great job of playing the ****** wife. The director, Julian Fellowes did not succumb to the typical Hollywood gimmicks to give the film some meaty storyline. It has not over dramatized it's portrayal of the English middle class.

I was watching an NFL game and started surfing during a break and found this on one of the HBO websites. I wasn't really impressed with it, but at least they let me watch it anyway. I didn't give this film a fair chance in my initial viewing, thinking it to be rubbish. I know what some of you might be thinking - "that's not true! It's got good reviews!" Perhaps you are right, if you have any opinion at all. I can't see why anyone would feel the need to heap so much negative energy onto this film.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort, and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This patriotic and propagandist picture is part of his contribution, although the war was nearly over by the time of its release. The tramp goes to war, humorously accomplishes acts of heroism and kicks the Kaiser in the bum. It's a very funny film, although I don't think it nearly one of his best. It's with 'A Dog's Life' as his better output for First National before he made his early masterpiece 'The Kid.'

Made at the height of the Black Power movement, this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope (Arnold Johnson) getting made CEO of a corporation after the white CEO dies (the white executives all hate each other and can't decide who should succeed the previous CEO). Once in power, he decides to turn it into a militant organization.I don't know how Robert Downey Sr did it, but he did it! "Putney Swope" is the ultimate jab at America's power structure. It's the sort of thing that seems like it would have come out of Richard Pryor's mind.

These critics need to find a new job!!! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY, which has made history. It illustrates beautifully how even in the mist of war and tragedy love can conquer all. The breathtaking Chephallonia of Greece has captured my heart and soul as if I too were there. The Blue eyed Cage & the delightful Cruz were amazing! Together they perfectly portrayed how a Mediterranean couple can only become closer in the time of war. This movie will touch your heart like it did mine you must go see it!!! !

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The film captures and interprets his artistic method ('sketching' poems), his inspiration (the spirit of nature and its fantastic beauty) and his struggles to accept a harsh reality in the face of his idealist imagination.The film integrated excerpts of Miyazawa's poems into the plot beautifully. His relationships with his students was powerful, especially in one scene where he offers everything he has to a student who has just been caught stealing materials from the classroom.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce their own TV shows? If I had to guess, it's because there is a large population of talented people out there who really love what they do. There are also a lot of great writers out there who have found that they can get more exposure if they write about something that isn't going to immediately make them a million bucks (see The Walking Dead). I feel sorry for this guy! He should've known better, but he still went ahead and tried his hand at television.

'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' is a fantastic film in itself. It is nothing like the book, which may disapoint its ardent followers. Yet, viewed on it's own, the film is a masterpiece. The views are spectacular and the acting isn't too bad either!! Nicolas Cage was brilliant-so different from his usual action hero type characters. Penelope cruz is superb and really holds the film together. I think that this film has to be judged as an indivdual project-not related to the book. Louis de Bernieres gave up rights to the film script, so the film is an interpretation of the director, john maddon.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and more than reasonable elucidation for the genre. Personally I think he has been unfairly maligned throughout his career as an aesthete of gore. It's a pretty capable procedural and surprised me with its subtextually rich narrative that shows his distrust for small minded small-town mentality and the inefficiency of the police, as well as the twisted ideals of the Catholic church, the last of which seemed to have cut this film at its knees when it was first released and could have possibly given the director another direction so early on.

(Some spoilers included:)Although, many commentators have called this film surreal, the term fits poorly here. To quote from Encyclopedia Britannica's, surreal means:"Fantastic or incongruous imagery": One needn't explain to the unimaginative how many ways a plucky ten-year-old boy at large and seeking his fortune in the driver's seat of a red Mustang could be fantastic: those curious might read James Kincaid; but if you asked said lad how he were incongruous behind the wheel of a sports car, he'd surely protest, "NO way!"

I saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it . Since then I 've searched high and low for the director's cut (as I'm sure you've done, too) only to find no such title. So, I am going to write this review right here: Don't bother looking up a copy of the director's cut. Go rent it. This is one of the worst movies ever made. One of those things you see once in a lifetime and then there is nothing left to talk about. It's not even funny anymore!

I wonder why I have n't heard of this movie before . It 's truly a magnificent comedy ( I don't think I am exaggerating when I say it ) and well worth seeing.It is not perfect, for example the two actors seem to be in such bad form as to make one wonder about their sanity, but there are lots of wonderful moments throughout the film and the end result is just as wonderful as the beginning. The acting was excellent, and the script was original and fun. If anyone wants to spend an evening at the Movies, go see it.

where do we go from here ? that is the overriding question of this film . And make no mistake - this is a terrible piece of filmmaking. What happened to all the good ideas and great characters ? I must say I was disappointed by this movie. This is not what I expected out of it! I've been watching "Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country" every Friday night, but I just can't bear to see those two films. So I gave this film a try. However, I was very much hoping for some real twists and surprises.

`` I am ... proud of 'Head ' , '' Mike Nesmith has said . He should be , because he's a master of this type of screenplay. I was disappointed by the end, but that is not the problem here.It is just a really boring movie about two guys who live in a small town and have some weird adventures. If it were made today we'd probably have a lot more interesting dialog. The plot is so unbelievably bad that I can't even begin to imagine what would happen to someone with any sense if they saw it.

I thought this was movie was great , Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie . It is very funny and you will really enjoy the scene when they are kissing . Also, I am a big fan of comedies. They are not made to be acted or directed but it is interesting to watch. This movie sucked me in from the first second i saw it and i didn't like it for one second. There were some good points that i liked about the film. The characters were well developed and believable.

Gary Busey 's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography . Since had a musical background , he was able to get into the script with ease, and there's some very good music in it . This movie is just awful. If you have any interest in cinema, then I'd recommend watching this. You may be more interested in reading my book about film than watching this movie.I've seen worse movies in theaters and on video. The main problem with this movie is that it is nothing more than a glorified ad for McDonald's.

It's up there with Where's Poppa, The Groove Tube, Putney Swope. It memorializes the NY city mind set of the period, a wonderfully strange man with a bizarre plan, hoist by by own petard, and at last retreating into the bed of his adoptive parents. Totally absurd, its the life one sees through the magic glasses, seeing things as they "really are"... I don't think it is ever shown anymore. If so, surely someone would Tivo the thing and put it out there.

Oh my gosh!! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is so incredible......I loved it as a wee babe and still love it as an adult. It is my favorite Disney movie of allllllllllllllllllllllllllllll time! You should watch it, watch it and love it. My friends and I watch it a ton.....It is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo good. I recommend it to anyone who is a child or a child at heart.

Even after nearly 20 years apart, the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing. In this concert, they perform their best songs from their heyday (1970-1978), including "N.I.B. ", "War Pigs", and "Paranoid".Also included is priceless backstage footage with interviews and retrospectives into their days as the top hard rock band on the planet. The comments of Ozzy, Tony Iommi, Geezer Butler, and Bill Ward are just as interesting and intriguing to watch as the fabulous onstage performances.A must-see for all Sabbath and Ozzy fans.

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I'm dying to see it again one more time before I... well.. you know. The interaction between the main characters after the Tiger (Eli Wallach) "captures" his prey (Anne Jackson) in a botched kidnapping attempt is absolutely hilarious. Charles Nelson Reilly's portrayal of a neurotic university dean(?) or department head is priceless. How many films can you name which are able to illuminate humanity's struggle for meaning and fulfillment by making you laugh from beginning to end?

The writers of lost have outdone themselves. Season two's finale is even more heartbreaking and intense than the finale for season one. Locke's lack of faith has not only resulted in spiritual consequences for himself, but in tragic physical consequences for the lives of the other castaways. Michael's betrayal resulted in a success for him but can he possibly escape the island? He will have to if he wants to stay alive. I don't doubt that one or more of his former friends would be willing to kill him in revenge.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004's Academy Awards, My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to find out about his father, the legendary architect Louis I Kahn. Lou Kahn died in 1974, when Nate was 11 years old, leaving behind an incredible but limited body of work, unpaid debts and three separate families all living within a few kilometres of each other. My Architect follows Kahn's life through chronologically examining his buildings, and interspersing their beauty with the story of a charismatic, but selfish and emotionally immature genius.

I saw this film at the Seattle International Film Festival in a full house of avid movie buffs and Indian ex-pats. The film is amazingly beautiful and smooth flowing for a first film. The direction is self assured, especially with locals who were recruited on the fly for extras and bit parts. While the plot and story line is elementary to nonexistent, the pleasures of watching the performances and scenery offset the lack. The soundtrack to this film is a big attraction to world music lovers. If you want to see what can be done in 45 days, with a different location every day, check out Hari Om for inspiration.

Oh my word!! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or consideration for anything other than the death of the scum! Michael Winner here makes a valid observation of human desires in displaying a gung-ho troth world of deep and damaged execution. Not only does he spoon feed us with utter hell on earth seen through the face of the moustached Bronson, but he also shows us the spoon he's feeding us with and says "look at what your watching now look at your self and ask the question: Are you enjoying this?"

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I've just managed to watch this film for the second time in nearly twenty years, and I can honestly say it hasn't lost any of its kick. I can't believe that Channel 4 have let this one vanish without a trace as it is an extremely powerful, moving and moralistic take on the consequences of misplaced loyalty. It focuses on a clique of friends over the course of ten years and their relationship with two 'outsiders' from school; specifically how they use one and mercilessly torment the other.

No , I have not seen the original series and I wo n't compare the two if I had .I did however see the remake which i was so excited to see. Unfortunately this time it was a mess. The director tried to make me care about the main characters but didn't really succeed in that regard. This film, like its predecessor (aside from the title itself) is awful. It is obviously made by some people who do not understand their subject matter or how it relates to life. It also lacks any substance whatsoever.

Hey look, you don't watch this movie to change your life! But if you are female especially and have always had a little thing for Richard Gere; this movie is right up your street. Diane Lane and Richard Gere have on screen chemistry going way back. 'Nights in Rodanthe' is not a Oscar winner movie and it will probably be forgotten sooner rather than later but if you want an atmospheric, beautifully shot love story between MIDDLE AGED good looking people (they don't make your stomach turn and even when Gere is 'on top' he does not look too jowly) then this is the movie for you.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job. He apparently received no credits. Too bad.All the Dead End Kids do their jobs beautifully in this 1939 entry. It is odd to watch them in a Western setting with their Brooklyn accents ( I guess that should be Bowery ). They even show some swimming abilities.I think there are many special scenes that can stay with the viewer of this boxing/love/crime story. My favorite right now is in the fight scene near the end of the film.

I saw this movie on it's opening night, and enjoyed it. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I hadn't been sitting by my father. My father saw the original (unfortunately, I have not seen it yet) and kept talking through the whole thing. He kept saying that the movie sucked, and that it was stupid. The thing is, he didn't understand that the creators were slightly making fun of the horror genre with the film. In every horror movie, there is always a certain character depicted.

Really , This movie should be released to DVD . I just got a bootleg copy of what I think it was supposed to be , and this is the worst possible movie. The only reason I give it 2 stars is the music . It's not great (maybe because I have never heard it) but it has its moments . But, when you're trying to make a bad movie sound like a good one, everything else goes out of the window. A couple friends of mine went to see an old B-movie with this film as the tagline.

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family 's journey from the Old World ( Italy ) to the new world ( New York ) . It has all the ingredients of a good thriller, but I was not expecting much more than a decent action flick. This movie is one of those movies that you just know will fail. The entire premise is ridiculous - an Italian man travels to America in order to find his wife and son who are both dead. In the course of his travels he gets involved in various illegal activities with local drug dealers, thugs and police.

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? I just watched it with friends and laughed out loud when the lead character is shot in the face. This movie could be summed up in a single word--disgusting. Let's start with the plot: Jekyll & Hyde is based on two real life patients who were victims of an experiment that allowed them to live as their opposites for years. The actors are so far over-the-top in this piece that they are actually trying to look like people, which doesn't work well.

I have to offset all the terrible comments. I love this movie. I own the movie and the soundtrack. I watch it whenever I need a pick me up. Granted it's not like the Sound of Music but it's as much fun if picking at movies is not your thing. I adored the late (and great) Bobby Vann, and James Shigeta has always and will always be a favorite. I saw this when it first came out in the theaters. I'm a big musical fan and this one is 100 times better than Twiggy in "The Boyfriend".

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling. The story, set in New York at the time of World War II, has all the makings of being good film. In fact it is very well done. But what's really going on isn't just a plot line; it's an intriguing combination of historical events and social commentary. It is impossible to put this film down. I couldn't believe my eyes when the screen went blank. After a couple of minutes I could only imagine the movie would go on for another 10-15 minutes.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn 's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect. He's trying to prove that there is something inside him that cannot be contained. The problem is that we see it only as a projection of his personality. I thought I was going to hate this movie. I've seen it a couple dozen times, but each time, it has been so much worse than the last. There's no plot and no mystery. It just keeps repeating the same bad lines over and over.

Containing Billy 's famous humor , this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure , pleasantly refreshing to anyone who has not encountered Billy in the past. The characters are still great but the plot and dialogue are very light-hearted and easy going. If you like good camp, you should take a hard look at this movie! It takes place during the American War for Independence (1861) and follows the story of two young soldiers: George "Old Baldy" Tarrant (Tarrant, as he is best known, played by Jack Palance) and Jim "Hickory" Davis (Spencer Tracy).

If you get a chance to get a hold of this lost (for many years) gem, I doubt you will be disappointed. PS has an odd blend of social satire and ultra-cool blaxploitation-- even hints of slapstick, but it's so odd that it was not only ahead of it's time, nothing has been seen like it since.I strongly disagree with people who say that the film is dated, especially with Spike Lee's "Bamboozaled" (SP?) a few years back which was a misfire of trying to capture the same message. (Good filmmaking, disjointed script.

The Child's Play series isn't a favourite of mine, but Bride Of Chucky is actually an okay movie. This time we have two dolls Chucky and his former girlfriend (when he was human) Tiffany. Together they go on a journey to find an object. There are a few interesting scenes through the movie like the guy getting hit by the truck and literally exploding, the sex scene between Chucky and Tiffany and the ending which allows for another sequel to take place. Wasn't really a straight forward horror, it mixed a lot of comedy and was a sort of spoof of the horror genre.

I usually give horror films around 6/10 , but this one caught my eye . House of Wax was by all accounts an excellent B movie, I just didn't see it in the same way as many other people did. It started off pretty strong, and ended up being more of a slow burn to me than anything else. That said it was a very interesting and well-shot movie, and for that we should be grateful. This isn't even a great movie. This is simply a horrible piece of crap.

After spotting the boat at the end of the previous episode ( `` Three Minutes '' ) , the survivors found themselves stranded on a deserted island in the South Pacific, where they eventually had to make their escape by climbing into the boat and attempting to swim across a river to freedom. In this installment, however, we finally get an explanation of how that happened. I have watched this entire show with my eyes wide open and I cannot believe what I'm watching. The acting is terrible. This show is so bad that it should be shown on a cable network.

Always enjoyed `` DOA '' ,1950 , which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film . Dennis Hopper did his best in the role although there were a few problems. Very funny movie, with an old school feel to it. It's got a good sense of comedy, but not as sharp as the more recent films. The acting is OK, so that should be nothing to fret about. The problem comes when you find yourself trying to figure out whether all of the characters are supposed to be from the same town, or whether some of the people in the story are just really weird.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film , The Life of Jimmy Dolan, which was made for little money (around $4 million) with the sole purpose of turning him into a bankable star. The script is by Paul Schrader who has since gone on to write some of the finest crime thrillers ever produced. "The Man Who Knew Too Much" is one of my absolute favorite movies ever. It is not only a very good piece of cinema, it also has all the ingredients of a great thriller.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a museum is a stupid, spoiled brat. In addition to not understanding basic facts like gravity and relativity, those who are foolish enough to try this on for real (which I have no idea what it does) are the epitome of life's most annoying idiots. These people must be given an ice-cream cone or something as a punishment for their stupidity. It's just plain embarrassing. This film should be seen by every sane person in America.

I don't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch while I did. I got so engrossed I gave up working to just sit and finish watching the last half hour uninterrupted. And I sure don't usually shed tears over this sort of show, but I was crying at the end. A lot of emotional nuance. Great acting, and good southern feel. John Corbett is one of the most talented actors out there, and the guy who played Luke was really good too. Highly recommend.

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David . It's an interesting concept, though the film has too many holes in the story. In the first place, the movie is never explained where the monster is going. Why it came down here or how it can be so far away from the coast isn't explained. I'm not a big fan of this kind of "buzzkill" movies. I don't really think I have ever seen a movie that was worse than this one.

When the new Outer Limits first started, the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging. As the series began to wind down, most of the episodes became just plain ugly and devoid of any entertainment value. The six episodes here reflect the very best, and worst, of the series.Since The Outer Limits always preaches a moral. I would like to offer my own. Starting with the most entertaining to the flops.1. Afterlife: As an institution, The U.S.A. military-industrial complex is both evil and paranoid, not to mention plain stupid.

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war. The rain, the mud, the explosions - all these things are present but Chaplin seems strangely oblivious to them all. He's in France for one thing: to fight the Germans, something he does with unbelievable success.It almost seems like an extended ego trip for Chaplin - a very funny one, at that - until the final minute when it rises to a new level of poignancy and everything makes sense.Perhaps it's what all soldiers dream of before the go to war.

James Franco is totally cool in this movie . Not just handsome and charismatic but genuinely open and vulnerable in a way that he is never on film. He doesn't appear to be under the impression that anyone is looking at his face, or that he knows what is going on, or that he has to pretend like he isn't seeing anything. His eyes don't look fake or contrived. I saw this as I was taking a nap in bed during the weekend. I had been reading some reviews here and there about it and decided that it should be worth a try.

Just as in "Columbo" we see the fatality occur right at the beginning. What follows is an escalating web of lies, sex, blackmail, and murder. The investigating officer, Adam Arkin, is even somewhat of a fumbler, not unlike "Columbo". It is William H. Macy, as the movie critic suspect who carries the film. Constantly twisting and turning, the plot sends Macy deeper and deeper into the quicksand of his "perfect crime". William H. Macy fans will enjoy "A Slight Case Of Murder", as will those who like crime capers with all kinds of delicious possibilities.

Before I forget, let me say the artwork in here is outstanding. From garbage cans to the huge cruise ship, the drawings are beautifully done. If this wasn't animated, critics would be lauding the "direction" in here, because it's really good.To the story: Sylvester is picking through the garbage at the shipyards but the pickins' are slim. While brooding at the dock next to a big ship, in a porthole he spots Tweety in his cage. Tweety spots him, too, and you know his first comment - the same one he always makes when he spots the cat.

When I first saw this movie , I also expected `` our boys '' to be cute , and more importantly they are funny. But as you watch this movie , I realized it is really a cheesy movie . What the hell? How on earth can you call this an enjoyable flick with such bad acting, so many plot twists that make no sense, characters that just have no redeeming value and some of the most poorly written and acted characters I've seen in my whole life. The only reason I give it four stars is due to its ridiculousness.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of "L'Anticristo"(1974),this one begins with a brilliantly-handled sequence involving a priest,a little girl,and a broken doll.However the main story is about maniac(David Warbeck)marrying a traumatized cripple to kill her for her money.The plot,whilst not original,is really suspenseful,the acting is good and there are several skillful and gory murders.The score by Francesco de Massi is quite effective,some of which can also be heard in Lucio Fulci's "The New York Ripper"(1982).Highly recommended for fans of Italian cinema!

What 's the point of this messages if not to discuss and share thoughts about the next season ... Here's hoping there are no spoilers. I would rather see that show end, than have people keep thinking "I'm so sad he's going to die". The episode was incredibly disappointing. In my opinion, the first 2 episodes were fine, but this third episode fell flat. The story line was just too contrived. It didn't even make any sense as to why we needed to know where each character was going with it.

You know , people who make comedies so often forget it 's really ok to be outrageous . Well , I did that in this movie and I never saw any of that funny side. It's all about a guy who wants to have a good time on his college trip with his friends but then meets a girl that turns him into an outcast . But as soon as their relationship starts, things get serious. It's okay to be ridiculous. The problem is if you are being silly or off-color. You can't play both.

Is this a good movie ? It 's hard to say -- but in 1953 , for many people , such as me , it really was ! In the 1930's there was not one, but two major Hollywood film studios: Paramount and Walt Disney . But neither studio released any successful movies in the mid-1940's. They had no films to make. Both studios were running out of money at the same time so they started making low budget films that nobody saw or cared about. That is how "Duck Soup" was born.The original title was "Odd Couple."

Coming from the `` druggie '' generation , I thought this movie was hilarious . It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde back into fashion. If you have read the book, you know exactly what's going to happen. One of the worst movies I've seen in quite a while. The cast was terrible and the script wasn't even close to being as bad as it looked. This was a "bad guy" type story where they were trying to outdo themselves by doing something really evil. It just didn't pay off at all.

As many of today's movies are guilty of, the plot isn't exactly stellar, the movie doesn't move anyone, and certainly this won't warrant any award (outside of Blockbusters' perhaps)...but then again, who really cares.Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro team up to produce a very funny, at times hilarious, movie that I really enjoyed. Russo and Shatner played their small parts well as well. Man, I hope in the future my wife ages as well as Miss Renee has.Moving along, this "buddy" cop-flick produces high laughs in a reasonable amount of time.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji , a Japanese poet and writer who was active in both the 19th century and early 20th. I have just returned from the BFI film festival in London, which I've been to with my son once before last. As usual, I did not get to spend a whole day with all of the wonderful films being shown, but there were very few that struck me as particularly bad.The only one that really kept me awake for longer than 2 hours was 'Vampire Smile'.

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an elderly couple in a home invasion, I don't know but this was my least favorite installment in the series. I bought this movie mainly because I had heard that it was "good" and that it was being remastered. Well, what can I say? How bad can it be? The plot is so awful and unbelievable, that I found myself laughing hysterically out loud at the end. Not only that, but every time I tried to laugh, I would go completely limp.

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline. I go to the movies as an escape, to leave everything behind and enjoy a "story". I found this to be a good movie, not great, but good. It was worth my money and my tears :)Diane Lane was wonderful as always, Richard Gere isn't an over-actor. He held his own and has a certain presence that we always come to expect. He brings his own style to the movie.I think it was the kind of love story that doesn't always get told.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie. I am not saying this lightly. I love movies and am fairly picky about them (my home DVD collection is over 9,000 movies - some are great, others are OK, a few I do not like at all). And, to all those with criticisms: this is a comedy. I simply love this movie. It is light, funny, and very restful. I am aware of all (or most) of the deficiencies but I love it.

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply . I 've been looking all over and i haven't seen it here or there . This film has had its ups and downs. It was really good for the 90 minutes in which it appeared on television. But it did get so bad in the last few minutes, when it became even worse. As an example, if you don't understand what is going on, then you can't watch it.If you want to understand the plot of this film, then be prepared to have your mind blown!

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in the early 19th century (and still very present). If I were a black man living at the time, my first reaction would be "Why would anyone want to watch this crap?". Why even bother? In all honesty, there was absolutely no redeeming value. The actors did not act on any level beyond what they were paid to do. All of them were as bad as it gets.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos either. Ali G Indahouse is a hilarious laugh-a-second fun fest - just like on the small screen. He has lost none of his character or stupidity at all, and behind all that - none of the film is brainless fluff either. A human side to Ali is revealed during the film, the idea of Ali G running for PM is a brilliant, fresh and funny one - and the incessant stupidity of Staines' gangster man is mixed well with the stern, harsh world that is politics.

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an Italian Officer and a Greek Villager in an honourable story: "Captain Correli´s Mandolin", just escapes me! Witness: a wobbly, inconsistent accent by Cage amid horrendous over-acting, with Cruz -- more adequately cast as a spoiled Latino opposite Johnny Depp in "Blow" -- in basically a repeat performance under the guise of a Greek nurse... ay, it was painful. But there were saving graces.The story itself is thrilling-to-tragic, and Cage does have some (-- redeeming, this is !--) musical ability.

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.Thing is when they all go missing she goes into the woods to look for them.When she does she meets a guy who takes her back home.There is a little bit of nudity though I think it is a little overdone, I thought it might be a little too close to some of the earlier movies in this series.The movie is kind of sad and dark but I thought it would be funny so that is probably why it made it. This movie was pretty good.

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally , at the end of the 1960 's. The director (James Dean) was able to convince a decent cast of well-known characters to play parts they would never have fit into the original version of the story. My first ever horror movie! It starts out with a small town being threatened by an alien spaceship. There are lots of stories about what's going on, but there isn't enough info for the audience to really believe in them all.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly ( 1936-59 ) . He does have a lot of great acting skills but he can't quite match the film's other star, Charlie Sheen. Sheen's performance is pretty good but it just doesn't get near as much credit as Busey's. What kind of movie would this be called if it wasn't such an awful waste of time and money? I feel bad for anyone who thought it was going to be one of the most original and entertaining films ever made.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie . She was only 19 when she got the part. The director thought she should show off more. He even went to great lengths to change her dress so that it wouldn't look too "cutesy". After seeing this movie, I am left disappointed. The actors were not gifted enough for my taste. As an avid reader, I would expect better acting and dialog. There are no real twists or revelations. This movie fails to make any sense.

This Oscar-winning short film ( 40 minutes ) , based on a short story by William Faulkner , takes us back in time to 1872, the year that Martin Luther King was assassinated. One of the funniest things about this film is that its premise consists entirely of racial stereotypes. It's one of those movies which are so stupid and bad that they have to be made. The only funny part is when some African-Americans insult an elderly white guy.The script is just awful. There are no clever lines here and it gets boring very quickly.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful reputation as the "Godfather Of Gore". Fulci's absolute greatest film, however, dates back to 1972 and, while it is definitely gritty and violent, it is not nearly as gory as many of his other films. "Non Si Sevizia Un Paperino" aka. "Don't Torture A Duckling" of 1972 is not only by far Fulci's greatest film, this tantalizing and utterly brilliant Giallo is one of the absolute highlights of the genre.

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for it. Nothing to do, not in the cinemas, nor on DVD neither on Blue ray. Absolutely nothing!!! How it's possible this could really happen??? The direction is IMPECCABLE, the story is intriguing and has been filmed in a very original way the music it's perfect and James Franco is hot as hell!! !Please release this master piece and allow it to have it's proper life!!!!!!!!!!

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time. Excellent original music, clever, heady...it's hard to be articulate about something this good. There isn't one character that you don't instantly love to watch- Myronex "Putney, there's trouble in the black room!" "My name is Rufus." The lines, thrown away left and right, are classics themselves, recalling Slapshot, Caddyshack, Anchorman, Repoman, Dolemite, any comedy whose dialog is not of the formulaic set-up punchline variety. "Putney, Myronex called you tasteless!"

If you expect that this movie is full of action and grabbing you from the start then don't watch it. But if you like those kind of meditative movies which stick in your mind for a while, until you get the details, then you will love it. Now don't get me wrong there is action and there are things going on just not in the usual way. Basically the plot is in a post-apocalyptic world where anyone fights in his (or their) way for survival. In this fight they lost the ability to speak...

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons, and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out. I must admit, season one is by far the most underrated season, and this is the most underrated episode in season one.The episode begins with the family playing a game of Scrabble to get Bart ready for an intelligence test he needs to take at school. He says the game is stupid and he doesn't want to play it, but he needs to. He spells out a word that angers Homer and he chases Bart around the house.

First of all, around the time I wrote this comment, I had already read what kittiwake-1 had written about this game and was confused. This is a video game and not an actual movie. I mean, I myself would choose a good Deniro movie or playing a video game any day. But, dude, what are you talking about? Now that I have that out of the way, let's move on, shall we? The video game adaption of Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon is, as you may have guessed, based on the movie of the same name.

I love this movie, though I don't like how they picture Egyptians, being an Egyptian citizen myself! that's why it earns an eight out of 10.The relationship between Augustin and the leopard is awkward, and of course because of loneliness and living in that cave for quite so long, he develops a kind of insanity and passion to that leopard.A very touching scene when the leopard dies, watch Augustin's reaction.. All in all I find it enjoyable, and I'm looking forward to reading the short story by Balzac.

* Could contain spoilers , read only after seeing last episode season 2 * Think about it . The guys have no reason to be on this island , there is no sense of mystery , why do they keep visiting the island ? I'm still trying to sort through all the awfulness of this movie. There's really nothing wrong with it except for the lack of a coherent plot. This is one of those movies that has no beginning or end. You either watch it, or you won't see anything good happen in the whole thing.

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall the movie is effective very effective it makes you question and leaves you thinking the story is kinda far fetched but is believable and makes you feel good in sequences, its not like its the usual done and tried path. the characters are pretty well defined and are convincing. Justin long stands out among all the others and watch out for his speech in the end he will convince anyone with that speech he is simply brilliant in that speech.

Great show! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps. Contestants range in ages, some seem old enough to have watched the movie when it first came out. And others, looked so young that perhaps parents or teachers handed down the movie hoping it would touch their lives the way it once touch them. Grease has truly become an American icon. Grease is a fun and entertaining movie in which the young and old can relate to. "You're The One That We Want" is sure to gain even more Grease followers.

Based on a William Faulkner short story, Two Soldiers is a top notch short film, a movie that has enough story, emotion and great cinematography for a feature film and definitely leaves you wanting more in the end. The story involves two dirt poor Mississippi brothers, one only a kid, the other old enough to volunteer for the war effort shortly after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The younger brother, played brilliantly by newcomer Jonathan Furr, doesn't want to let his older brother go, and he sets out on a quest to enlist in the Army himself.

Lucio Fulci's "Don't Torture a Duckling" paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by series of brutal murders of young boys.This surprisingly well-directed film(especially in comparison to later Fulci's gorefests)is distinguished by overall atmosphere of perversity,nastiness and two truly grotesque scenes of brutal violence.The soon-to-be-dead children are depicted as casually cruel and budding peeping toms;Bruno's near-seduction by the naked Patrizia(Barbara Bouchet)really has to be seen to be believed.Highly recommended-especially in pair with my another cult favourite "House with the Windows That Laugh"(1976).

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner's mansion in Paris. When the evil butler hears that the rich old lady is leaving everything in her will to the cats first, the butler is angered, because he wants to get everything first. So he puts them to sleep and abandons them off the side of the road. When the cats wake up, they start on a long trek home. A street wise cat named Thomas O'Malley meets up with them and offers to help them.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a football game or they don't want to leave their car "to get stripped" deserves whatever happens to them.The guy, Wade who "went to a barbershop and asked for the He-Man haircut" wasn't my type, but there's this really cute scene of him having his eyebrows and facial hair waxed. That's a little too high-maintenance for me. Also fun, but not my type is the fat guy in the big sunglasses who looks "like Elton John only gayer," but that whole plot goes nowhere!

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie (I have lived here my whole life), I have waited for this movie to come out. And I mean waited and waited and waited over a year and a half for this movie and to me, it was worth it.The movie is different from the book but in my eyes, it's still a beautiful piece of work as is the book. In both I cried, there were moments that tore me up. I laughed and I smiled just as much.

I wasn't expecting a great deal from this film, so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it and found it to be most noteworthy. It's noteworthiness is mainly due to the talent and appeal of it's star, John Garfield.Garfield plays Jack, a boxing star who is framed for murder. He must go on the run, and ends up out in the sticks with Gloria Dickson and the Dead End Kids. Here is offered a chance for redemption, yet will the past catch up with him yet? Garfield was an actor ahead of his peers.

He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song, and now the terrific Justin Lee Collins wanted to reunite the cast members and maybe some crew of one of his favourite TV shows as a kid, The A-Team. The only member he wouldn't be able to get was the late great George Peppard who played main character Col. John "Hannibal" Smith, but he did get some kind of psychic to try and help. He did manage to reunite all members including Dirk Benedict (Lt. Templeton "Faceman" Peck #2) who went to Celebrity Big Brother in 2007, Dwight Schultz (Capt.

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen . Clearly not that many because it only gets two minutes on IMDB. When you do watch the movie, be sure you know who the actors and actresses are based on their voices and body language. This is one of the most boring, low-class, over-acting films I've ever seen. It's just so awful! I like to see movies from different eras. Usually I find myself in a movie theater where my parents are watching Star Wars. However, some of these movies have aged much more badly than others.

One of the most magnificent movies ever made. The acting of Charles Buchinski (later known as Bronson) is simply outstanding. This is the crown on the career of director Winner, who himself was often quoted saying this was his masterpiece. The plot has been copied many times, but it's never been topped. Wildey J. Moore, the gun manufacturer, many times claimed his brand's growth since the mid 80s can be fully credited to DW3, and rightly so. This is not just a movie, this is art that many generations will admire and appreciate.

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times. I taped it in about 1987 when it was shown on Channel Four but my tape is severely worn now and I would love a new copy of it.I have e-mailed Film Four to ask them to show it again as it has never been available on video and as far as I know hasn't been repeated since the 80's. I have had no reply and it still hasn't been repeated. The performances are superb. The film has everything. Its funny,sad,disturbing,exciting and totally takes you back to school days.

At first I didn't think I would like this movie, but as it progressed it became better and better. I love music and I was impressed with how well Cage could fake the movements of playing a mandolin. My son was with me and he also like the movie a lot for its music and the story and the way the story unfolded--- slowly showing how Corelli won the girls heart. The acting and the story were both well done and well directed. At first Corelli's bravado was irritating, but soon he grew on you.

I can not say this movie was a hilarious , but I must have had a grin on my face while watching it because i cannot imagine how someone could hate it so much. This film was the worst thing I've seen in years. The acting was terrible. The plot was weak. There wasn't a moment where anything made sense, and yet the story was more stupid than funny. Even the script was awful. I really felt for the characters. It was just such a slap in the face that you almost want to punch somebody in the face.

This is a 100% improvement over the dross of a third movie and it's one hell of a good time. This is a John Hughes movie meets The Devil's Rejects. I really enjoyed this movie and it really stands out as the savior of the series. I thought Jennifer Tilly played Tiffany really well and Brad Dourif in Chucky's shoes once again really makes this movie shine. Actually they're the only good parts of the movie. I got rather bored with Katherine Heigl and Nick Stable's scenes. It's as if they were thrown in there as a sidetrack and someone to save the day.

To say the truth , I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor . If I didn't know him as an actor and a human being, I'd still be thinking "I don't believe this could possibly happen!" The film was not worth watching. First of all, it looks like it was made by someone who did not care about making good films. The acting was abysmal; one would have expected more from a bad script written by someone who has never worked on a serious project or done a scene with a bunch of people before.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments on this planet. Being a staggering five years in the making, one would be hard-pressed to expect any less. I did get the impression that some scenes from the first episode where repeated in the latter ones, which is naturally only a minor gripe.David Attenborough is great as a narrator and comments are informative, leaving enough room for one's imagination, and well spaced out, so that viewers get plenty of time to reflect upon the breathtaking imagery.

This movie got better with time. I can't believe that it has been forty years since I saw this at the age of 15. Yes, that's right. Movie ratings were not yet a reality, so any teenager could walk into any movie. Imagine what it was like for a kid my age to see both Midnight Cowboy and Putney Swope in the same year. Imagine the times. Bobby Kennedy and Martin Luther King has just been killed but the following summer had a man walking on the moon and Woodstock. Putney Swope was the Woodstock nation's chance to stick it to the man.

I thought that the storyline came into place very well . I liked this movie a lot . If you are looking for a good thriller then definitely watch this movie. This is one of the worst films I have ever seen, and i'm not making that claim lightly. What an absolute disaster! Not only was the story so awful, the acting was as bad, or worse, than the script. The two leads were so pathetic, the only reason why I kept watching until the end was my curiosity to see how far they had fallen.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen! The images that are shown are absolutely breathtaking and stunning. On top of that, it is a wonderful learning experience. I'm not one for educational documentaries, but this one grabs hold of you and doesn't let go until the end. You'll be so hooked and entranced by what you are watching that you'll forget your at home watching TV! This series is available to buy on DVD and I HIGHLY recommend picking this one up!

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old , I adore AristoCats . It is my second all time favorite show and its even better on DVD so you can find the episodes in a single sitting without having to rewind and watch them again. My only regret is that there aren't more original stories in this show. The main characters are great but don't get me started on the storyline. This is probably the WORST cartoon ever made. You could go to any amusement park and see people running around jumping out of their cars, shooting at each other, breaking things, etc.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from! For once she was bang on! What a superb film! First of all I was convinced James McAvoy & Romola Garai were Irish so convincing were their accents; and by half way through the film I was utterly convinced Steven Robertson was a disabled actor and pretty sure James McAvoy was also! When I watched the special features on the DVD and saw both actors in their 'normal' guise, to say I was blown away would be an understatement!!!

I saw this film at the Seattle International Film Festival in a full house of avid movie buffs and Indian expats. I thought it had good potential and enjoyed seeing the film, but as soon as the credits rolled I decided to walk out of the theater.The problem is that the plot doesn't make any sense. In fact, the film goes out of its way to do the opposite of what it's trying to accomplish. What makes it all the worse is that the cast are just awful. The whole thing was terrible.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before, should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse' Although I prefer Ali G when he is interviewing the rich and famous, his brand of completely off the wall comedy definitely entertains from start to finish on the big screen too.Ridiculous plot, ridiculous characters and a ridiculous script, that all make this film a riot for fans of Ali G.If you've seen him and didn't like him then avoid this film like the plague, because it's definitely just more of the same; for everybody else - watch it Aiiii!

Can the intensity of a husband's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime,despite betrayal on many levels? Tom Wilkinson is no brutal Othello, in the setting of modern day England. So, gradually a web of deceit begins to be woven. And, we witness cycles of jealousy and drunkenness and guilt and fornication. And so the web of "separate lies" begins to fail and then hold together again. And life (and death) goes on, despite the bright flame of the husband's love and the deep despair and guilt woven into so many lives.

At one time ` Buddy Cop ' movies ruled the box office . It seemed that every summer flocks of Hollywood types were going on a vacation, and this made them even more excited when they came back to town. When they got back, there was no longer any movie theatres in Los Angeles, but everyone went to their home movies which were rented at the movie theaters. They didn't just rent them; they watched them all the time with other friends. The only problem was that these movies didn't have a lot of funny lines either.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange. I was confused, sad and happy in the same moment. I guess that too less people will pay attention to this movie. But I hope that at least a few will see it and get something out of it. The story of two friends, linked by their suffers of bodily disability, whom (as a team) beat the medical well-fare system and fight for their rights. This movie shows a side which some of us would never understand, not too exaggerated but emotional presented.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I've ever seen. Not only it's the mother of coincidence, but also every time that you think you can set up the whole puzzle in your head, the story takes a completely new direction.Take this casualty for example, The US marine, whom gives Sayid the way to become a Torturer, Is Clancy Brown, playing a character named Joe Inman. In the last episode, he is playing Kelvin Inman, the Desmond partner in the Hatch. Destiny, uh?

This is a funny movie . The Bob & Eddie Show feel of it could lead to a sequel but the plot isn't really connected to the show. When I first heard about the film I thought it must be some kind of "bad" rip-off and was disappointed because it was just not bad. Instead, I found it to have a few moments that made it memorable, but nothing that set it apart from others out there. This is probably the worst thing ever to be made in Hollywood, and this is no exception.

This movie is true action at its finest, It doesn't get any better then this. This is one of those movies that you can just kick back and watch some real good non stop shooting and killing plus there are some excellent lines to go along with all of this. My favorite is there is a one bad guy who is breaking into this old couples home and he is stealing a TV or something and he goes right up to them and yells "I will come in here anytime i like!!!" and right before he jumps out the window he yells "Anytime!!!"

A very weird , psychedelic , esoteric , ( and did I say weird ? : ) experience.But on at the end it turned out OK, but not really. The only thing of interest in this movie is that they filmed it in New York. They filmed it right next to Madison Square Garden! This film is just so bad, I don't know why you're still watching it. My friends and I went to an after party a couple of weeks ago and we sat around trying to decide on which movie we wanted to watch together.

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time. Quickly the movie grabbed me with the depth of the characters and subtle plot. I was quite surprised to see that the rating given by my satellite provider did not show any stars.I will not give any spoilers to the plot-line or outcome but most of the characters had at least some redeeming value. Until the very last minute I did not know how it would turn out. Frequently, you can pick-up the formula and predict a story direction.

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918 . In fact , it looks like an earlier version of the same type of movie that was made about three decades later.I would have to say it is a total waste of my time to even try to find something positive about this film. For anyone who's never seen it, here it is: It's probably the single most tedious and stupid piece of trash ever made. The only reason I bought it was because I wanted to see it, not because I thought it was entertaining.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh: as the Monkees reduce their entire career to a one-minute TV commercial about dandruff! See: the 50 foot Victor Mature try to figure out what the heck he's doing in this film! Hear: Frank Zappa (with his pet cow on leash) tell Davey Jones "Your music is awfully white"! Experience: the Monkees' only live performance as a real rock band play the honest-to-gosh first-ever real punk-rock song (Circle Sky)! Listen: as Davey Jones sings a Harry Nielsen song about having a transsexual father!

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard (Beau Travail), Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem that follows the journey of a peasant family from their primitive home in Sicily to Ellis Island in New York at the turn of the century. It is a surreal, enigmatic, often strange, but ultimately deeply rewarding experience. Interweaving dreamlike and symbolic imagery with gritty realism, the latest film by Emanuele Crialese (Respiro) is like an impressionistic painting - a cinematic artist's rendering of what the immigration process may have been like for our parents and grandparents.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency . Putney Swope is on the board for the firm, which has just been destroyed and its new owners are going to run it for them. After watching the video I couldn't wait for this movie to show up in theaters so I could rent it and see how bad it was. The first thing I noticed was the horrible acting. If you are familiar with Wes Craven's zombie movies you may know that he makes his zombies come across as more intelligent then the average person does.

My husband and I watched this last night ... It was wonderful .... For once he was wrong in guessing that the girl was on her period, but we got it right and were disappointed with the film. The plot was very weak and did not add anything to the movie. I'm gonna say this right off the bat: this is one of the most annoying movies I've ever seen. At first, it's funny. Then it becomes annoying. Then it begins to feel like a waste of time.

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature. Faulkner mostly wrote about life in the South particularly during the depression years. Many of his stories have been adapted to screen. Short stories like Two Soldiers is an endearing tale of two brothers in December 1941 after the attack on Pearl Harbor. The older brother, Pete Greer, goes to Memphis, Tennessee to enlist like hundreds of thousands of young men, some who would never come home. His younger brother doesn't take his departure well. He manages to get a bus ticket to Memphis without any money to find his brother.

I first saw "Signs of Life" on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation. It's a wonderfully written, ensemble production with terrific performances by Michael Lewis as Joey and Vincent D'Onofrio as his brother, Daryl. Arthur Kennedy, in one of his last roles, is also excellent as an aging shipbuilder whose family business is about to close. The rest of the cast which includes Beau Bridges, Kathy Bates and Mary-Louise Parker give remarkable clarity and substance to their characters.The direction is subtle and effective. I've watched this movie several times over the years and would very much recommend it.

A mix of 70's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line. As I've often said about this flick - if you don't get it - you're way lame.....
