Classic lines such as (parapharsed) "I've got this erection and it won't go away no matter how many times I do it. You're a nurse, what can you give me for it?" Nurse replies "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." Great sound track.The classic "Hyde's got nothing to hide".

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films , it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment . The film consists of a group of men who have been forced to live together for a few months before they decide to join forces. This is a really good piece of work. In terms of plot and characters, it can't get any better than that. There isn't enough to keep the viewer interested, and there were times when the story just didn't make any sense. It was hard to like this film even with all its problems (I'll admit that some people will love it).

Chucky is back but this time he is not scary ( a lot ) - but he is funny ! It may sound cheesy, but that isn't the reason why I didn't see this movie. For me this was the worst movie I had ever seen. There are too many scenes where the director seems to have no clue of what's going on and doesn't want to give an answer. The acting is good and it has some nice special effects, but if you like watching movies where the villain goes around doing bad things, or just plain weird stuff then you will definitely dislike this movie.

A Formula For Murder is n't a well known Giallo , but that is n't to say it 's not worth watching. It certainly isn't for everyone, but it is certainly worth the effort.The story is about an American woman who goes missing on her way back from a holiday in Portugal and turns up dead at a country resort after having been stabbed by her lover in revenge for his bad treatment of her. When I watched this movie last night I had a feeling that the director was trying so hard to make me laugh, that he didn't succeed.

In Tweety 's S.O.S , Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that's supposed to have been stolen by a group of drug smugglers. When his father gets involved in the smuggling plot, it turns out to be the same group as the one that originally stole the ship. I don't think that this movie had any merit; if there was something about it that was enjoyable, it was more than likely that it was because you enjoyed the fact that the characters and the situations were very much made-up.

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one! I watched it yesterday and i was presently surprised. The story is very good, but all the ignorant people would say "This sucks people cant fly!" to them i say IT'S FICTION and that it is. This is not to be taken as a film about reality you could say this is a "fairytale". And a very pleasant to watch Asian fairytale. The image's can actually blow your mind. Because there so artistically filmed , Ang Lee has a very (unapreciated u might say) big talent.

When his elderly mother Emily (Jeanne Bates) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier (Brion James) and turns into a cannibalistic monster, TV news reporter Clay Dwyer (Mark Thomas Miller) struggles to keep dear old mom from satisfying her hunger.Although the above plot summary conjures up images of trashy, over-the-top, 80s horror titles such as Flesheating Mothers and Rabid Grannies, Mom actually turns out to be a refreshingly original take on the werewolf/vampire/zombie mythos (exactly what Emily becomes is never really clear, but it ain't nice!

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans . Okay I 'm sure it 's not as good as the original but its still worth seeing.The plot is simple: a serial killer makes an innocent girl pregnant. The killer kills his victim after her father refuses to pay child support and takes away her son. I'm just going to start this off by saying that I never thought that Chucky would ever be a big enough hit to become a movie. I always pictured him as more of a bad TV show villain, or perhaps a slasher movie villain.

The last film by underrated director Alberto De Martino ( `` The Antichrist '' , `` The Killer is on His Deathbed ), this is one of those films that doesn't fit into any genre. The movie is a black and white suspense horror picture with a very interesting premise. I was intrigued by this documentary when I first heard it, as I felt like I had just seen something really special but didn't quite get the whole picture yet. This is exactly what happens to us when we spend too much time trying to understand "what's" going on while watching so-called reality tv shows.

I 've never seen the original `` House Of Wax '' so I really did n't know what to expect from this movie. The premise sounds good - a man wakes up out of a deep sleep in a strange town, goes off and has a fight with a monster, but all I got was some generic monster-fighting action! It's hard to describe this film as anything more than a cheesy 80s sci-fi/horror flick. You've got an old guy in his forties who thinks he's being chased by a bunch of evil goons on a small spacecraft.

This movie is beautiful in all ways. It is visually stunning, and this is a good thing since the dialogue would only take up a page or two of paper. The acting is superb; it is subtle, passionate and intense. Ben Daniels does a fabulous job of turning himself into an animal, and mixing that wild nature with a man's overbearing passion and honor. There is not one flaw, not one mistake or wrong moment to be found anywhere. It is completely perfect, but only if you understand what you're going to experience.

My impression, having seen this documentary, is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had before he made the film. He took five years to make it, a labour of love and longing. I can only imagine the turmoil of the editing process, what to leave in, what to take out. His father, the renowned architect Louis Kahn,comes across as a man too selfish and self-absorbed to be emotionally available to even one wife not alone three. But like many men of his character, he attracted women who were spellbound by the remoteness and entranced by the creativity.

I viewed the original Outer Limits in real time , when first broadcast and have since viewed the entire original series. I felt it was one of the best programs on television to date, and would not hesitate to watch it again if someone ever asked me to. I am now a huge fan of Dr. Who , which is my second favorite show. It's a pity this show has such a bad reputation--it is actually a great show. The only reason it hasn't made the list already is that there isn't really any other serious sci-fi or horror fare out there these days.

What a great film! I never knew much about Buddy Holly, but was familiar with his lively and fun music. This is a wonderful biography of someone who helped change the music in the 1950's. Although I never cared for Gary Bussey, he was fabulous as Buddy Holly! I don't know how accurate the movie is, but assume at least for the most part it is accurate, which makes the movie all the more interesting. The music throughout the movie just adds the pizazz to this biography. I don't think I would change a thing in this film, it was all good!

The `` all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring ... '' scene was a riot . I laughed out loud. The actors were funny but the script was not funny. Beware, it may be one of your worst movies. It is about an ex-cop who takes his daughter to a secluded beach in the Caribbean where she meets two men while he is away. One of these men wants to make a deal with the girl that will guarantee his freedom for the next 30 years. In exchange, he will allow her to live in his home.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative, but I loved this movie. I am a student of Asian art with a particular love of Korean art, culture and history. I thought this movie borough a very controversial and interesting character to life. Jang Seung-up is one of the (maybe the most) famous Korean artist and continues to be revered as a master. Given the tumult of the time in which he painted and his own conflicted nature, it is amazing that he produced so much work, in so many styles and with such skill.

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie . I caught it last night on TMC . The picture looks great , the acting is good but the writing is so bad, you can barely understand a word in most of the dialogs.The story starts out promisingly and with a decent cast of actors. They get to play a couple of cops who discover something very strange about their town when they go there to do some investigating. This movie is just plain bad! It's hard to put words to why this movie is such a joke.

A very weird, psychedelic, esoteric, (and did I say weird? :) experience.But on at least on one level - it did exactly what it was supposed to do. It bridged the gap between the silly, manufactured, Hollywood look at teen pop idols that was the Monkees TV program and the adult, musically growing and evolving, and yet still a little silly Monkees of the '70s and beyond.The most important line in the film is Mike Nesmith's, "If they think we are plastic now, wait till they see how we do it."

To experience Head you really need to understand where the Monkees were when they filmed it.This was as their series finale.The show had a lot of potential if it would have been directed properly but it was a complete farce. They should have put together a pilot episode and called it a day. When I saw this movie on DVD yesterday, I was surprised that no one said anything about it at the preview. Then I went to the video section and saw that someone had listed the movie as being in theaters. I guess that must mean it has gotten better over the years, although I don't think it did.

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious . Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull man looked like his head was on the chopping block. I've seen this movie three times now but have yet to find out what happens to it. First time I saw it, I actually thought it was a complete ripoff of "Karate Kid." This one just doesn't give me that same sort of fun. It's not as bad as "Fist of Fury," but it's not as good either. There isn't a lot going on in this one.

I am a guy , so i was very hesitant to watch the movie because i know that Richard Geary is a very bad director. So i did not have much expectation about this movie. Well, I'll admit it - I'm a big fan of The Man with the Iron Fists (the TV series). A good story is all well and good, but a great movie should have more than just the story. That's exactly what happens in The Man with The Iron Fists, where the entire action consists of nothing but the action scene.

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family's journey from the Old World (Italy) to the New World (America). Salvatore, a middle-aged man who hopes for a more fruitful life, persuades his family to leave their homeland behind in Sicily, take the arduous journey across the raging seas, and inhabit a land whose rivers supposedly flow with milk. In short, they believe that by risking everything for the New World their dreams of prosperity will be fulfilled. The imagery of the New World is optimistic, clever and highly imaginative.

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie , this wo n't be one for you . If you like to enjoy a good laugh , this wo n't be for you . I thought this was going to be a comedy, but it turns out that the plot isn't even real. I think this is all about some of the worst acting talent i have ever seen in a movie. The story is completely unbelievable. Every single character makes absolutely no sense. One of the main characters keeps asking "What did you do to her?"

Pity the Monkees. People always accused them of being manufactured (which they were) or being nothing more than a American knock-off of the Beatles (Again, which they were) but to the kids of the time they were real, they were important, they were legitimate. Discussions about who were better The Monkees or The Beatles were common on school yards but the critics, well they never quite bought into it. Despite recording some very catchy, classic pop tunes, the Monkess did not receive much respect for their albums.

I 've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie . I agree 100% with some of what others have said, it's terrible. I also think it was a bad decision to leave out one of the best films of the 80's in favor of this mediocre effort. It is very much worth seeing, however, if you are looking for something different than your local thrash/doom/whatever band. What a complete waste of film. At first, it looked pretty decent, but after the opening sequence, it became obvious that it was all going to be wasted.

The `` old dark house '' sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the original, which was filmed from an upstairs window. The new version of this classic is pretty much the same story (which isn't hard to believe) but there's one major thing that doesn't really change. You can still hear that muffled voice of William Shatner in the background. When it's over, he'll be at your feet with his hands around your throat and trying to beg you to let him out.

I love this movie a lot. I must get this on DVD. I have 2 VHS copies, but the quality is so poor that you can't read one written joke over the door of the ward. I'm forever amazed that Blankfield did almost nothing afterward. He made both Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde totally believable.The movie is plagued by it's low budget. (One atrocious edit jumps into mid-word and was described on, "Siskel & Ebert".) But, there are a thousand jokes, sight gags to subtle references, that more than compensate.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004 's Academy Awards , My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to learn what went on inside the brain of a man with an IQ of over 200. Kahn, who has been working closely with Dr. Charles W. Freeman for the past five decades, began by interviewing Mr. Kahn's family members as well as people he knows personally. I had heard of this film through my wife and I were excited when we decided to see it together. The cast list was very strong and one of the most exciting parts of the movie was watching the performances of all the actresses.

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I, which gave us Werner Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness".Le Dernier Combat is not "Sci Fi". It's more like Judgment. I've watched it at least a dozen times. It really is a fitting companion to Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness": "And in that time, men will seek death, but they will not find it, for death will flee from them. "That someday, alas, may be today, in Iraq.

I thought it was brilliant! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down. Dwight Schultz still looked the same, he had hardly changed in looks, neither had Dirk Benedict, he still looked just as dishy! I thought that Mr T looked thinner though, but it was still great to see how he looked after all this time. I thought that it took some doing tracking down the other members of the cast, such as the one who played Decker, and the lady who played Amy. It was just a shame that Mr T could'nt make the actual reunion.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort , and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. He did not show any love for the German soldiers, he went one step further and showed his hatred for the Japanese. You would think that the man with more than 30 years of experience in filmmaking would know better how to take a good story and move it forward...but this was a failure of a film. My daughter saw this at my local movie house, and she wanted to watch it too!

Pity the Monkees . People always accused them of being manufactured ( which they were ) or being nothing more than mindless "chaos". In the end, I think you can make your own mind up.In a time when people were just beginning to understand how human nature is built, this film was a classic in its own right. There are some good points but there are also plenty of things that are completely stupid and out of touch with modern life.I'm not sure why I gave it a one because I could have found better films.

It 's just that . Chucky 1 was good . Chucky 2 was better . Chucky 3 sucked . Now Chucky 4 sucks and it's a waste of time . They need to make the sequel even better. This is a bad movie . Okay, maybe this isn't one of my favorites but it was one of the most entertaining I have ever seen in awhile. A lot of movies today seem to be so formulaic they could be played with a tape-recorder (which would be pretty funny). I think this movie has more originalness and interesting ideas than any of the recent horror flicks I've seen.

Do you liked "Dead Man don't wear Plaid"? What about "Top Secret" and "A Chorus Line"? Well Müllers Büro is a fantastic Melange of all three of them, as unlikely it may seem. Very Funny "tongue in Cheek" Movie Noir hommage with stunning Songs and great Dancing. You have to have a little odd humor for this movie, but it is very well worth seeing it. I've voted it a nine, If the end would be a bit more logic it would have gotten a ten. Thats how Good that Movie is.

The Child 's Play series is n't a favourite of mine , but Bride Of Chucky is actually an okay film. The story could have been a lot better, the performances could have been more natural and there was a really boring ending. But hey, that's what you get for watching a child's movie ! My friend and I came across this movie while looking to find a "family" movie. We had watched many horror films and found ourselves intrigued. So we rented it without hesitation.We didn't understand the title at first.

I love the TV contest . Hate to see it end . There are so many talented contestants . It would have made for some good tv shows , and if they get picked, I think it will be a great story . The contestants are all really nice and smart , but there are just too many weak contestants . For the most part this movie had me intrigued. My initial expectation was that it would be an extremely interesting action flick. While I was pleasantly surprised by the overall feel of the movie, I did have a feeling that the filmmakers had something in mind other than simply making a fun film.

I was 19 or 20, years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City, Utah and I still remember the new dome theater, called the century 21. Layback chairs that rocked and a new sound system, large screen and huge open space between the screen and the packed theater. We felt all the excitement of a new preview screening of a film. Ta da da daa da ta da dada dada... I can still hear the opening music ringing trumpet and the crash of cymbals. I loved the interplay of characters and the filmed vistas.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White, Cinderella, or Bambi, but it IS a very sweet, enjoyable, romantic, well-done Disney animated feature.There are, of course, lessons included herein for the kiddies, and some very appropriate kiddie-cheek, but there is plenty herein for the adults, as well.While this is somewhat of a regurgitation of the Classic Disney RomCom Adventure, it still holds some elements, which solely belong to the AristoCats. O'Malley is the "tramp" and Dutchess is the "lady," but Dutchess has several kittens and they are all trying to get home.Phil Harris is our tomcat O'Malley.

Ah the Outer Limits . I love that show . It was surpremely creepy , or down-right mysterious . I mean what in the world was that movie? I really have to ask myself, 'what was the point?' Why do we watch horror movies ? We like them because they tell us a scary story, and sometimes it gets good scares. I want to start off by saying all of the above review is based on an actual purchase of the DVD...and yes, that does make the film much less enjoyable for those who would rather watch TV.

Due to its predictable, second-rate title, (the one it was distributed under in Italy, at least) I didn't expect much from this movie. Thought it'd be another cheap flick about a haunted house ("LA CASA MALEDETTA" means "The cursed house"). Well, I had to change my mind just after the very first brilliant scene! The constant presence of priests and the creepy atmospheres, reminded me a bit of The Exorcist and some of its decent Italian rip-offs, but this was going to be something completely different...

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form. I tracked it down on video a couple of years ago and viewed it again. The film although slow and slightly odd (the mountain men look very strange) the atmosphere was eerily effective. It's one of my favorite slasher films and I have no idea where an uncut version can be found. Currently deleted everywhere (except the USA where it was accidentally put on a horror compilation!). It's a shame you cannot get this movie as it was meant to be seen.

As I have said before, I am NOT a fan of Tweety. He's just so aggravating I wish Sylvester would just eat him and get it over with.In this cartoon Sly is homeless once again and is back to feeding out of garbage cans. He spots a cruise ship leaving port nearby and decides to hop aboard when he spys Tweety is one of the passengers. The ship provides an adequate stage for the following hijinks and Sly desperately tries to catch the annoying bird and avoid seasickness. If only for once he's succeed by chewing and swallowing, thus finishing of the irritating Canary forever.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old . I had no idea who the lead character was and what his story was. In retrospect, I now realize it was one of the greatest movies ever made (even more so today). It's a real treat to see the entire cast perform on stage and watch them in front of such a large crowd. It's difficult to say exactly what to make of this movie, especially as it's so much a product of its time.

1930 's comedy mystery about `` The Crooked Circle '' a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the murders of rival gangsters. A few months later one of them and his brother are arrested for the murder of a fellow crook and shot in the back. The most disappointing film I had seen this year. The acting is very bad, there is no suspense and none of the "chills", the script is not even funny. This film was made in the 1950's, it would have been funny if it could have come up with something interesting to say.

Yes, at times "Unconditional Love" overwhelms as it bounces -- no, as it ricochets -- from one story element to another in the most unconventional use of thematic elements and characters. In fact, it wasn't until I watched the film for the second time that I began to understand what I think P.J. Hogan might have been attempting to do with this quirky, unconventional flick. Perhaps the entire film itself is a metaphor for the unconditional love for which Grace (Kathy Bates) yearns and describes in the later part of the film.

As far as I know I've seen most of Lucio Fulci's films, with the exception of some later ones that are popping up on DVD now, and I would have to say this was his best "pre-zombie" offering. In fact it beats out his later movies hands-down. This is a tale of superstition and suspicion in a small Italian town out in the middle of nowhere, where young boys are dying mysteriously. It's no mystery how they died, I guess, it's more who's doing it. Is it a woman that the townspeople have always considered a witch?

This movie got better with time . I ca n't believe that it has been forty years since I saw this one. I will admit that I didn't like it at the time, though I must say that I still think it is an OK movie. There was one or two nice moments for sure, and I always thought there was something missing in it. I watched this film after being recommended by someone who had heard about it on a British TV show. While I found some good bits in the film, it was nowhere near the greatness of "E.T."

A labor of love. Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you. Then the sheer emotion and story-telling take you through a dream that stays with you long after the movie. The director gets your heart and leads it through 100 minutes of visual poetry. You are a part of the emotional ride of the characters. I have seen this movie at 2 festivals and it got with standing ovations at every showing. The remarkable story-telling transcends nationality and language and I felt I was a part of the drama unfolding before me. The casting is as perfect as one can get.

This is possibly one of my favorite films . It tells the tale of a girl named Gerda ( Chelsea Peretti ) who is about to go out for a date when she gets a call from her boyfriend asking her to come back at night. When she comes back she finds that he has killed another woman. Now what can she do? This movie came out of nowhere. And it was not even good. This film was terrible. It had too many pointless scenes and bad acting. It didn't have any interesting plot but it had all the other ingredients you want in a crappy movie.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread . Louis de Berniere, in one of his most memorable roles, plays the lead. He doesn't really come off as a leading man, but he certainly does give it a good shot. Okay, here's what I can think:1. This film was bad for a few reasons. The main one being the fact that the actors playing the role did an absolutely awful job of it. At times they were so bad at their work that you just couldn't take it anymore.2.The characters in this film are not believable.

I really enjoyed this film , it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat . It was very suspenseful and I kept hoping for the ending to be a surprise ! I could not believe what I just watched ! The end was such a disappointment and I did not understand WHY anyone would want to watch something like this !! The story is terrible, the acting is poor, the special effects are amateurish, the directing is horrible, the production value is pitiful, the dialogues are stupid and stilted. You see all that, but don't know why anybody would ever want to watch such a thing.

(Synopsis) Graduating high school senior Bartleby "B" Gaines (Justin Long) finds himself without a college to attend. He has been able to talk and con his way out of every problem he encounters, but he hasn't been able to charm his way pass the college admissions board of eight colleges. His mom and dad are very disappointed that Bartleby hasn't been accepted into college. His parents think that if Bartleby doesn't go to college, he will have no future. Several of Bartleby's friends are in the same situation of being rejected by all the colleges they applied to.

This is one of my favourite Disney films. It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation: cute animals, great songs, a nasty villain and lots of adventure. The story begins in Paris, where aristocat Duchess and her three kittens live with their Mistress in a mansion. Life is perfect for them until the Mistress' fiendish butler Edgar discovers that she plans to leave her entire fortune to the cats. He realises that if he even stands a chance of claiming the fortune, the cats will be out of the way.

This is a wonderful movie , and I still love it ! It just so magical and it is fun to watch in a car (I was sitting there for about 15 mins). The music is amazing and the director does his job perfectly. The plot is not very clever, but is executed well.The only problem I have with the picture is the "darker" lighting. I remember this movie as one of the better ones of the 1990s. Now, I really can't see why anyone would choose such a film; it wasn't really good at all.

I remember this film of old . It 's a great , chilling , atmospheric horror picture about a man and his son whose lives are turned upside down when they are taken by a mysterious cult in the Colorado Rockies. The story itself is excellent (well, it's good if you're a fan of weird films) as well as the music.The only problem was the dialog. I don't see how anyone could watch this movie with an open mind and actually expect to understand everything that goes on! This movie had some interesting scenes but the overall story was pretty unbelievable.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development . Fulci was a master at creating horrifically funny characters; this movie does not disappoint. When I saw this movie I had high hopes--but it fell short on every level.First off, there was absolutely no suspense. The plot was so predictable I felt as if I'd just been told it was going to be a big action flick. What's even more disturbing about this is that my expectations seemed to go out the window when the film ended. No one left any questions after the movie was over.

He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song , and now the terrific Justin Bieber is singing it at every party I go to. I've got no complaints with this, but there's nothing even remotely funny about it. I have been hearing about this album from various other fans over the past few weeks, so I decided to put in a quick review of it. I'm a huge music fan and have always appreciated songs by some of my favourite artists, so I was hoping for something special.

inspite of many movies dealing with great artists or a genius, chihaweseon pointed out the real dilemma in which an artist is capted...the decision whether to ease the demands of the popularity or to create something new and to define ones' own style.Chiahweson's desperate seek for inspiration and broadening his conscious led him to live the way he did, restless, outrageous, and yes very drunk! But still he defended and retained the most important ethical rules for an artist: respect to his Master, respect to the nature and the gradual seek for improvement and to perfection.

I hope, from his seat on Heaven's comedic throne, Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film, as Terence Ryan and Ken Tuohy have taken a book that the author himself said writing it "nearly turned me mad" into a joy to watch.The film tells the story of the Irish town of Puckoon and the problems befallen upon it when the partition between Northern Ireland and the Republic is drawn up, cutting its way through the centre of the village and, more worringly, through the middle of the churchyard.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n ' roll . The young singer/songwriter was in trouble with his parents. So they sent him to a boarding school where he would become the world's most popular child entertainer. The opening scene of this movie was pretty dull. It showed us the protagonist (who I can only assume is Buddy Holly) sitting around talking to himself. Of course, this could have been a nice introduction to some of Holly's more unusual lyrics but it didn't go anywhere.

I first saw `` Signs of Life '' on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation . It 's a wonderfully entertaining little play that, like many plays of its type, gives the audience what they expect to find. The play itself is very good so I can understand why it was shown here and there as part of the general theater program. However, I have only had the opportunity to see this one in New York City, and from what I've read, it doesn't seem to be performing anywhere else yet.

I'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it's absolutely everything you could ever want in a horror film. This is the definition of being a horror film. I consider myself to be a big horror fan and I must say that this house delivers the goods. House of wax Is the story of a group of college kids on their way to a football game whom decide to camp out for the night and have a run in with a local weirdo. Upon waking the next morning they make a gruesome discovery and decide to go into town for a broken car part.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n' roll. The young singer/songwriter from Lubbock, Texas left his mark on the template of modern music. Inspired by Elvis Presley, Holly would spend a lot of time fighting the system in order to get his rock-a-billy sound recorded. Before his untimely death, he was mixing lush strings with be-bop rhythms. Holly would take his place with Presley, Chuck Berry, Jerry Lee Lewis and Ricky Nelson as the voices of teenage angst.This easy to watch bio is not without flaws.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread. Louis de Berniere's bestselling novel is one of my favourites and anyone who has read it will realise that there is no way in hell that any screen adaptation can be 100% faithful. All the way through I found myself convincing myself that the movie was unsuccessful, and had stripped the book's plot back so far as to render it redundant. The ending, however, is much better than that in the novel, and I could not stop thinking about the movie afterwards.

First off , I absolutely loved this movie . As a Billy Crystal fan , I must say that I have always been very disappointed with his movies. This one was so bad that I almost fell out of my chair at the screen . There were so many things that went wrong here . For one, there was a lot of wasted time during the final scene where Billy is forced to shoot himself. It felt like an extra scene was added just to make him feel more alive. Secondly , this movie had so many pointless characters and scenes that they seemed to be cut from the movie .

I thought Besson 's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them. I am sorry to disappoint my friends, but this is by far the worst film i have ever seen in my entire life. This is just a complete waste of a good film and i will not be spending any more time watching it. The main reason I decided to write this short review is because I was very interested to see how this bad movie would be treated in a cinema. In other words, whether it would be accepted as a movie, or viewed as a piece of rubbish.

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode, THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode of the series. And, while I have always loved A PIECE OF THE ACTION because it is so much fun, I really do have to cast my vote as this Romulan episode as being the very best.The movie, interestingly enough, is really like a WWII submarine movie in that it bounces back and forth between the cloaked Romulan ship and the Enterprise as it seeks to destroy the Romulans before they sneak back across the Neutral Zone after a raid on Federation outposts.

But a great cast ! Jonathan Pryce , Kathy Bates , Rupert Everett , Lynne Redgrave , Julie Andrews and many more were brilliant. I have no words to describe this film. "Rising Tide" does exactly what it is supposed to do. The plot is interesting enough and the action (and some of the editing) is pretty good, but the acting was mediocre. Some of the lines were just not that funny. In fact, there are a few lines that made me laugh out loud. But when the film really gets going, most of the humor is gone.

For those out there that like to think of themselves as reasonably intelligent human beings , who love film , and/or literature and have a strong appreciation for all things '80s and '90s, you really should sit down for this movie. The script is terrible and even the actors' performances are sub-par. To put it simply, I could not care less. There are 2 problems with this movie. 1) One of the most popular bands in rock history was made into a bunch of "bouncy" dorks, and 2) these kids just don't get it.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you'll be hard-pressed. HEAD is a masterpiece of non-linear non-structure, surrealism and experimentaion. In less than 90 minutes, it manages to be not only a time-capsule of an era, but also a full-length experimental feature that defies time,space and convention in a way that only underground films of the sixties could.HEAD is a reflection of those films. No matter how one feels about the Monkees, this is a film every filmmaker should see because it cracks wide open the endless possibilities of film as an art medium.

I loved this film, which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival. In March 2005 I went to India with 2 friends, and this movie was very real. I related to everything, and savored every moment. The characters are believable, the story poignant and the ending realistic, but not sentimental. I also enjoyed the discussion with the director after the showing. This movie shows very well the blending, but not complete mixing of 2 worlds (East and West). The supporting cast was wonderful, depicting the life a tourist encounters in India quite realistically.

Telling the story would n't be the point at all , would it ? Barnens ö , spelled almost like that, does not add anything. He doesn't even have a plot. There are some interesting things about this film. First, many of its elements fit perfectly into real life. In fact, one of the reasons I had to watch this movie was to see if it was true. I found myself having to pause several times and think: "Hey, this actually happened?" And then finally I laughed out loud.

Coming from the "druggie" generation, I thought this movie was hilarious. It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde up-to-date, so to speak. My husband and I laughed all the way through it. Would love to have the movie in my collection. I told my two teenagers about the movie and they would love to see it. They aren't into drugs but they know enough about them to understand the comedy in the movie. It's been so long since I've seen it I can't remember but a few things.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast ! I am not sure if it's my favorite film of the year, but I loved this one. It has no stars, but you will be happy to know that the script is solid and well acted. This movie is based on an Italian novel written in 1787 by Francesco Saverio Rava. I read it in the 1960s when it was published by Edizioni (Italian publishing house). There are some plot elements that do not make any sense.

This Oscar-winning short film (40 minutes), based on a short story by William Faulkner, takes us back to small-town Tennessee in December 1941. Two brothers, one about 18 and one about 8 are looking for birds eggs (obviously a huge collectors item for boys in the South around this time). Well, the Japanese bomb Pearl Harbor and the older brother, Pete, decides to enlist. He gives his prize egg to his little brother, Willie and heads off wishing to show more emotion and tenderness to his little acolyte.

I think that this short TV series , was absolutely wonderful , and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of life on Earth. If you are an avid fan of the space operas like Star Trek, Babylon 5 or even The Next Generation then this will be exactly what you've been looking for. I don't know who directed this, as it was written and directed by a different team, but I have to say that there is a huge disconnect between the tone of the story and the actual events that were portrayed in real life.

Dr. Paul Flanner (Richard Gere), a successful surgeon, has his wife leave him, his son (an uncredited James Franco) not respect him and looses a patient he's operating on. Adrienne Willis (Diane Lane) has two children and discovers her husband has cheated on her. They both need to get away. She watches over a beautiful oceanside inn in Rodanthe at the same time he books a room. They're all alone together. You can pretty much figure out the rest.This is what's known as a weepie or a woman's film.

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it . It is just not available on DVD anywhere in my local video store . I was so close to getting it. The worst thing about "Masters of Sex" is that it doesn't make sense. There's no reason for Dr. Peter Lorre to be married at all, especially after what he did when he was hired to help with sex therapy. That being said, it's still kind of a great movie if you've never seen it before because it has many great scenes which are worth seeing.

Exclusively for Coop 's lovers , though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this movie. I just started watching this, and honestly I did not give it much of a chance. Not in the least due to the low budget and lack of production values. The actors are all so bad that I cannot even believe that there are people who thought that they could act convincingly with those terrible voices. There were some good scenes (mostly), but the majority of the movie felt like something someone on a college campus would watch on a rainy day while trying to stay awake.

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it. It is just not available and it has not been on TV for many many years. I enjoyed it and the songs because it had something different to say and made you think how every person looks at something from different prespectives. Also we often don't appreciate something we have till it is no longer there.My 12 year old daughter just discoverd the music and is entranced with some of the songs. Someday I hope to get a copy of the film so she can have an opportunity to view it.

Spike Milligan 's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years , and 2002 's 'Puckoon ' is yet another classic example. The plot is simple enough, the story is a bit silly (it doesn't really seem to care what happens) but the acting was superb. Even though the book is based on an early stage play, this movie didn't give me that same feeling as it would if I went to the theatre to see one of those old stage plays written by Shakespeare.The cast is fantastic in this movie.

Little Gus is a ten year old delinquent . He runs away from his parents and decides to go on a cross country treasure hunt. So, this movie had been in the works for what seemed like forever. I loved the script, I loved the actors, and I thought the direction was very good. What I didn't like was that it came out in 2007. It was almost twenty years ago, and things are much different. So many of my friends were dying of cancer, and when I first heard about this film I just laughed.

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining. It provides updates of tech news, video games pretty much everything geek. They are also the official broadcasters of E3 and Comiccon. If you are a geek, gamers or anything really, you will enjoy this show. They have definitely upped their game since the guy below me's review (2006). It's the only place that I get my tech info. Kevin Pereira and Olivia Munn work beautifully with each other and the show always has segments referring to things in the game, movie, comic... Universe.

Chucky (the murderous doll from "Child's Play" and 2 crappy sequels) is dead. But his ex-girlfriend Tiffany (Jennifer Tilly) gets his remains and (using "Voodoo for Dummies") revives him. Then, through circumstances too convoluted to get into, SHE is killed and has her soul put into another doll! Together they fall in love and kidnap a nice couple (Nick Stabile, Katherine Heigl) to take them to Chuck's coffin to get an amulet to make Chucky and Tiffany real people again...A lot better than it sounds.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. This is a haunting tale of loneliness & missed connection in which the longing for intimacy conflicts with our fear of revealing too much about ourselves to another. The three leads (Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo) are all excellent and the dynamic between them is very surprising. After all the movies which devalue older women, it's wonderful to see Flavia (who is a law professor at a university in Rome) presented as beautiful & sensual as well as seductive & powerful.

Jack , Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond . His traumatic past experience leads to him being unable to speak English. He has no idea what to do with his life. It is hard to think of anything better to end a mediocre film than an emotionally-dubious plot that tries to make you believe in a story, instead of showing you how weak the movie is. This is where "Orient Express" falls flat. We are told nothing about its meaning. We are not told what these people are after, why they came to America, why it is so terrible, etc.

This is one of the best of the early `` Star Trek '' episodes , with Kirk and his crew on a search for the Orb, and it has lots of wonderful moments which make up for the lack of interesting ideas. This is a must see because of its superb special effects and excellent performances. If you liked the original "Star Trek" you probably will like this one as well but be ready to give up about half an hour. The plotline is pretty weak and lacks any significant twists and turns. In fact it is almost entirely predictable.

Barbora Bobulova 's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time . I don't even know who this movie is based off, but I can't stand it. I have to give credit where credit is due, there was a nice plotline that didn't seem to gel and the acting was awful. There were two main characters in this movie, both of which seemed so out of place and unlikable.The most egregious thing about this movie was the fact that almost all of the dialogue was completely made up, and nothing ever happened.

To experience Head you really need to understand where the Monkees were when they filmed it.This was as their series was coming to a close and the group was near break up. Their inventive and comedic series (sort of an American Idol of their day) took four unknown actors and formed a manufactured supergroup around them.This is their take on their "manufactured image" and status as the 2nd tier Beatles. They always felt they were in a box, trapped, and unable to find credibility despite their talents.It is also a hell of a musical-trippy, inventive (I have the soundtrack) and full of surprises.See it with an open mind.

I viewed the original Outer Limits in real time, when first broadcast and have since viewed the entire original series again and again in re-runs and complete on DVD. I find the New Outer Limits WELL MORE than just a remake of old retread episodes, as some of the more adolescent commentators have suggested.With seven (7) years of programs versus just the two (2) years of the original series, the producers and writers have certainly added considerable new original stories and philosophical lines to a much longer running and very well produced (cable) TV series.

i love this film ! ! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is trying to say. It's a shame that i can't even find the movie at my local library anymore. I've heard it's great, i'd go and see it for sure. A lot of people tell me this movie is the worst they've ever seen, and I'll believe it when I see it. The acting was poor. The story was boring and predictable. The production value was lousy.

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining . It provides updates of tech news , video reviews and other stuff. But, as a whole, "The X Factor" is a total farce. This is one of the shows worst moments. I had to take my wife and son away from the set for an entire week. One of the cast members even left the set with me in the car and that was the last I heard of her. There is absolutely NO reason to sit through such a pathetic show.

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO , regardless of the age of the OAV . The plot, while not particularly deep, is well-executed to a degree. There are some scenes in the first few minutes or so that have me giggling as I watch it, but overall the story was a bit boring and predictable. The characters were mostly forgettable and didn't seem like they'd make a good addition to an animated movie. A group of friends go out for a night of drinking, when one of the guys decides to try his hand at acting.

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode , THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best part of this year's Christmas specials. And I've never been a huge fan of sitcoms. But they do have an advantage in that there is always some levity in the midst of tragedy, and the way this movie works is simply brilliant.The storyline revolves around three young friends who get together for Christmas dinner. One of them, Charlie (Jason Bateman), wants nothing to do with the other two. They don't appreciate his lack of decorum, he's too busy making jokes.

I think this show was right on the money for me. I watched it over the plane but there were parts in the movie that made me control myself from tearing all over the place. The chemistry between Richard gere and Diane lane was very believable (fantastic acting on both parts)! I loved how Diane lane's daughter acted in the show too. She displayed maturity and how she transformed throughout the show was easy to believe as what a teenager could possibly be like in real life. I loved this show from start to end. Definitely recommended for the romantic people out there!

This is a stunning movie. Raw and sublimely moving. It felt like a very gripping, intelligent stage play (but without the overly theatrical feeling one actually gets from watching people on a stage) which plays on everyone's terror of a white lie escalating to monstrous consequences. All of the main players are mesmerising. Tom Wilkinson broke my heart at the end... and everyone else's judging by the amount of fumbling for hankies and hands going up to faces among males and females alike. Julian Fellowes has triumphed again. He's a national treasure.

"I am ... proud of 'Head'," Mike Nesmith has said. He should be, because this film, which either has been derided by many of us or studied and scrutinized by film professors, works on many levels.Yes, it's unconventional. To many, frustrating. It's almost as if the producers hand you the film and tempt: "You figure it out. "You probably already know that The Monkees TV show was a runaway marketing success that depended upon business acumen and no small serving of public deception. TV shows are about selling soap and toothpaste first, than to entertain.

*May Contain Spoilers*The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when I was around 8 years old. Now I am 17 and still watch it whenever I get a chance to. "The Aristocats" was a cute heart warming film that I immediately fell in love with. I loved the songs on it especially the one the kittens sing by the piano. In fact I even sang it in a talent show with my sister and friend since I loved it that much. All three kittens are so cute and their mother is one of the prettiest cartoon cats I ever saw.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci's reputation as a director. Too often he's categorized as a no-talented filmmaker, only out to shock and disgust entire audiences with images of pure gore. True, his films contain more explicit filth and sickness as your average mainstream American production, but his films always are of wide range and the plots are gruesomely morbid. Don't Torture a Duckling is yet another story! This film is a pure gem of the Italian shock cinema! I easily dare to call this film a masterpieceit's an old-fashioned giallo that includes all brilliant aspects of genuine horror.

I'm not a massive Disney fan, but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them, so we've built up quite a collection, and this is one of my favourites. We first saw this a couple of weeks ago and we must have see it half a dozen times since! OK, as others have pointed out, not the most complex or inventive of plots, but there's more to a film than that.Great characters, Phil Harris stealing the show as Thomas O'Malley, but Edgar the butler not far behind.

First of all , around the time I wrote this comment , I had already read what kittiwake-1 had written about her. This movie has nothing good to say about its main character and that makes it one of the worst, as far as "pulp" is concerned. What kind of people write a movie about a teenage girl whose only ambition is to have a successful career in modeling after her mother? Not only does she fail, but she eventually gets caught up with the gangsters who murdered her mother. That was the most boring thing I have ever seen!

The film is n't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch . The characters are all quite likable , even if they have a hard time acting themselves. I bought this DVD because of the poster and box art that included the cast and crew. That was about the only reason I picked it up. Sadly, that was about all I got.The film takes place on a moon called "Eos". It's an abandoned world where people live underground under the moon's surface.

Do you liked `` Dead Man do n't wear Plaid '' ? What about `` Top Secret '' and `` All About the Boogie Man !? I don't like either one. It is hard to think of any good TV series from this period, even though it started in the 1940's. But I must admit that I love all these movies, they are just plain boring. The only reason I still watch a movie when I am bored is to see something else. This was not the case with 'Dead Man' , I actually had high expectations for this movie.

The "old dark house" sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the oldies to-day. Here is one that provides so very many suspicious characters you have to wonder how they will be able to tie up all the loose ends in the 6 reel running time.The Crooked Circle is a gang of counterfeiters and thieves who have decided to take revenge on Col. Walters (Berton Churchill) who has sent one of their ranks to prison. They decide he must die that very night. Meanwhile the Colonel's own group, The Sphinx Club, is determined to protect him at all costs.

A well written screenplay . A moving story showing the middle class English at it 's best . Some great supporting actors , lots of humor, and some suspenseful action scenes . Not sure why this is one of my all time favorites , but it IS! One word: disappointing. I was expecting to be in love with a film like "The Secret Garden" or "House of Sand and Fog". Instead, I found myself frustrated by the slow pace and unappealing characters of the film.I could not understand why someone would choose to invest so much money and effort in making a low budget film.

Dr. Paul Flanner ( Richard Gere ) , a successful surgeon , has his wife leave him , his son is killed in a motorcycle accident and then he meets a new woman, the mysterious Dr. Elizabeth Parke ( Susan Sarandon ), and they move into an old mansion on the estate of a wealthy family . This movie was awful. I mean terrible. The acting was horrendous. It was like watching someone try to read my mind by speaking slowly and making me look stupid. And it was so poorly filmed that I could have done better at trying to find out what happened.

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere , strikes him from behind , and he dies instantly . The film started off looking promising on paper. The story was intriguing enough, the cinematography could have been much better, and the acting was great. However, by the end of the film it had lost all its promise, and turned into one of the most boring and poorly directed films I've ever seen. The only reason I watch horror films is to find out what goes on in them.

Not a stunner, but a good movie to see once or twice. Bill Macy shows he can do more than just act; his writing was pretty darn good. Great supporting cast, especially Jamie Cromwell as the extortionist private eye.The movie's greatest strength is the work of Macy, who reminds us of his Jerry Lundergaard role from Fargo. He has numerous scenes where he is extremely funny as a slimy, manipulating and deceitful character. It's enjoyable to watch him be a weasel, and for a while I was happy that things were turning out well for him.

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates `` Separate Lies , '' a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson , Linda Cardellini and Christopher Lloyd . The story centers around a couple whose marriage ends in divorce (in the latter half of the movie), and their efforts to rekindle their relationship. It's a very heart-wrenching story about two people who have been estranged for most of their adult lives. It is not that I blame the director/producer/star, Robert De Niro - if he truly loved this film he wouldn't be trying to put it back on DVD!

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre , but I think this one is done quite well.The plot isn't interesting enough to warrant any more detail. The character's motivations and their relation to the story is not clear either. The action scenes are so simple that I was expecting something more complicated. It doesn't help that there is little to no background or background setting. This film was directed by a director known for his work on the B movies, as well as other lesser-known indie flicks.

*Could contain spoilers, read only after seeing last episode season 2* Think about it. The guys on the north pole? Center of the earth? Looking for abnormal magnetic behavior? They also said something about: "did we miss it again?" So there was another abnormality? Of course that was when the plain crashed! I think this whole Island is a setup. Set up by her daddy. She found out about it and is looking for her Desmond. How else can she know what to look for.So basically it's an Island in a magnetic shield.

If you've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts, here is a Zasu zinger! In 1933 Mae Questel caricatured Pitt's voice for the character Olive Oyl for the Fleischer Studios animated cartoon version of the comic strip Popeye. Zasu (pronounced Zay-Sue) does her best "Olive Oyl" impersonation walking around whining and ringing her hands or attaching herself to the policeman's laynard. I kept waiting for her to say "ohhh myyyy", but instead it's "something always happens to somebody." The first time I saw this film I loved Zasu and found her character really funny.

Chucky's back...and it's about time! This time, with the help of Jennifer Tilly and a little spell from Voodoo For Dummies. Well, at least with this installment, the camp is back. This was the more gruesome of this series, so far. It has some good twists and some good action scenes. This one was by far, the most fun of the series, and successfully, if unintentionally, bridges the gap between pure horror to horror/comedy. I am looking forward to Seed of Chucky. It'll be a hoot!

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I , which gave us Werner Herzog 's `` Lessons of Darkness ". Now, as far as my knowledge is concerned, it was a good movie.The story does contain some interesting historical and philosophical elements, although they were not developed enough to warrant the attention that they had to be. The acting, on the other hand, was superb. It would have been nice if this movie had been better. It was supposed to be about a military officer trying to make a new life for himself in England (in this case an army unit) after his wife leaves him.

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie, this won't be one for you. If the Truth is what you seek, rent or buy this. From a true story, the movie attempts to capture the heart of what was/is happening in South Africa (and many other places).For historical knowledge, this rates up there with stories such as "The Pianist," "Schindler's List" or "Nuremberg." Millions of people today have no clue what apartheid is or that it even exists. This movie may help them learn, and may even help them dig deeper.

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London(England). Enjoyed it immensely. Although the Crow & the Chinese Policeman don't appear, and Dan Milligan becomes Dan Madigan (played by Sean Hughes (I)). The interaction between Dan and the Author (Writer/Director) voiced/played by Lord Richard Attenborough, works very well.The rumour is that Lord Attenborough and Elliott Gould (as Dr. Goldstein) appeared in the film for just a pint of beer.Spike was shown the film, on video before he died and by all accounts enjoyed it immensely.

Before I forget , let me say the artwork in here is outstanding . From garbage cans to the huge monster they make, this movie could have been just as good without it's great art. This is one bad movie that should never be made. If you don't like zombies, watch "Dawn of the Dead". You'll find out very quickly that they're far worse (in fact, I've even seen two or three movies that had zombies that were worse) and the same goes for other genre movies too.The story is pretty dull and uninteresting but the acting isn't that bad either.

I thought this was movie was great, Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie. Yasmine Bleeth's character plays a women who has fallen head over heals in love with Richard Greico's character. They end up getting married and everything seems perfect except Yasmine Bleeth wants a baby more than anything, however she has a hard time trying to conceive. Richard Greico will do anything to make her happy, and will go to extreme measures to make her happy. I thought the acting was great in this movie, and it keeps you guessing.

Being a middle aged mom myself , I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in and out of each other, not to mention the fact that it doesn't always go exactly how one would like.I'm not too sure if this would be a great movie to rent or watch for the family, however, because I am pretty sure the film is terrible. It's hard to recommend this movie after watching the trailers. Not only was the story way off, but the character designs were really ugly!

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries ( Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island ) that keeps you going from beginning to end. This was the only time we had seen this in the cinema. It's easy to get lost in all of these scenes, but the main thing to keep track of here is that there are so many things happening that you feel like you don't know where to go next. You're walking along, and you see something on the horizon, and you wonder where it could have gone.

This film, winning Im Kwon-Taek the Best Director at Cannes in 2002 (tied with P.T. Anderson for Punch-Drunk Love), is about a 19th century Korean painter with a commoner's roots and significant impact on Korean painting. One of the strengths?of the film is that Im tries to help us see with the eye of a painter, so we see multiple scenes and objects which help our drunken painter friend, Jang Seung-up (Choi Min-shik),?receive inspiration.The costumes and the art direction are all impressive and the acting is even along being good.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic barriers, especially among those who don't share the same tastes and values. Some of the characters in this movie seem like they have no idea what it's all about. I can't see why anyone would take a trip to Las Vegas or Atlantic City where such a movie could be filmed. I love this movie. This is the best movie I've ever seen. The plot is very simple; a black man goes to his white girlfriend's house looking for money.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it. I found the storyline very distressing and can still remember the various bullying techniques used. One in particular was when the other school children spat in his soup before he could even taste a spoonful. They also bound him and shaved his private parts. This was all because he was unpopular. Why was he unpopular? Because he was bad at games. I have a feeling though that even if he was good at games he would have been bullied because it's hard to decide what makes someone popular.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to it in order to keep them from getting sick. It's really a pity that the director did this. I would have liked him to go on for several minutes and do some research into the background of the real story, because there is so much good stuff about this movie. The story is based on an actual incident in the United States. Somebody said this was the worst movie he'd ever seen--and he's not wrong.

"Nuovomondo" was a great experience. Many filmmakers tell their stories to a big extent via dialogue. Emanuele Crialese directs his film very visually driven. For everything he wants to tell, he finds powerful images that are able to stand for themselves. Thus, he understands film as a medium that primarily tells its stories over the pictures on screen. Particularly European cinema is often very dialogue-driven (and many of the young US-American directors are strongly influenced by that). Crialese's opposite attitude was really the point, that made this film special for me.

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once, about ten years ago. I remember I liked the book a lot, and this movie does a good job in telling the story. The most important thing in this movie isn't the story, however, but the highly original visual look it has.The visuals are absolutely beautiful, and they are apparently achieved by a clever combination of animated drawings combined with live actors, stop-motion animation and sets that are painted so that they look much like from an animated movie.

The Monkees , surprisingly , are a big favorite of mine . Yes , they might have been the original show , but no matter how bad the music is it can't compare to this. I mean, what else can be said about this crap except that it's terrible! I'm surprised that anyone in their right mind would watch this kind of "entertainment" any more. The acting was not funny or entertaining. This movie is the worst thing I've seen in my life. It's so bad you won't even believe what's in it.

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I'm Dancing'... i didn't know a thing about it, so had no preconceptions before i went in.The film is about two guys who are confined to their wheel chairs, and live in a home. Michael (Steven Robertson) suffers from Cerabal Palsy and Rory (James McAvoy) suffers from Muscular Dystrophy (please excuse any spelling mistakes!). They form a bond, as Rory seems to be the only person who can understand what Michael is saying.

I thought it was brilliant ! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down . Dwight Yoakam did a good job in his performance, but we didn't get to see all of the characters. We were treated to less than three hours of the film, and I would like to know how much screen time went into each character. If you're planning to do a road trip from San Diego to New York City, you might want to put this film on the list of movies you plan to skip!

Years ago I read the book ' A Máquina ' ( The machine ) . As I re-read this little book over the years, many interesting things have come about. I must say that the book has a good ending but it has so many problems that it is not believable. I don't know if you can blame me for being disappointed, but i had just gotten a chance to see the movie in theatres. I was expecting a good movie, but it turned out rather poorly. It is hard to explain how bad it is.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love , passion , and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss in the process. It's impossible to fully comprehend the depth of grief after losing your brother and, even worse, is it possible to reconcile your desire to protect him from harm?is a compelling look at human nature in the face of tragic loss.It's hard to imagine that you'd ever truly be so torn between such a profound sense of attachment to a loved one and the overwhelming need to protect him. And yet, I'm actually quite interested in seeing how the film deals with these difficult subjects.

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good . And of course by that I mean Wilkinson. He plays a "good guy", but not one of the hero types, so he does not come off as too good. I just finished this DVD and it's awful. Not to say that it's bad, I'm sure most people who have seen it would be able to spot a few good moments. But there seems to be no direction in the film, or an intent to get the audience involved.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink in 1956 Lubbock, Texas. As the credits start, the camera moves down from the moon to the parking lot, into the roller rink, past the concessions and across the rink to a small bandstand where a small band is doing their sound check. It's a tracking shot Welles and Scorcese would both appreciate. It cuts to Buddy Holly's bespectacled face peering down in rapt concentration as he grips the headphones and talks to a man putting this band on the radio.

This movie, based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt, is one of the best films I've seen on race relations in South Africa; a very good history lesson of the turmoil of 80's South Africa. I put it in on the scale of American History X as far as it's depiction of how a young man can get seduced by the Aryan doctrine and how the "certain" segments of the Christian church taught a false doctrine regarding race to justify an injustice.It's strong message of forgiveness and redemption, is one of rarity in films today.

This film is an impressionistic , poetic take on the immigrant experience , a reflective look at the turmoil and suffering that has been inflicted on the American psyche since the end of WW2.It's not perfect, it does fall short of the high standards set by most films of its time but still remains entertaining to this day. I have no idea why anyone would think otherwise. I just watched this movie today. The plot was awful. It felt like the writer or producers had already read the script in advance and decided what they wanted to say before they ever showed it.The characters were dull, one of them especially so.

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters in the late 1950s under the title "The Chaplin Review".This was an odd film in some ways because later in life, Chaplin was anti-war and his movies stressed peace and brotherhood. This film, in contrast, is a propaganda comedy meant to bolster the US efforts in WWI. It's truly odd to see Charlie as the "super soldier" who single-handedly captures 13 Germans, casually and coolly shoots several Germans in mere seconds as a marksman and then goes behind enemy lines to try to capture the Kaiser himself!

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground, and in particular the "flowering" of one of them. An embittered, "Spike"-type youth (McAvoy) with Deuchennes MD is placed in a home for the disabled and quickly makes friends with a youth (Robertson) with cerebral palsy. Robertson has never known anything outside of the home, but McAvoy has and he is bound and determined to get back into the real world. Together, they manage to do just that in this funny and heartwarming and often heartbreaking tale of inner strength overcoming physical shortcomings.

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one ! I watched it with my daughter, who was in her 5th grade class. The only bad thing about this movie is the ending. We had no clue what was going on in the last 10 minutes. I felt sorry for the main character because she wasn't supposed to be there at all. Her name was Elisa, but we never learned her final name. There are so many missing people throughout the story that you can tell that someone was really missing.

"Back in the Day" is an interesting, but flawed effort. Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper, a honest but sad man trying to cope with the death of his father. He meets his old friend J-Bone (Ving Rhames) who tries to force Reggie into a life of crime. Reggie also falls in love with Alica (Tatyana Ali) who is the preacher's daughter. Now he has to choose: Love Or Crime.Ja Rule does a competent job as Reggie. At least he's trying to act. Ving Rhames is perfect as J-Bone.

`` Pearl Harbor , buddy . '' This movie is brilliant ! Sure it does n't exactly flow like an actual movie but its got to be the greatest thing ever put into one. I would give this movie 100 stars and i'd even consider making it into a full blown reality TV program. Just watch this movie you can't imagine how many scenes you missed out on. The fact that these scenes are actually in a movie is pure genius. I am a complete skeptic. I was skeptical because of all the reviews.

I love this movie a lot . I must get this on DVD . I have 2 VHS copies , and I really want to watch it again ! The only problem i have is that the music is very repetitive. There are some scenes where you can see the same music playing all the way through the whole movie, so it can't help but take up too much time. One thing that bugged me during my viewing of this was that the director did not talk at all during his interview. I think he could've been more involved in the film if he'd done so.

Some days ago, in Rome, a young Romanian man with criminal precedents assaulted and tortured to death a middle-age lady coming back home after an afternoon of shopping. A Romanian girl, who had seen everything, reported what happened.Therefore, it started a debate about the too much intense flow of immigrants from Romania, generalizing them as criminals, everyone, indiscriminately.I'm only 15, but I thought: what idea of affluence does Italy give to these poor people? How ever do they regard us as the Land of Plenty? Yesterday evening I finally saw NUOVOMONDO, and my question had an answer.

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title . The movie was cool , despite some poor acting . The story was bad , and I am sorry to say that they had to do this. But I like the "original" film and if they would have given me a few scenes from it i might have liked it more.The characters were not so great, and they are really annoying at times. This is one of those movies that will make you go out and buy a DVD set of your favorite movies just to watch them.

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history , someone had to be the realist. It was an incredibly entertaining film, however it was not as well thought out as others are making it out to be. At the time of this writing, the film has garnered 3.5 votes on Rotten Tomatoes. This means that approximately 4% of the critics who have seen this film have decided that it is one of those films that need to be given a 4 star rating just because it can be made funnier than the majority of movies.

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters under the title 'The Great Train Robbery'. One thing I found extremely odd about this movie is that on the DVD commentary, it claims to take place in New York. Why would they change the location so dramatically? And why not have some shots of the Statue of Liberty from the same time period? There's no explanation whatsoever as to why they switched Manhattan from New York to Detroit. It would have made a far more believable film.

As an English teacher, I appreciate films that do more than tell a story. Good films, like good literature, cause one to think, reflect and predict. This film made me do all three. Mr. Jansen takes risks and uses foreshadowing, symbolism and interesting turning points for many of his characters. I also likes the fact that despite the choices the characters make in the film, their choices do not seem as adolescent or felonious as other films I have seen. The acting is pretty good and the actors seem to share a good chemistry with each other.

I know this movie isn't for everyone, and I won't push my opinions on you, but what I have to say is the truth about how many people feel about this movie...It was the best I have ever seen!!! It was soooooooooooooooooo funny, and even though it wasn't the scariest movie I had ever seen, it kept me on the edge of my seat, because I didn't know what was gonna happen next. If you like funny scary movies, you have got to see this one!

Years ago when I first read John Irving 's The World According to Garp , I was astounded that most people could still believe that the Cold War was actually a war between superpowers. In fact, many in the press and some politicians still seem to think that this is at least part of the story. Even if you disagree with his conclusions or want him to be proven wrong, he has been right about many other topics as well.The world is a complicated place, and we are all going through our own trials and tribulations.

What a cast of actors and actresses in this Columbo episode , beside Peter Falk , you have Julie Newmar , Joanne Froggatt , David Hyde Pierce , Robert Wagner , Jane Russell , James Brolin, Christopher Plummer, Roger Moore , Donald Pleasance , Richard Dreyfuss , Jean Dujardin , Martin Sheen
The best part of this episode are the people who appear on the screen. I didn't think that anyone was going to want to see them all together but they sure did. They looked good in their clothes (I thought they were really cute) and acted well.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan, where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion. I really admired the story and visual approach. The action is frightening and the mood of loneliness that the film projects is amazing. There is much beauty in the melancholy that surrounds these three misfit heroes. Not just in the desert but in the city too. My best scene was after the boy discovers his friends in the apartment and then rides his skateboard through all the remarkable lights of the city. You really feel for this guy.

My friends and went through a period of time when we would rent movies that none of us had ever seen before and just try to figure out what the story was about. We even thought it was some kind of sci-fi satire! It ended up getting really stupid. The movie was like watching two guys go at each other in a boxing ring. I mean, seriously. This is probably the worst movie I have ever seen in my life. I didn't come here looking for "the best" movie this world has to offer, but I can say with confidence that this movie is not even good.
