This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house . The film was shot in a single day , and there are some really nice camera moves. It may be possible for me to give it 3 stars, because it has potential, but still, this movie has no real story. It could be interesting to see what happens when humans become sentient (if you're going to put human beings in robots, you would think it'd be at least a bit interesting to see if they got along well), but otherwise, nothing special.

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons , and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out . I must say, I do not like how it has been handled over the years by Fox... It was a great comedy series for a long time, but now we are being treated to a lot of trashy garbage. For anyone who loves the original "The Simpsons" series, this film is very well worth your time. For some reason, I've never gotten the slightest sense that it was made by anybody other than the original show's creator, Dan Greaney.

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people would n't like it . Not me. It had a good plot and interesting characters. However the only thing that kept my interest was the female lead. I didn't go to this movie as a fan of science fiction. I just found myself drawn to it in general. After reading the reviews, I thought "this will be fun". Unfortunately, I wasn't prepared to sit through such an overlong film.There was no tension at all. The writing was incoherent. The dialogue was not funny.

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not: intelligence and good messages. Accepted, is the story of a kid named Bartleby (Justin Long) who gets rejected by every college he applies to. His parents are incredibly strict, frustrated and disappointed. So, Bartleby and a few other students who face similar problems start a fake college, to pawn themselves off to their parents as college kids. Not everything goes to plan, and the movie is about them winging it. But behind this plot which sounds ridiculous, there are good messages, morals and a new outlook on the American educational system.

I was 19 or 20 , years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City , Utah and saw a movie called 'Viva La Bam' on MTV. I was really disappointed that this movie failed to bring about any excitement for me. I wasn't too enthused watching this movie because of how it seemed to try its hardest to be interesting, even if it did have a very basic plot and was very predictable from what I could tell from the previews. After watching this movie I went to my local video rental shop and picked it up .

Easily Lucio Fulci's most respected film, "Don't Torture a Duckling" is highly renowned for it's edgy subject matter, gruesome imagery, and strong storyline. Terror befalls a small Italian village as young boys begin turning up murdered, engulfing the confused and determined authorities plus a dedicated detective in mystery. Was it the creepy hermit? The spastic voodoo witch? One of the hookers? The rich girl? Someone else? Contrary to most fan's frequent representation on the film's violent content - I consider it much more plot driven; featuring only one real moment of memorable bloodshed (involving chains and boards).

I think this show was right on the money for me . I watched it over the plane but there is not a good story to be found. I do not understand why people give it a 5-star rating unless of course they are too young to get it or have no clue about the meaning and value of films. Most people just sit there and wait for the plot to unfold and that never happens. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because there was at least one decent bit of humor. You know the type.

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it . That would be fine if the acting was decent, as most of it is , but not for this film. It has no charm and no heart. I have seen so many positive reviews about this film that I took a risk and watched it hoping for the best. The movie starts off pretty good with an interesting plot, characters, set-up, etc...but then it slowly turns into a mess. Every single action character seems to have some sort of hidden flaw that will eventually lead to him getting in over his head.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously , its primarily directed in a way that makes it entertaining, which is an impressive feat. For the first half of the movie, we follow the exploits of a British officer who travels abroad to investigate a strange series of attacks by aliens. After he learns more about their origins he goes off to save the world.I found the plot interesting enough, though it did feel a little contrived. That's all I'll say for it.

I thought Besson's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them; Capture true human emotions. The main character's struggles, triumphs, set backs, hopes and desires are all so honestly shown that you wonder if he is acting at all. The film has a low budget and is obviously made without the glitz and glamour afforded to most Hollywood productions but that minimalism is what allows this film to transcend the stereotypical Sci-Fi labeling and become a true drama. However calling this film solely a drama would take away from the fantastic post-apocalyptic plot.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon. I loved the film so much as well as the songs that I went several times to the cinema to see it again and again. My mother bought the LP and I learnt the songs off by heart, just as I did with "The sound of Music" (which people hardly know in Austria). I think the problem with some of these self-appointed critics who's comments get published is that they don't have a romantic soul and didn't see the film through the eyes of a young teenager.

Being American, I have not been exposed to this character before, which is good because some of you have been disappointed. I have nothing to compare it to. I have found no enjoyment in the mindless idiot humor in the American teen movies, and although this is a slightly similar type of humor, I couldn't stop laughing. I hardly ever laugh out loud at a movie. And usually a movie has a few funny parts for me, but this movie was funny from start to finish. My only disappointment was when it was over.

Separate LIES changed my life. Actually, the Q&A did.SPOILERS BELOW. Read only if you watch trailers or if you've already seen it:The Emily Watson character cheats on the Tom Wilkonson character. My first reaction to the puppy-dog-eyed Emily was "It's Over. Dump her. Bad riddance." For some reason, he stuck around. Not in a pathetic way. He just listened. And tried to accept her needs. At times he needed to leave. But he stuck by her and let her live her life.

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen. Clearly not that many because it only got a 6.8. There is nothing wrong with it at all. It's my favorite of the Disney classics, which have tons of fantastic films already made. Like Beauty and the Beast, Snow White, and Peter Pan. The reason why The Aristorcats is so high on my list is because of how funny the film is. I hate to say this, but I don't blame Edgar for what he does. I probably would've had them taken care of too.

I am a guy, so i was very hesitant to watch the movie because i know that Richard Gear likes to be in tear jerker movies. I would rather watch action/adventure/sci fi. I was right, the movie is definitely a tear jerker. Diane tended to over act a few times, as did richard, but they brought it around and made it work. The daughter was a suppressed teen with huge attitude, so you started out hating her. The movie is way too predictable, but for entertainment purposes, it was a masterpiece.

Another enjoyable Warner flick. I really liked John Garfield in this, though I'm wondering why Cagney wasn't in the role. Perhaps it was too similar to ANGELS WITH DIRTY FACES? I mean, it's another Dead End Kids story of sorts too, but I really appreciated them here and this film had a lot of nice comical touches along with some good serious drama. The boys work great with Garfield. A nice sequence was the whole "swimming" scene which starts out with no cares but winds up coming too close to disaster.One negative comment: Claude Rains was grossly miscast.

I Loved this movie . Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role . More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade in to this form . Don't get me wrong there are plenty of good Sci-Fi movies out there I just wish they were remade . I can't believe how well this movie has held on to the audience's attention for three hours. There is a reason this movie is one of the "Most Wanted" on IMDb! What an interesting way to make money, even though the plot lines are pretty lame and uninteresting at times.

This film, like much of their music, is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer. It is terrific and, in many ways, ahead of its time.The images are funny, disturbing, and at the very least, engaging. The music is amazing. This is not the "candy pop" sound they are unfortunately associated with. This is the sound of a band in exploration and revolt.HEAD, alone, should put The Monkees into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Can anyone tell me why these guys are not in there?

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war . The rain and the dust on the floor give Chaplin a sense of hopelessness that he seems to have. WTF?! What is wrong with this film?? I don't get it!! It is as if they tried so hard to be funny but it all goes down the drain after a certain point.The acting is horrible. The script is terrible. You can't really make up your mind about who the main characters are from one second to the next (they are all dead by then).

"Blind Spot" one of my festival favorites. I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers searching for a mysterious man who has loved and betrayed each of them in different ways. The cast is great. James Franco is particularly amazing as the broken-hearted boy from Los Angeles. His journal entries, which we hear in voice-over-narration, work well with the visuals and are quite intense. The film has a powerful style. It pushes elements like the road movie and revenge-drama in new directions. It also plays with time and perspective in ways that capture the frightening ambiance of lost love.

A Formula For Murder isn't a well known Giallo, but that isn't to say it's not a very good one! The film is directed by Alberto De Martino, the man behind cult classics such as The Antichrist and Blazing Magnums. The film was released late on in the Giallo cycle, but more than stands up to many of the films released around the 'golden' period in the early seventies. Despite a lack of logic in some areas, the film works mainly due to the competent way it mixes Argento style death scenes with some genuinely surprising plot twists, and a host of well defined characters.

I thought this movie was pretty good ! OK , so maybe it had a few scenes that could make the film better , but on the whole, it is ok . This movie is bad. I think the director tried to do a good story, but just couldn't finish it. The actors are all very flat. They didn't have chemistry together and they were all very tired when they appeared in this movie. You can tell that the writer made this movie to be a horror movie, which I understand, but it doesn't work at all.

This version of `` The Lost Horizon '' is actually not a bad film at all . I think the whole plot was a bit silly to begin with (but then, you can never really tell what was and what wasn't in a sci-fi flick). Well, there are a few good scenes in this film, but for the most part, it fails to add anything to the rest of the franchise. You will still remember the events of the previous movie , but if you watch this one, it's probably not going to come as a surprise.

I never thought I 'd say this about a biopic , but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (even by the standards of Hollywood films from the 1970's) that can't be denied. One character in particular stands out to me as a very flawed and interesting human being. This character is played by Robert Redford . There are some good things in this movie but there are also some bad ones too.The characters, if you're not familiar with them, are all flawed, but none of them are perfect.

Between sweeping, extraordinary scenes within a plethora of Indian locations and a plot which is Bollywood inspired yet grounded in reality, this highly moving film is a must-see for those who love a good romance/adventure. And by this, I mean "good", not a Hollywood or Bollywood easy and contrived happy ending. East meets West in a different take on the buddy film. The performances are inspired and brilliant, the cinematography epic and the plot entertaining, engaging and poignant without a trace of schmaltz or cheap tugging at heartstrings. HARI OM is a sweet film that won't rot your teeth.

( Synopsis ) Graduating high school senior Bartleby `` B '' Gaines ( Justin Long ) finds himself without a home after the death of his mother, who was forced to move out of her apartment in order for Bartleby to be able to stay at her side. This film is so terrible that I almost gave it away on DVD when I saw it at my local Blockbuster with an R-rating. When I came to review it I found that there was a warning on the front of the video that if you watch it even one more time it will get your family killed.

Oh my word ! ! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or human interest whatsoever. In fact, I am surprised to find out that there is still a market for this filth on Youtube! It makes me think of all those horror movies I saw back in the 1980s where the only good thing to say about a movie was its "spooky" feeling (that's the closest I can get to the term in this case!). What a waste of one of cinema's biggest and most iconic names.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously, its primarily directed to fans of the series who are looking for a quick fix. Bronson (Paul Kersey)once again takes to the streets (given a license to kill by the chief police no less) and moves into his friends apartment (who you guessed it) was killed by a street gang that has taken control of the neighborhood (which looks like Beruit). It's funny that people who associate with Bronson have a habit of getting killed.

Really, This movie should be released to DVD. I just got a bootleg copy of what I think was a studio film and I was utterly pleased!!! It was on my list of films to own simply because of the cast. Three of my PEOPLE, Michael York, Olivia Hussey. Both having been in Romeo & Juliet, and also John Gielghud. sorry about the bad spelling, were in there so on that alone I thought that for the small amount I was spending it would be fine. Boy was I right.

Better than it has any right to be , this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office. The only saving grace in my opinion is that most of us are old enough to remember the original . It is hard to think that someone would go out and make another one of these cheap rip-offs but I am sure there is still some money to be made! This movie should have gone over better, it could have turned into something good.The story line is very generic and the acting was poor.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of `` L'Anticristo '' ( 1974 ) , this one begins with a man who is murdered and then finds out what really happened that led to his murder. His wife is trying to solve the case but is in fact involved in it herself. There is a great deal of hype around this film, and while it may be the best horror film of the decade, it certainly has a few problems. The plot is confusing and the story seems to be all over the map. I can't recall ever having seen any of the movie before I watched it.

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies . Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 6 is a pretty bad movie in comparison. It might be the worst movie ever. Death Wish 2 is so disappointing because I loved it and now I wonder what happened to make it such a disappointment. Why did there have to be so many plot threads and not enough time spent on the characters? All I can think of is that the producers got tired of making movies with lots of plots but little time to spend on the characters and they decided to make two very different movies.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie . It follows all the usual plot lines and characters as well as providing plenty of funny dialogue to help make it funnier than it could have been. When I saw this movie at a theater, I was impressed. The opening credits (which were so beautiful) really set the stage for what was to happen later in the film. Unfortunately, this movie is one of the very few that I can think of that does not live up to these expectations.

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in the days of apartheid. It shows how this hate was contrived and was groomed from generation to generation. Jan Ellis was taught that a black man was a plague. He was raised to be that way. Then he meets a man who is on the opposite side of his beliefs, Pastor Lekota. will he change his ways?. The film is a powerful movie that shows the perceptions the different races had for one another, it shows these perceptions with quite a lot of accuracy.

As with so many modern US films, there has to be a supernatural element to the plot, but if you just let that go, this is a tale with heaps of charm and a kindly heart cased in a crab shell.We are presented with a scene of a town in an economically depressed area struggling to find anything to be happy about. Beau Bridges' character is really up against it with a family on the increase, a nil bank balance and a brother-in-law who's sold out to a big business chain which he secretly hates, but in which he is willing to rub Beau's nose.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME . In fact, it was so good that it earned a nomination for best picture. The movie tells the story of a bunch of kids who crash into the Bermuda Triangle only to find themselves being hunted by the inhabitants of this mysterious island. As I watched it, my head started to spin with all kinds of weird ideas. I got this as a gift in the late 90's. It has been a part of my TV library ever since.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard ( Beau Travail ) , Golden Door is a visually striking tone-poem that deserves its reputation as one of the best film noir pictures of all time. There is a sense of tension and confusion in every scene, but it also feels lighthearted and easygoing. If you're looking for a true crime masterpiece, with a truly original twist, this movie may not be it. I'm going to try to be fair and objective here, since there have been plenty of great true crime movies.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen : much better and deeper than Luhrman's version. And this film is a masterpiece of cinema, not only on the artistic level, but also on the quality of acting, direction and cinematography. This is truly one of those rare moments when the director himself has an impact upon the viewer. This film will make you want to drink more water in your stomach. If you've tried any of the snowqueens, you know they are great actresses!

i did not read the book . nor do i care to . the movie was a beautiful romance , but it failed at making us want to go to see it . I had no interest in watching this. I didn't even know there was such an option. My boyfriend and I rented it because we thought it would be fun to have a laugh with our friends on the couch together.We weren't disappointed. For one thing, I could not get the joke out of my head. There were so many times I wanted to throw up.

We loved this movie because it was so entertaining and off beat-- Not your usual Hollywood drivel.My husband had a Blockbuster coupon and passed on a string of new releases of violent Hollywood stuff. He was about to walk out when he saw this and decided to take a chance. There was only one copy -- and with some glitches in the DVD that we finally had to flip to wide screen version and then back to the full screen version to make it stop stalling. But it was worth it. Cathy Bates is so good and she was so perfect for the role.

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage's better films. He turns a fine performance as the title character. This is a romance set against the backdrop of a worn torn island. John Hurt's character gives his daughter, played beautifully by Penelope Cruz, some honest advice about love. This movie doesn't have the fault of being completely predictable. This movie also allows Cruz to turn in a performance as a strong woman who knows her own mind and heart. Once the film warms up beyond the opening sequence this film keep you focused on it.

I will admit, I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film, and after about 5 - 10 minutes into it, I felt like many did. I was expecting a Monkey movie that was similar to the television show, but instead I was given... well, I didn't know what I was given to be honest.However, after finally watching this film, I realized that not only had I had a closed mind to the brilliance it depicts, I also found myself watching it over and over again.

Duchess and her three kittens are enjoying the high life with their devoted human mistress until the wicked butler Edgar shows up out of nowhere and takes them all down. The Princess Bride (1982) has been on my watch-list for a while now, and I had to see it first hand. I was quite interested in seeing how the story would end.I was surprised when I saw how long it was. When I was younger, movies were short films, usually less than 20 minutes. In this film, you get 2 hours and 45 minutes.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 `` They Made Me a Criminal . '' He was not the only star who didn't shine in this classic comedy, with Paul Newman, Jane Curtin, Robert Vaughn, Walter Matthau, Mandy Patinkin, and Gene Hackman also doing their thing. I don't know how you can even begin to put into words how badly this movie did. I first heard of this movie on the radio. I thought it was just a joke. Then when I saw it on the screen I laughed.

This is one of the finest TV movies you could ever see . The acting , writing and production values are absolutely superb. This is a brilliant piece of British filmmaking and I have seen much, much better. For those who are familiar with this film, you may think that there might be some issues with plot, character and pacing. However, it is so incredibly well made, I found myself unable to take my eyes off it for hours.The story starts out innocently enough. A young man goes on an adventure across Europe in search of his missing wife.

Enchanting . The best time to see this movie is sometime when unhappy or sad . It 's all just a waste of time . This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I bought it from the DVD shop but it didn't play in my home computer and I couldn't find what it was. When I went to look at the internet I found something about it and it had been made by an Italian company called Mondo. Anyway, I can't get over how bad this film was. There were so many scenes where the characters looked as if they had not slept for days.

I saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it. Since then I've searched for a video but never found it until now, 33 years later, when I ordered it from Moviehunter. Sorry to say it doesn't hold up. This glamourized version just can't rise up to the 1937 production level. I love Burt Bacharach's musical score, that is if listend to by itself, and I even bought a CD of it, but for my taste it doesn't lend itself well to this mysterious and compelling story. Just doesn't fit.

Then again , I like Rachael Ray . She is fun , sweet , fresh , and such a joy to watch on stage. That is all you get out of this "movie." I saw this film in the theater and, while enjoying it, thought that there had to be something really wrong with my brain chemistry. It was just plain wrong. First of all, the actors are horrible. They don't even bother to look like real actors. The acting is so weak that they have to use props for their lines.

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance, a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - and beautiful scenery. Nicholas Cage never fails us, and here again does a great job. And so do the other principle characters. One key charater, the physician/father played by John Hurd, delivers (to his daughter) one of the best definitions of love I've ever heard. Some of the events are a bit too coincidental to be real, but I excused that, knowing that this is partly fairy tale and fantacy. My wife and I really liked the film.

My favorite show of all time ! Yeah , I thought this was so cool , and Larisa Oleynik was really sweet in her performance, but unfortunately the plot is just a load of b-s
Why did they make this such a crappy movie? It's one of the most boring films ever made. I mean, it has some good scenes at the beginning but there's not much to do. There's no story, no character development and the only reason why I like it is because it gave me a bad case of the popcorn syndrome.

This is my favourite Columbo . Martin Landau ( excellent ! ) plays twins , one of whom may have to be taken out. The other has a past history of stealing from bank accounts. Why did I keep watching this movie and not come across something better? I don't know. It wasn't too long ago that I was going through a phase of watching all the best Sci-Fi movies, especially the ones with Tom Cruise in them. After seeing "The Bourne Identity", I was thinking, "Well, how bad can it be? ".

I really enjoyed this film, it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. It was very well directed. I think it was important that they showed the other couple's life as well as Terry and Bobbys and show them as people with emotions. As this film needed to show Bobby as a cold and vindictive person.I agree with another review it was sick love, not true love. He didn't need to go to great lengths as murder to give his wife a baby. He should have been honest with her and told her that he was sterile and decide to adopt a baby together.

This is a 100 % improvement over the dross of a third movie and it 's one hell of a sequel. This time around, we're not just following our intrepid detective (Ben Foster), but we're also following his wife (Gloria Reuben) as she takes to the streets looking for him. I've never really been much of a fan of Ben Foster films. Not because I don't love him as a performer, but because there were always some parts that I thought he failed to deliver.

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something `` not human '' is portraying human beings and their activities, and it makes for an entertaining watch. Unfortunately, the film I saw on this particular night was not one of them. The movie had some plot points that could have been interesting in theory, but in the execution they were just completely out-of-the-ordinary, with no relevance to anything the characters actually did. First of all, despite what the filmmakers tried to tell us, we didn't really know who these two guys were.

Documentaries in which sons and daughters seek to understand a parent and, by the process, their own lives are not that uncommon. Also not uncommon are results that reflect lack of talent, a failure of introspection, an abundance of narcissism and, perhaps, an unsubtle quest for publicly-splashed revenge for countless past hurts, real and fantasized. What is unusual is a brilliant, fair and engrossing portrait of a fascinating parent and "My Architect: A Son's Journey" is that rare achievement.Louis Kahn emigrated to this country as a child, his face irreparably and brutally scarred by an accident.

Containing Billy's famous humor, this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure, pleasantly unexpectedly so for Billy Crystal. This movie has different tear-jerker, dramatic, serious underlying themes (particularly with a scene with Steven Seagal). This movie was both entertaining and serious, a movie about lost love, about relationships with father-son, husband-wife, about friendship and values with a good dose of humor thrown in, especially at the beginning. The balance between drama and comedy isn't always maintained as with the new classical genre of this type, but the real message and motivation for this movie remains solid.

Another go round with the monkey king going west .... sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie jumps around a lot.The plot is fairly well set out, and while it did get a little boring after an hour or so, there's enough excitement to keep things interesting (which is all that matters).The characters are pretty good - I actually liked most of them. As a huge fan of Stephen King, it was disappointing to find myself disappointed when he decided to use one of his favorite characters as the antagonist.

I'm not going to go into too much depth, but Showtime was a pretty funny movie. There wasn't any slapping-your-knee funny scenes (that I can remember), but it had it's moments. The cast is pretty good, Robert De Niro is good as usual and Eddie Murphy pulls off a pretty funny performance. Rene Russo was just fine in the film, no complaints there. There were two characters in the story that I liked that they didn't explain much at all. The first one was Trey Sellars' (Eddie Murphy's) buddy at the gym played by Ken Campbell.

Years ago I read the book 'A Máquina' (The machine). As I re-read this little book again and again, I could never stop getting more and more fascinated by the imagination of the writer and the richness of the Brazilian culture.When I knew about the movie, I was really scared that someone would spoil one of my favorites books! Well, happily, my fears were unjustified and the movie is such a wonderful and delicate piece of art.I can't recall of any other movie that could bring tears to my eyes due to the very beauty of the text.

I absolutely adore this movie ! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store. I got it and was blown away. It has some of the best scenes in all the Star Wars movies, and is the best Star Wars movie to have ever been made by Lucasfilm. Well, how can I say good things about a movie if I don't have enough positive stuff to go on with? After watching this one, I came to that same conclusion: This is a movie which should NEVER be allowed to be seen by any person over the age of 18.

No real plot, no character development, no Scorcese-level direction, but seriously, were you really expecting any of this? The only thing that matters is that this flick is absolutely hilarious, nearly on the same level as Borat. Sure, the ending drags a bit, but if Borat's cameo didn't crack you up, you must be the worst batty boy in the history of batty boys. Sacha Baron Cohen is possibly the greatest comedian ALIVE, and here he gets more laughs than Jude Law on a nude beach.

This new installment to the Child's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as a stoner witnessing Chucky giveing him the finger and saying "rude f--king doll" and lots of references to the series: "you can kill me but I'll come back. I always come back". The movie's title was probably thought of before the script and was written around it. This is totally different from all other films in the series. It doesn't even have Andy, the central character for all the previous ones.

As an English teacher , I appreciate films that do more than tell a story . Good films , like "A Few Good Men," make you feel. This one does not.I wish I could take away one thing from this film, because I don't see how it deserves the negative reviews. It's all too easy to read into these reviews, and I think that's a shame. A few words of wisdom: 1. There are many better films out there! 2. If you can find them, watch them. 3. Never judge a film by its cover.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments I have seen on film.The cast of characters are good but there is not enough depth to really feel like you're watching someone's life. I recently watched 'Deepwater Horizon'. It was a must see; I saw it again just to confirm that I had made the correct choice. The production values, editing, story, acting, direction were all superb. I thought I could trust my eyes, but they weren't too reliable.I found myself agreeing with every single aspect of each and every character.

Wow , What a wonderful film-making ! Mr. Im has done it , again ! His last work , ChunHayang was a bit too slow to catch the imagination and i found many scenes where i wanted to see more action but it took too long to see what was happening. There are no bad moments in this film , just a lot of things that were done right . You could say that this might be a good movie for a couple of friends or an evening with a friend/ sibling but if you want to watch something longer than 20 minutes , this isn't it .

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the supporting roles to the foursome of lies and intrigue. Yet at the heart of it all, each character maintains a streak of decency - moral conscience held up in spite of obvious contradictions. "Contradictions are the source of all movement and of all life." How true these words are. Watson's Anne Manning is at the core of this intrigue - she's the central conscience that the other three latched on. She is the decency undeterred.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of India. When was the last time you could say you really enjoyed a movie? This movie has pace and keeps us moving in directions that may only exist in India. If you didn't want to visit India before this movie will surely make you want to visit it now. This movie has dancing girls, a chase scene, and the mafioso involved. But it has a lot more. Thanks, Bharatbala, for taking us on such a spirited and wonderful tale.

An interesting look at the immigrant experience , told as a fable with some very weird imagery.I got drawn to this film during my time in Ireland. I spent a few weeks there in the 80's and even went on a couple of summer holidays there. My wife and I would always end up at the local cinema for the family-friendly movies. Very bad, but I do not think it can be described as anything else than an absolute disaster. It starts off fine enough, with the main character (Jack) traveling to the U.S.A. from Mexico.

I've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months (maybe longer but not much). I was very infatuated with Olivia and I found Kevin to be very witty and the repertoire between them very good. Lately though it's starting to wear thin due to many factors for me. First my favorite segment is the first 15 minutes called Around The Net, that shows 5 video clips that you would find on a site like Youtube, that are generally funny, or of people getting hurt inadvertently (some intentionally).

I can't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I've described that scene to folks not familiar with this film. I saw it the year it was released, I was 19. I don't think there were a dozen people in that East Village theater that night. For years I thought we were the only ones who saw it. Nice to see here that others found it as hysterical as I had, and see it's lasting value despite the time gone by. Rent it, buy it or steal it.... a must see.

Hey all you jive hustlers , you stone foxes , you mean dudes . Watch out cause Slaughter is back in town and he has his hands on some girls . I bought a DVD from Amazon for $3.00 after reading the reviews of people who watched it and liked it, so I had to get it. The first half of the film was interesting. It looked like a decent thriller but then the second half went downhill from there. I've seen too much gore films to have any interest in what happens to these two main characters.

Exclusively for Coop's lovers, though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this very good documentary film. It is a biography of Gary Cooper, based mainly on his filmography, but also on more private archives, which show him as a child, as a young man, as a family man, with some of his friends (Picasso, Hemingway, etc. ), as an older man, finally as a sick and close-to-death man. After "the end", I did not have the feeling that I knew the man any much better.

Loved today's show!!! It was a variety and not solely cooking (which would have been great too). Very stimulating and captivating, always keeping the viewer peeking around the corner to see what was coming up next. She is as down to earth and as personable as you get, like one of us which made the show all the more enjoyable. Special guests, who are friends as well made for a nice surprise too. Loved the 'first' theme and that the audience was invited to play along too.

At first I did n't think I would like this movie , but as it progressed it became better and better , the plot was really good and I enjoyed the acting . This movie could be a great film if not for the horrible acting and script. If you're an action movie fan, or a fan of kung fu films, this movie might be for you, but I don't think so. The characters were poorly written and they lacked any kind of humor.I found it difficult to relate to these characters because they had no real lives outside their roles.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but also humor and a few surprises. The film opens with the mother (Natalie Portman, who did not win the Oscar for her role) coming home to discover her husband (Michael Fassbender) being brutally raped by an unknown man (Ben Kingsley) while she is away at work. To make matters even more complicated, her son (Ricky Gervais) has been left in the care of his father (Paul Giamatti), who does not return his phone calls.

I wonder why I haven't heard of this movie before. It's truly a magnificent comedy (I'd say farce, but it's too well acted and I'd hate to denigrate it's quality). A comedic character study about the travails of mid-life crises, the inequity for gays who can't have their long-time unions recognized, and the general differences of people who can't fit nicely into society, that pairs Kathy Bates and Rupert Everett to a wonderful effect. Forget Julia Roberts and Rupert; Kathy Bates and Rupert should do another movie together.

I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series--my only detraction would be the somewhat jarring appearance of Mark Lenard as the Romulan Commander. My reasoning is this--if you were not around for the first run of this episode, then you know Mr. Lenard as Sarek, Spock's father. And for the 2nd generation Trekkie (or Trekker--your preference) it takes you out of the scene at first. Yet he's an excellent commander as well as opposite for our captain and this episode is strongly written and well-acted by all.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 "They Made Me a Criminal." Celebrating a ring victory in a jammed locker room, boxer Johnnie Bradfield emotes about his love of mom, rejection of booze and clean living style to fans, including cops, who eat it up. Later in the evening he's plowed and tussling with his bimbo gal while his manager, in on the con, shares the evening. And the whiskey.A problem develops when another couple arrives. The guy is a newspaper reporter and he says he'll expose Bradfield's phony life on the front page.

So it 's not an award winner , so what ? Have you ever wanted to see a film that will make you cry? You know the type I'm talking about. Well this one has done just that, and it's hard to find words to describe the level of emotions I experienced during its runtime. The acting was fantastic, but the worst part is that this movie is just too sad to be enjoyable. Some people have seen "The Notebook" already, so you can't go wrong if you want to see a more mature version of that story.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert . A brutal but beautiful journey that will be remembered as one of the most important movie of the 20th century. The only problem with it being a "horror" movie? It's not even really a horror film, because there is very little gore in it (aside from a bunch of corpses)
I had seen many horror films over the years, but I didn't really like any of them. In fact, I would probably say that some of these films were actually kind of boring.

`` Hari om '' is an Indian greeting and the compelling title character of the film bearing this same name. It is not clear at the time of writing this piece that it is a remake of any of the many earlier films featuring the same star. However, the similarities between the first three films are striking. If you have seen all of the previous movies in the series, please go and see this one. You will love it. First of all, I had expected a good old fashioned horror movie from this guy. And to be perfectly frank, I was wrong!

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries (Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island) that keeps many of the novel's characteristics. I think that greek sceneries add something special and magical to a movie. One thing i didn't like at all though, is that the main characters, like 'Mandras' and Pelagia's father weren't greek actors but foreigners. I mean the actors tried to express the greek way of living, but to me they didn't succeed and it was quite clear. Even their pronunciation when they were trying to use greek words was terrible and that was bad for the film's plot.

I've never seen the original "House Of Wax" so I really didn't know what to expect when I went to a sneak preview of the new film. After a somewhat wobbly start introducing our young characters, "House Of Wax" shifts gears and becomes an extremely effective horror outing.The plot really doesn't matter too much here - I think most people know upon seeing this that these stranded kids are going to meet up with a nasty killer and find some awful things in the titular house of wax. It's all about the special effects here, and they are top notch.

Yes , at times `` Unconditional Love '' overwhelms as it bounces -- no , as it ricochets -- from plot point to plot point. Even after a dozen or so such scenes, it never gets going. The scriptwriter could have done something like this much more interesting, even if the idea was not new. My wife gave me two copies of this DVD for my 50th birthday and I bought it for Christmas. I don't know what's wrong with me but I didn't want to watch it until I read the synopsis that accompanied it.

People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the way this movie turned out. Although it lacks in the big special effects department and there are no battles with hundreds of extras, there is still a masterful amalgamation of two old folk tales here. The acting talent, although not A-list, is still great and the interaction between the characters is perhaps more sincere than in a larger movie with an A-list cast. My particular favourite from this movie is Bridget Fonda, whose performance as the Snow Queen herself was quite moving, assisted enormously by a stupendous wardrobe and makeup.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS ... Hmm .... Only that this was one of those "what's it like" type of shows... which is quite a good description of the show! If you have been following the movie and book series, you must be able to tell by now that this is the weakest of the lot. If you've been reading the books or seen the video games, you'd know what I mean. The acting is all over the place. There is too much going on, and nothing feels right.

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918 , a doughboy who can not seem to get the job done. He is forced to live in an apartment with a wife and kids. I like Chaplin, but I had no interest in this film. I think it's more than obvious that the writer(s) of this were not very well versed in the finer points of making a comedy. I have never heard anybody say they are a comedian, unless they have taken classes or something. And even then only after they've had a couple glasses of wine.

In Nordestina, a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco, Antônio (Gustavo Falcão) is the youngest son of his mother, who had uninterruptedly cried for five years. When he is a young man, he falls in love for Karina (Mariana Ximenes), a seventeen years old teenager that dreams to see the world and becomes an actress. Antônio promises Karina to bring the world to Nordestina, and once in Rio de Janeiro, he participates of a sensationalist television show and promises to travel to the fifty years ahead in the future or die for love with a deadly machine he had invented.
